loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 48-year-old married woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children and her husband is a motorcycle mechanic by profession. He has been running a motorbike repair workshop in the market, where he performs his services. He has also spare parts in the workshop to use in repairs. 

Zahida's husband needs to purchase some equipment for his workshop. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the needed things. Therefore Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. This loan will help him to buy workshop items like tires, tubes, axles and brake shoes. 

Zahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy workshop items like tires, tubes, axles, and brake shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure, and leaf fertilizers, and to pay workers to clean and fertilize her property.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis tiene 35 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y solo tiene 2 hijos.
 

Luis se levanta a las 5:00 AM Junto a su esposa que le apoya en la actividades diarias que realizan mientras sus hijos van a la escuela, se dedica  a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres trabaja en la parcela que posee durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos; en la tarde se dedica a trabajar en otras parcelas para obtener un ingreso adicional para su familia. 

Él solicita este préstamo a CrediCampo para comprar los insumos que necesita para la siembra, semilla, abono, veneno, etc.

sus planes a futuro son que con los ingresos que obtiene de la siembra, poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis is 35 years old and attended school until ninth grade. He is married and they only have two children.

Luis wakes up at 5:00 am with his wife, who supports him by helping with daily tasks and his children attend school. He works in agriculture, which he learned from his parents. He works on his piece of land that he owns during the morning while his wife completes domestic tasks. In the afternoon, he works on other parcels of land to earn additional income for his family.

He requests a loan from CrediCampo to purchase the supplies that he needs for his crops, like seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, etc. 

His future plans are to provide a good education for his children with the income that he earns from his harvest.

loans.use: to purchase supplies that he needs for his crops, like seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “Amigas Unidas” esta conformada por 05  mujeres carismáticas y entusiastas, que en el transcurso del tiempo han ido mejorando sus negocios con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Rosa de 34 años es casada y tiene 02 hijos menores de edad. Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosmeticos hace mas de 02 años donde todo le va bien. Su mayor deseo es continuar creciendo el volumen de venta de sus productos. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de perfumes, colonias y talcos. El grupo “Amigas Unidas” agradecen el crédito brindado a los inversionistas Kiva. Rosa es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste chompa de color negro.
texts.en: This is the “Amigas Unidas” (United Friends) Group. It is made up of 5 charismatic and enthusiastic women who over time have been improving their businesses, with the goal of improving their families' quality of life. Rosa is 34 years old and married, with 2 underage children. Rosa has been selling beauty products and cosmetics for two years, and it is going well. Her greatest wish is to continue increasing the volume of her products. This is why she is requesting the loan: to buy perfumes, colognes, and powders. The “Amigas Unidas” group is thankful for the loans the Kiva investors have provided them. Rosa is the third from the left in the black sweater.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, colognes, and powders.

loans.name: Norma Francisca

texts.es: Norma tiene 41 años de edad y se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. Norma habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 10 años y 8 años de edad. Norma desea construir una fosa de absorción para el tratamiento de las aguas grises por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra del material necesario como arena, ladrillo, grava, cemento, etc. para la construcción de la fosa.
texts.en:
Norma is 41 years old and has for a long time made a living delivering domestic services. Norma lives in her own house together with her husband and their two children of 10 and 8 years old. 

Norma wants to construct an absorption pit for the treatment of grey water for which she requests this loan of FUSAI, to invest in the purchase of the necessary materials like sand, bricks, gravel, cement, etc., for the construction of the pit.

loans.use: to buy sand, bricks, gravel, cement, etc. for the construction of an absorption pit.

loans.name: Alba Lucia

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Alba con su credikiva, mediante el cual compró maercancia variada, articulos y variedades en general. Su credikiva lo benefició pues fortaleció su capital de trabajo, ofreciendole una mayor liquidéz y un mejor surtido de mercancias. Sus ventas y utilidades han mejorado con esta inversión y así mismo sus ingresos familiares . Por eso dice a sus financiadores: "Dios los bendiga , sigan apoyandome para poder continuar mejorando mis ingresos familiares. " Enla actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual pueda  incrmentar los inventarios con una nueva compra de Cosméticos, articulos para el hogar y variedades. Así una vez mas su capital de trabajo, sus ventas y utilidades se incrmentarán, pues hay una clientela fija con potencial de acceder a variedades de productos para satisfacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Alba with her Kiva loan; with the loan she bought a variety of merchandise, items and a variety of goods in general. Her Kiva loan benefited her as it strengthened her working capital, offering greater liquidity and a better stock of merchandise. Her sales and profits have improved with this investment and thus her family's earnings. She therefore says to her lenders: "God bless you and keep supporting me so I can continue improving my family's income." 

Currently she is applying for a new Kiva loan, with which she will increase her inventory with a new purchase of cosmetics, home goods and a variety of items. In this way, her working capital, sales and profits will increase once again, as there is a fixed customer base with the potential to access a variety of products to satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, home goods and a variety of items

loans.name: Paz

texts.en: Paz is a businesswoman from Ozamiz City. She is 57 years old and never gets too tired to support her family. She became a member of PMPC to access financial assistance. She has applied for a loan for her retail business that sells various items. Paz wants to purchase kitchen- and plasticware to sell. She hopes to sustain her business to continually provide for her children's needs.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen- and plasticware to sell

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José de 57 años de edad estudió hasta 7º grado debido a la situacion economica que su familia pasaba, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen dos hijos, y por lo tanto solo dos personas dependen de él.

José actualmente trabaja en la agricultura y lo ha hecho desde niño, lo aprendió de su padre pues siempre anduvo con él.- Además tiene un camión con el cual hace viajes en su cantón y así obtiene un dinero extra.

Se traslada cerca de 1 ½ kilómetro para llegar a su parcela.

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para la siembra de maíz y compra de un terreno, él cuenta con un capital por lo que completará su presupuesto.

Los sueños de José son ver crecer a sus hijos, darles todo lo necesario a ellos y a su pareja, poder tener una mejor vivienda a la que hoy tiene y seguir trabajando hasta que Dios le preste vida.
texts.en:
José is 57 years old. He only studied until 7th grade because of his family's economic situation. He is married, and his wife is a homemaker. They have two children, and because of this, only two people depend on him.

José currently works in agriculture, which he has done since he was a child. He learned it from his father, since he always went out with him. In addition, José has a truck with which he makes trips to his canton to make extra money.

He travels approximately 1½ kilometers to get to his plot of land.

The loan will be used for planting corn and to buy land. José will have the money he needs to complete his budget.

José's dreams are to see his children grow up, to give them everything they need, to give his wife a better home than the one they have today, and to continue working as long as God allows.

loans.use: to plant corn and buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Чамшед позитивный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 39 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Чамшед имеет только среднее образование. И так сложилось, что он решил не работать в каком-либо учреждении, а заниматься своим бизнесом и самостоятельно зарабатывать на жизнь. Он занимается необыкновенным делом. Его бизнес это убой скота и продажа мяса. Этот бизнес он ведёт уже несколько лет и от этого получает хороший заработок.

Чамшед торгует говяжьим и бараньим мясом на базаре, для этого он арендует торговую мясную лавку. В продаже также имеются говяжий и бараний жир, а также он продаёт шерсть от убитого скота обработчикам кожи. Каждую неделю Чамшед покупает скот на убой и продает их мясо. У него уже есть свои постоянные клиенты, люди покупают для потребления, а также закупают мясо в столовые для приготовления пищи. Сейчас Чамщеду необходимо закупить несколько голов скота для убоя и дальнейшей продажи, поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Jamshed is a positive and hardworking 39 year-old man.  He is married and has three children. Jamshed only has secondary education, and it worked out that he decided not to work at some office, but rather to be involved in his own business and earn a living independently. He is involved in an extraordinary business. This business is livestock slaughter and meat sales. He has been running this business for several years and earns a good income from it.

Jamshed sells beef and lamb at a market and leases a butcher shop. He also sells beef and lamb fat, and also wool from the slaughtered livestock to leather processors. Jamshed buys livestock for slaughter every week and sells the meat. He already has regular clients - people buy meat for consumption and also for food preparation at cafes. Now Jamshed needs to buy several heads of livestock for slaughter and subsequent sale, and this is why he came to Arvand for a loan. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana, age 38, is a married woman. She is a hard-working and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Being a mother, she wants to provide better living conditions for her children. This is the reason she is doing extraordinary hard work to keep smiling at her children.

Rukhsana has been sewing clothes for several years, since she observed that her son cannot provide all the necessities for her children. She decided to start tailoring work at home and now sews the clothes of people in her community. She knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors and relatives and local community persons. 

Rukhsana wants to enhance the beauty of her stitching, so she wants to buy a Juki sewing machine. Rukhsana has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet increasing demand. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages deSANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés..
La spéculation cultivée est mil et arachide  avec  MINATA , première personne assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, et à SANANKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 140.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Djantoyerela II are married women who average 26 years of age and 2 children each. All live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages in Sanankoroba, second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their third farming loan from the MFI, the previous ones have been repaid without problems.

They grow millet and peanuts, just like Minata, the woman on the right in the front row in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay plowing cost to maintain 1.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village, and in Sanankoroba, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers.

Minata intends to turn an average profit of XOF 140'000 per planting. This profit will enable her to repay her loan, and to help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay plowing cost

loans.name: Djantoyerela Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le gombo et mil  avec  SAFIATOU , première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SANANKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Djantoyerela III are married women who average 38 years of age and 4 children each. All live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages in Sanankoroba, second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their third farming loan from the MFI, the previous ones have been repaid without problems.

They grow okra and millet, just like Safiatou, the woman on the left in the standing row in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay plowing cost to maintain one hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village, and in Sanankoroba, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers.

Safiatou intends to turn an average profit of XOF 95'000 per planting. This profit will enable her to repay her loan, and to help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay plowing cost

loans.name: Zandrex

texts.en: Zandrex is 18 years of age and has this saying “never say die”. According to him that is his favorite saying because when he was at his secondary level he experienced going to school without allowance and his family struggled financially. There was a point when he was about to stop studying, but he strived to overcome that. Zandrex’s father is a farmer, while his mother is a housewife. Having a college diploma or even vocational course is very important to Zandrex for he knows that through that he can have a better job and earn a better income to support his family. With that he wants to avail of a Php40, 000 loan from KIVA lenders through ASKI for his tuition fee when he takes up the Microfinance Technology Course. Zandrex hopes that lenders will approve his requested loan.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fee

location.town: VILLA JOSON, SAN JOSE CITY, NUEVA ECIJA

loans.name: Nelly Odila

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 26 años de edad es soltera tiene 2 hijos vive con los hijos en San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar.

Pertenece a la venatnilla Santiagueña esta ubicada en la Parroquia Santiago pertenece al Canton San Miguel A 15 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel en esta ventanilla tiene 12 miembros que se dedican a actividades agricolas como simbre de maiz, frejol  y papas, ademas de esto se dedican a la crianza de animales como gallinas ponedoras y engorde de cerdos.

Nelly se dedica a la agricultura y a la siembra de arbeja, maiz, papas y habas, ademas a la crianza de chanchos, gallinas y vacas lecheras. Nesecita el credito para la compra de semillas fertilizantes abonos ademas balanceado de engorde y crianza para los animales.

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de San Miguel  y vende en la Feria en San Miguel. Ha enfrentado desafios como las plagas en el cultivo.

El sueño es mejorar los ingresos para comprar un vehiculo para el trabajo. Le gusta pasar con los hijos jugando las tardes despues de hacer las tareas.
texts.en:
Nelly is 26 years old, is single, and has two children.  She lives with her children in San Miguel in the province of Bolivar.  She belongs to the Santiagueña group that is located in the Santiago parish of the San Miguel canton, about 15 minutes away from the San Miguel office.  This group has 12 members who are dedicated to agricultural activities such as planting corn, beans and potatoes.  In addition to this, they also work raising animals like hens and fattening pigs.  

Nelly works in agriculture, planting peas, corn, potatoes and lima beans.  She also raises pigs, chickens and dairy cows.  She needs this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and manure, as well as balanced feed to fatten up and raise her animals.  She will make her purchases in the city of San Miguel, and she sells her produce in the San Miguel fair.  

She has faced many challenges such as pests in her crops.  Her biggest dream is to improve her income to be able to purchase a vehicle for work.  She enjoys spending time with her children, playing in the evenings after they do their homework.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, and balanced animal feed to fatten up and raise her animals.

loans.name: Ramata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce  groupe  créé le 04 Juillet  2008 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte en son sein des femmes qui habitent toutes dans le même village. Elles partagent des valeurs de solidarité et entre aide qui caractérisent leurs actions et relations entre membre. Le banc villageois est à son douzième cycle ce qui fait que les femmes jouissent d’une bonne expérience dans le petit commerce qui constitue leur activité  principale.

Madame Ramata  (en médaillon en haut et à droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 filles. Elle s'investi toujours dans la vente de légumes plus précisément la vente d’aubergine et de piment, activité qui lui respectivement rapporte après chaque tourné un bénéfice nette de 25 000  et 7 000 F CFA.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter auprès des producteurs exclusivement des aubergines pour une valeur de 185 000 F CFA pour la revente au marché international de la sous région.

 Les bénéfices lui servent d’une part à participer de manière significative aux dépenses quotidiennes de nourriture et scolaire pendant la période des études et d’autres part à accroître son épargner.
texts.en:
This group was established on July 4th, 2008, when the Banc Villageois was inaugurated. It is made up of women who all live in the same village. They share values of solidarity and mutual aid, which characterize their actions and the relationships between group members.

The Banc Villageois is starting its twelfth loan cycle, which means the women have a good experience in retail, their main business.

Mrs. Ramata (shown again in the inset on the top right of the photograph) is the group's featured borrower. She dedicates herself to selling vegetables, more precisely eggplants and chili pepper. After each round, these businesses generate a net profit of XOF 25'000 and 7'000, respectively.

With this new loan, she intends to buy XOF 185'000 worth of eggplants, exclusively from producers. She will resell them at the international market of her subregion.

She will use her profit in part to take a significant role in covering daily expenses (food and school supplies) during her children's studies, and in part to build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy eggplants

loans.name: Bundikahungu Kwehimukya Women Group

texts.en: Thomas is a thirty-eight-year-old businessman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has an additional income business from cocoa, in which he has been trading for ten years. He runs two businesses to get income for meeting his basic needs and educating his children to higher institutions. He hopes to expand his business to a busy marketing area and educate his children to university levels. He is affected by the seasonality factor in that when it's off season there is no money in circulation. Thomas needs the loan to buy sugar, soap, salt, rice and biscuits to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, salt, rice and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Fermín Adalberto

texts.es:
Fermin tiene 47 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a comprar cerdos y pollos de engorde tienen tres hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ellos por lo que son 3 personas que dependen de el.

Fermin actualmente se dedica a trabajar en la gricultura y lo ha hecho desde que era niño y lo aprendio de sus padres. Además él trabaja de albañil lo cual le genera un dinero extra, sus 2 hijos menores le ayudan a trabajar en la agricultura, se trasladan cerca de dos kilometros en bicicletas para llegar donde tienen su parcela.

El dinero del préstamo sera utilizado para invertir en la siembra de maiz ya que en estos dias es donde ellos empiezan a movilizarse para trabajar la temporada.

Los sueños de Fermin son darles el estudio necesario a sus hijos para que ellos puedan tener una mejor oportunidad de trabajo, tener una vivienda digna, sabe que sera un reto pero con la ayuda de Dios lo hará posible.
texts.en:
Fermin is 47 years old and has a sixth grade education. He is married and his wife earns her living buying pigs and chickens to fatten. They have three children; two of the children live with them, so Fermin has three people who depend on him.

Currently, Fermin earns his living in agriculture; he has done that since he was a boy and he learned it from his parents. In addition, he works in construction, which generates some extra money. His two younger children help him with the agricultural work. They travel close to two kilometers on bicycles to arrive at their parcel of land.

The money from the loan will be used to invest in planting corn, since this is the time when they begin to gear up to work the season.

Fermin's dreams are to give his children the education they need so that they can have better work opportunities and to have a decent house. He knows that it will be a challenge, but with God's help, he will make it possible.

loans.use: to invest in planting corn

loans.name: Shabnum's Group

texts.en:
Shabnum is 33 years old, a married woman and mother of four children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He drives an auto rickshaw by day and night. He has been continuously driving the rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. 

For this reason, Shabnum has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner brac Pakistan, for for the maintenance of rickshaw. Her husband wants to maintain the engine and body of rickshaw. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her family and will bring positive changes to his business.
Shabnum thanks to Kiva and field partner brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of maintenance of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es:
Rosa de 67 años de edad tuvo estudios universitarios y es enfermera jubilada, está soltera ya que se separó de su compañero de vida desde muy joven, tiene con 2 hijos de los cuales 1 vive con ella y el otro ya está casado.

Rosa actualmente es enfermera pensionada ya que cumplió con los años de trabajo que exige la ley, ella desde niña soñaba con ser enfermera y gracias a Dios y sus padres  lo pudo hacer posible, en estos momentos se dedica a las quehaceres del hogar,  y a cuidar algunos nietos.

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para pagar una deuda de un electrodoméstico que tiene en una comercial.


Los sueños de Rosa son ver realizados a sus 2 hijos, tener una vivienda mejor a la que tiene hoy, ver crecer a sus nietos  y poder ayudarle a que estudien, para que tengan una buena oportunidad de trabajo igual a la que ella tuvo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 67 years old.  She attended college and is now a retired nurse.  She is now single after having separated from her spouse at a young age.  She has two children of whom one lives with her, and the other is married.  Rosa is currently a pensioned nurse, having met the legally required years of work.  Since she was a young girl, she dreamed of being a nurse, and thanks to God and her parents, she was able to make that a reality.  She now devotes herself to housework and taking care of her grandchildren.

The money from the loan will be used to pay off a debt that she has in a store for a household appliance.  Rosa's dreams are to see her two children make it, have a better home than she does now, see her grandchildren grow and be able to help them attend school so that they can have the opportunity to work as she did.

loans.use: pay the debt that she has in a store for an household appliance.

loans.name: Teyor Al- Jana Group

texts.en:
This group is called Teyor Al- Jana. It consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Hamoda is a hardworking woman. She is a 32-year-old single woman and lives with her family in a rented house in a poor area. She is the leader of the group. Hamoda's father passed away several years ago. He was the sole breadwinner of the family. After the death of her father, Hamoda decided to work and sell women's clothes door to door. She has been in this business for three years with a small capital. Year by year her business improves more, but most of what she earns from profits goes to the expenses of the family. She has good experience in this business. Thanks to her experience, she deals with her own business with ease. Unfortunately, the income of this business is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family, and she wants to improve it. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more women's clothes and resell them to her customers.



Hamoda looks forward to expanding in her business in order to provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes and resell them to her customers.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Фирузу 31 год. Он молодой преуспевающий бизнесмен в сфере продаж продуктов питания. Фируз живет в районе Кубадиён вместе с родителями, женой-домохозяйкой и маленькими детьми. Он в семье главный добытчик. Фируз в 2010 году открыл свой продуктовый магазин. Он продает там различный ассортимент продуктов, в частности растительное масло, сахар, чай, сладости, шоколад, рулеты, яйца, детское питание, консервированные продукты и т.д. Так как уже лето, Фируз хочет купить большой холодильник для хранения в нем скоропортящихся продуктов, а также хочет приобрести один кулер  для компота. Чтобы реализовать свое намерение, Фирузу не хватает собственных средств и он обратился за кредитом. Этот кредит ему очень важен и он надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Firuz is 31. He is a successful young businessman in the food sales industry. He lives in the Qubadiyon district with his parents and his wife and young children. He is the main breadwinner for his family. In 2010 he opened his own grocery store. He sells a variety of products, including oil, sugar, tea, sweets, chocolate, rolls, eggs, baby food, canned goods, and so forth. Since it is summer already, Firuz wants to buy a big refrigerator to store perishables and a cooler to store compote. He does not have enough money himself, so he applied for a loan. This loan is very important to him and he hopes for support.

loans.use: to purchase a large refrigerator and a cooler for compote

loans.name: Angel Rutilio

texts.es:
El señor ANGEL de  48  años de edad es  casado  tiene dos  hijos que dependen de el, tiene casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 04 años al negocio de venta de llantas, lubricantes y accesorios para carro, su venta es de lunes a domingo en su taller el atiende diferentes clientes como por ejemplo los que llegan a reparar sus llantas, comprar lubricantes y los que llegan a buscar accesorios para su carro, don Ángel es una persona amable y servicial que desea salir adelante.
Don Ángel está solicitando el préstamo para comprar materiales para  terminar de construir el techo de un  apartamento para su hijo el comprara laminas, tornillos, canaletas, varillas y mano de obra, con el apoyo de este préstamo el lograra terminar su proyecto y está agradecido con PRISMA por su apoyo a su inversión, Su sueño es  mejorar su negocio y también  su casa.
San Lorenzo, honduras -  Abril del 2014
texts.en:
Angel is 48 years, married and has two children who are dependent on him.  He owns his own home that is located in the San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras.  For the past four years, he has worked selling tires, lubricants and accessories for cars.  He sells from Monday to Sunday.  He tends to a variety of customers in his workshop such as people who come to repair their tires, purchase lubricants, and those who come to look for car accessories.  Angel is a kind and helpful person who wants to get ahead.

Angel is seeking a loan to purchase materials to finish building the roof of an apartment for his son.  He will purchase sheet metal, screws, gutters, rods and pay for labor.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to finish this project.  He is thankful to PRISMA for their support of his project.  His dream is to improve his business as well as his home.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras- April, 2014.

loans.use: purchase sheet metal, screws, gutters, rods and pay for labor for his son's apartment.

loans.name: El Mirador De Bombon Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “El Mirador de Bombon” en el distrito de Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo. 

Marina tiene 25 años de edad y vive en la comunidad de Mirador de Bombon. Marina es una madre trabajadora que desde muy niña aprendió de sus padres la agricultura, la crianza de animales menores y la ganadería, ella es una persona carismática y amable que sale adelante cultivando papa, trigo, cebada y avena, ella en sus horas libres se dedica a la crianza de ovejas, gallinas y cuyes y también al engorde de ganado entonces ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas.  
  
Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la ganadería, a la crianza de animales menores y el engorde de ganado. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.(Las personas que estan adjuntas a la fotografia llegaron despues de la reunión).
texts.en:
The "El Mirador de Bombon" communal bank is made up of a group of friends and neighbors from the Challabamba district in the Paucartambo province.

Marina is 25 years old, and she lives in the community of Mirador de Bombon.  Marina is a hardworking mother who from a young age learned how to farm, and raise small animals and cattle from her parents.  She is a charismatic and kind person who gets ahead by growing potatoes, wheat, barley and oats.  In her free time, she works raising sheep, chicken and guinea pigs, as well as fattening cattle.  For this reason, she is in need of a loan to purchase guinea pigs and chickens.

This communal bank is made up of a variety of people who are constantly searching for opportunities to get ahead, and through their daily efforts, they provide their children with better futures.  The members devote themselves to farming, raising small animals, and fattening and raising cattle.  The members are grateful for this opportunity and are committed to complying with the established payment schedule.  

(The people who are in the appended photograph arrived after the meeting.)

loans.use: purchase guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Sayhua Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAYHUA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tomasa ella es soltera y tiene 39 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de animales, negocio de venta de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “SAYHUA”; This bank is located in the district of Urubamba, province of Urubamba, and department of Cusco.

Tomasa is one of the members.  She is single and is 39 years old. For the past 7 years she has worked in her restaurant business where she prepares different dishes such as chicken with potatoes, soups, and sauteed meats. She works from 10:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. and has been doing very well. 
Tomasa's dream is to expand her restaurant and is asking for the loan so she can buy products to cook such as chicken, meat, and vegetables. 

The other members have various occupations: raising animals, selling livestock, grocery store business, and the business of selling animals. The member is grateful to those who are helping her to realize her dream, and promises to repay her loan in accordance with its terms.

loans.use: to buy products like chicken, meat, and vegetables for cooking.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has been growing rice to sell for twelve years. During harvest time, she becomes a dealer in rice also, buying rice from her fellow farmers to resell in town. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for farming. Recently, she took a new loan. She is using the new loan to purchase fertilizer, in order to improve her produce.

In the future, Elena wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza runs a business in the local community selling seafood products, including crab, fish, and shrimp. Her husband is a fisherman and fishing is their main source of income. She finds her business is a good source of income. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying more seafood to sell. She wants to improve their fishing business and is requesting a new loan to purchase new hooks and fishing nets.
In the future, Flordeliza wants to expand her business to gain higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase new hooks and fishing nets

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help in paying his personal, household, and business expenses.

He would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. Gilbert's profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and other expenses. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Gilbert dreams to have a comfortable and easy life and hopes to buy another tricycle unit. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa  es casada  tiene 6 hijos vive con el esposo en San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar.

Pertenece a la venatnilla Santiagueña esta ubicada en la Parroquia Santiago pertenece al Canton San Miguel A 15 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel en esta ventanilla tiene 12 miembros que se dedican a actividades agricolas como simbre de maiz, frejol  y papas, ademas de esto se dedican a la crianza de animales como gallinas ponedoras y engorde de cerdos.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura y a la siembra de maiz,trigo, papas y cebada, ademas a la crianza de chanchos, gallinas y vacas. Nesecita el credito para la compra de semillas fertilizantes abonos ademas balanceado de engorde y crianza para los animales.

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de San Miguel  y vende en la Feria edn San Miguel. Ha enfrentado desafios como las plagas en el cultivo.

El sueño es mejorar los ingresos para comprar terrenos y seguir sembrando. Le gusta pasar con la familia en las fiestas del patron.
texts.en:
Rosa is married and has 6 children, she lives with her husband in San Miguel in the province of Bolivar. She is part of the "Santiagueña Shop" located in the Santiago Parish belonging to the San Miguel Canton. 15 minutes from the San Miguel office this small shop has 12 members that make a living through agricultural activities such as the farming of corn, beans and potatoes. Additionally they also work in the rearing of animals such as laying hens and pigs for fattening. 
Rosa focuses on farming and plants corn, wheat, potatoes and barley while also raising pigs, chickens and cows. She needs the credit to purchase seeds and fertilizers as well as rearing and weight-gain feed for the animals. She makes the purchases in the city of San Miguel and sells in the San Miguel fair. 
She has faced challenges such as crop plagues. Her dream is to improve her incomes to purchase land and continue farming. 
She enjoys spending time with her family during the patron festivities.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizers as well as rearing and weight-gain feed for the animals

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
Maria tiene 53 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos vive con los hijos y con el esposo en San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar.

Pertenece a la venatnilla Santiagueña esta ubicada en la Parroquia Santiago pertenece al Canton San Miguel A 15 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel en esta ventanilla tiene 12 miembros que se dedican a actividades agricolas como simbre de maiz, frejol  y papas, ademas de esto se dedican a la crianza de animales como gallinas ponedoras y engorde de cerdos.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura y a la siembra de maiz,cebada, papas y trigo, ademas a la crianza de chanchos, gallinas y vacas lecheras. Nesecita el credito para la compra de semillas fertilizantes abonos ademas balanceado de engorde y crianza para los animales.

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de San Miguel  y vende en la Feria en San Miguel. Ha enfrentado desafios como las plagas y enfermedades en lo9s cultivos.

El sueño es comprar mas terrreno par seguir sembrando. Le gusta pasar con la familia los dias domingos.
texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives with her children and husband in San Miguel in the province of Bolivar.  She is a member of the Santiagueña group, located in the Santiago parish in the canton of San Miguel, which is 15 minutes away from the San Miguel office.  The group has 12 members who are devoted to agricultural activities such as planting corn, beans and potatoes, as well as raising animals such as chickens, and fattening pigs.  

Maria works in agriculture, planting corn, barley, potatoes and wheat, as well as raising pigs, chickens and dairy cows.  She is in need of this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, and balanced feed to fatten up and raise her animals.  She will make her purchases in the city of San Miguel, and she makes her sales in the San Miguel fair.  She has faced many challenges such as pests and disease in her crops.  Her dream is to purchase more land to continue planting.  She enjoys spending her Sundays with her family.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, and balanced feed to fatten up and raise her animals.

loans.name: José Marino

texts.es:
José tiene 60 años de edad es un hombre muy luchador, quien ha dedicado su vida al oficio de la agricultura, junto a su esposa ha logrado sacar adelante a sus 6 hijas y 1 hijo de los cuales solo su hijo y una hija viven en el hogar, ya que los demás decidieron formar su propia familia. Don José no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pero si aprendió muchas cosas de sus padres, las cuales hoy le sirven de mucha ayuda.

La actividad que él realiza es la compra y venta de animales, él va los días jueves al tiangue donde compra los animales para posteriormente venderlos. Pero la actividad fuerte que realiza es la siembra de maíz, frijol, y maicillo, pues es de donde obtiene los granos que sirven en la alimentación diaria de su familia.

El crédito le servirá para comprar los insumos que utilizará en la producción de granos básicos, por el momento José necesita comprar los fertilizantes, pues ya está germinando la semilla que sembró. Pero debido algunos inconvenientes que se le presentaron, tuvo que gastar el dinero que tenía ahorrado, es por eso que necesita el apoyo.

Su sueño es poder establecer una plantación de sandias en un futuro, y poder tener una granja de cerdos, esto con el objetivo de mejorar su condición de vida, y ofrecerles a sus hijos una fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
José is a hardworking man of 60 who has always been a farmer. He and his wife have successfully raised six daughters and a son--only a son and a daughter still live with them as the others have left to form their own families. José never had the chance to go to school but he learned much from his parents who today still provide him with much help. 

To earn his living he buys and sells animals. He goes every Thursday to the open air market where he buys animals and then sells them. His most profitable business though is growing corn, beans, and maize as the grains provide him with the means to feed his family. He plans to use the loan money to buy supplies for the production of grains. At the moment he needs fertilizer because the seeds he has planted are already germinating. Due difficult circumstances he had to spend the money he had saved; this is why he now needs financial support.

José's dream is to plant fields with watermelons and to own a pig farm--then he will be able to improve his standard of living and provide his children with a source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer etc. to spread on his crops

loans.name: María Deysi

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, un ejemplo a seguir. Actualmente vive sola aunque, están viviendo sus 2 hijas como vecinas a su casa, y pasan el mayor de su tiempo con ella ayudando en los oficios del hogar, Ella también cultiva maíz y frijol en las actividades le ayuda uno de sus nietos, pues es un trabajo bastante fuerte. 
María se dedica a la elaboración de pan (quesadilla) y tamales, desde hace 6 años, siendo esta actividad la que le genera ingresos, ella sale a vender pan y tamales a las casas vecinas, además vende otro tipo de bocadillos como yuca frita, y plátano frito. Ella comercializa sus productos en la comunidad. Así también ella sale a vender a la escuela que se encuentra a 3 cuadras de su casa.
Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando al cliente para que pueda comprar sus productos agrícolas ya que de la actividad que realiza solo le alcanza para los gastos del hogar, y necesita cultivar pues es de la agricultura de donde obtiene los alimentos que forman parte de la canasta básica en su hogar.
María desea tener una venta más fuerte, es por eso que este año ella va a sembrar maíz  dulce para venderlo en elote y maicillo para hacer pan. Su sueño es poder construir una tienda en la orilla de la carretera, y piensa hacerlo con sus ahorros.
texts.en:
54-year old María is an enterprising, hardworking woman: an example to follow. She currently lives alone although two of her daughters live in neighbouring houses and spend much of their time with her helping with household chores. She also grows maize and beans; a grandson helps with this work as it is very hard.

María has also made bread (quesadillas) and tamales for six years to provide an income. She sells the bread and tamales to neighbours. As well as she sells snacks such as fried yucca and banana in the community and at the school with is three blocks from her house.

With the loan money María will be able to buy agricultural supplies since she can now only afford to pay for daily expenses. She wishes to be able to sell more so she is going to plant sweetcorn to sell as cobs and maize to make bread. Her dream is build a store on the side of the highway, and she is hoping to do this with her savings.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is 48 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children and husband, who been working for a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Musarat is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute toward managing the household. 

Musarat needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, and machine oil for her business, but due to insufficient financial means is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above-mentioned items and also help her increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Musarat  is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy items for her sewing business.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 53-year-old married mother of four children. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and health. 

She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has two years of experience in this field. Her son assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Farzana wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. This will be her first loan with Kiva and with other loans she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Yasmeen Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 26 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a printing shop and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of all family members. Yasmeen has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years, contributing her income to manage the household. 

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints is unable to. Therefore, Yasmeen has applied for a Kiva loan as a group loan. This loan will help her to buy the necessary items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. The loan will also help her earn maximum profits to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Yasmeen is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy items for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Virgen De Natividad I Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD I”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Constantina ella es casada y tiene 46 años; ; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

Las socias que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de salón de belleza, negocio de venta de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD I” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Constantina. She is married and 46 years old. She works at her business selling and raising animals. She raises guinea pigs and hens, helping them grow and fatten, and then she sells them at various markets. By means of this small business, she is able to get her children ahead. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell the guinea pigs and hens. She is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs, hens and food for them.

The members that are attached to the group photo took those photos after the meeting; they asked permission to do so for work reasons. The other members make a living from a beauty salon business, a business selling livestock, a grocery store business and a business selling animals.

Constantina thanks those who form part of this dream in this way, and she commits to making her payments in the time period established.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, hens, and food for them.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a 26-year-old, single lady from Tubas, a small village near Nablus city. She lives with her family in a small house. For the past three years, Islam has been working in her sewing workshop. She has good experience in this field, and the demand is also high.

Islam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing workshop. By taking this loan, Islam will be able to improve her production quality, and also her income.

Islam appears in the photo, in her sewing workshop

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Monadel

texts.en:
Monadel is a 24-year-old, single man, from a small village near Tulkarem city. He lives with his family, in a small house in the village. Monadel works with his family, as a farmer on the family land. It is a good business, and all the family members cooperate together in their work. Monadel would like to improve the family business.

Monadel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy fertilizer for the family land. By taking this loan, Monadel will be able to improve the family business and increase their productivity.

Monadel appears in the photo, on his land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the family land.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is married and has four children. He has a farm that provides good income for his family. His previous loans used for farming were repaid successfully. To purchase fertilizer, Daniel took out a new loan from GDMPC micro credit.
Daniel is planning to improve and expand his farm to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Amy

texts.en: Amy, 30 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a computer and printing shop in their village for almost three years. With this business, she's earning a net income amounting to PHP 1,500 daily. Her daily income always went to her savings. Due to insufficient funds in her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to pay for the xerox copy machine to use in her business. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To pay for the xerox copy machine to use in her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 49 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, sugar, and rice to sell.

Emma has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, sugar, and rice to sell

loans.name: Naida De Jesus

texts.es: Nadia de 52 años de edad,  cuenta que el negocio de su sobrina lo tenía un poco descuidado y   por ello su padre, (hermano de Nadia) cuando su hija lo dejó totalmente,  lo entregó a Nadia para que le diera vida. Pues conocía que tenia experiencia pues antes trabajaba como comerciante en el mercado público de la ciudad. Hoy 7 años después su dedicación completa a la refresquería y venta de comidas rápidas le ha dado un buen resultado y mucho ánimo, para lograr su crecimiento.  Los principales productos de su oferta son os jugos  naturales, papas rellenas, hamburguesas, empanadas, perros calientes y en general comidas rápidas, que vende de contado todos los días desde las 2 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos residentes en el barrio donde habita y tiene su negocio.  Su meta familiar es proporcionarle estudios superiores a su hija y más adelante comprar un apartamento. Con estos sueños se despierta cada día dispuesta a trabajar para lograr sus propósitos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará jugos naturales, papas rellenas, empanadas, perros calientes, hamburguesas y salsas, con las cuales preparar su oferta diaria. Con ello se incrementarán sus ventas,  haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
52-year old Nadia explains that her niece's business was somewhat neglected so her father (Nadia's brother) gave it to Nadia when it was totally abandoned. He knew that she had experience as she had once run a business in the local market. Today, after seven years dedicating herself to breathing life into the refreshment stand and sale of fast food, she has achieved good results and much encouragement to continue growing.

The main items she offers are natural juices, stuffed potatoes, hamburgers, empanadas, hot dogs and other fast food which she sells for cash every day from 2 in the afternoon to 10 at night. Her principal customers are her neighbours from the community where she lives and has her business.

Nadia's goal is to support her daughter through higher education, and then later on buy an apartment. With dreams like these she wakes up every day ready to work to achieve them. She is currently seeking a loan from Kiva to buy natural juices, stuffed potatoes, empanadas, hot dogs, hamburgers and sauces so she can prepare her daily dishes. In this way she will increase sales and turn her loan into a successful investment.

loans.use: buy natural juices, stuffed potatoes, empanadas, hot dogs, hamburgers and sauces

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Hello world!!! Here is Sally,  a farmer living on her piece of land in the rich highlands of Litein with her husband and child. On her farm, she has dairy cows, poultry, and grows tea, which is her main source of income. She enjoys farming very much because it gives her very good returns.
Sally wants this loan in order to construct a dairy unit which will give her dairy cows a very good environment for feeding and also for producing milk. This increased milk production will lead to an increase in her income, and this will help her give her family a better life.

loans.use: For construction of a dairy unit.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a repair service business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials needed for her repair services.

Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional material needed for her repair services

loans.name: Nagri 6 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Nagri 6 and consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Nagri is a hard-working woman. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children. She lives with her family in a poor area in Hodeidah. She is the leader of the Nagri 6 group. In order to help her husband meet the expenses of the family, Nagri decided to work in dressmaking, selling ready-made women clothes. She started her business with little capital. Her business lacks many sewing materials and her income remains low. For this reason, Nagri applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase more sewing materials such as fabric, thread, and buttons to improve her business.

Nagri looks forward to expanding her business through opening a small store for dressmaking and buying many sewing machines.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials such as fabric, thread, and buttons to improve her business.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 47 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Josie is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm.

Josie has been farming sugarcane for four years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 59 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Angelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like cooking oil, vinegar, noodles, biscuits, soft drinks, cereals, etc., to sell.

Angelita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, vinegar, noodles, biscuits, soft drinks, cereals, etc. 

Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like cooking oil, vinegar, noodles, biscuits, soft drinks, cereals, etc., to sell

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.en: Ruqiya is a 45-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Her husband owns an ice cream shop in the market. Nowadays, as summer season has started in Pakistan, his customers demand more ice cream. To cope with demand of his customers, he purchases basic raw ingredients for ice cream such as cream, condensed milk, butterfat, sugar, flavorings, fruit purees and extracts, cocoa powder, nuts, cookie pieces, and cookie dough. He wants to purchase an ice cream making machine for the business but does not have sufficient funds to cover the cost of a machine. Therefore, Ruqiya requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy an ice cream machine for his shop. She hopes that lenders will support him and this loan will prove productive for her husband's business as well. Ruqiya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of an ice cream machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To pay for solar lighting systems

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 43-year-old married woman living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She belongs to a poor family; her family passes their lives living hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells ladies and gentleman’s clothes. He has been running this business for many years and cherishing his whole family. It is his misfortune that he could not build up a good relationship among his customers; this is the reason he could not establish his enterprise. 

Now with the increase in their needs they consider it necessary to grow the business also. But the lack of capital is the major problem for her husband. Therefore, Naseem took a loan for her husband’s business. With the help of this loan her husband will purchase more clothes to sell. 

Naseem thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Qapaq Niño De Huaynapata - Coya Group

texts.es:
La socia Bertha pertenece al banco comunal QAPAQ NIÑO DE HUAYNAPATA - COYA,  el banco se encuentra ubicado en el sector de Huaynapata,distrito de Qoya,provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Bertha continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia continua vendiendo plátanos, manzanas entre otros a  todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea continuar trabajando para de esta manera continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas para su negocio.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de golosinas, crianza de animales menores, transporte, maestro constructor, limpieza, ganaderia, agricultura, crianza de animales.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the QAPAQ NIÑO DE HUAYNAPATA – COYA communal bank, located in the Huaynapata area of the Qoya district, Calca province, and Cusco department. 

Bertha continues to sell fruit and has done so for some time.  This brings her personal and financial satisfaction.  She continues to sell bananas, apples, and other things to her customers.  She wants to continue working and supporting her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy fruit for her business.

The rest of the members sell snacks, raise small animals, provide transportation, teach, build, provide cleaning services, raise livestock, farm, and raise animals

She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution , les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mil  avec BINTOU , première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, et à  SANANKOROBA , après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Djantoyerela IV are married women who average 37 years of age and 3 children each. All live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages in Sanankoroba, second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their third farming loan from the MFI, the previous ones have been repaid without problems.

They grow peanuts and millet, just like Bintou, the woman standing on the left in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay plowing cost to maintain two hectares.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village, and in Sanankoroba, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers.

Bintou intends to turn an average profit of XOF 160'000 per planting. This profit will enable her to repay her loan, and to help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay plowing cost

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua-San Salvador Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA-SAN SALVADOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Salvador, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Laureana ella es casada tiene 04 hijos y tiene 56 años; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de carne, negocio de venta de crianza de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de confección de ropas.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the communal bank "San Antonio de Padua-San Salvador;" This bank is located in the San Salvador district, belonging to the Calca province and the Cusco department. 
The partner is Mrs. Laureana, she is married, has 4 children and is 56 years old. She alternates her daily activities with her small grocery store business. She sells first priority products such as rice, sugar, milk and oil. She has been running this business for quite some time and it is successful thanks to the hard work that she puts into her business every day. She hopes to be able to continue working and in this way supporting her family. She is applying for the credit to purchase milk and sugar among other things. 
The other partners make a living in the business of selling meat, the business of animal rearing, the grocery business and the business of dressmaking. 
This partner thanks those who participate in this dream through this medium and is committed to making her repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: purchase milk and sugar among other things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a flat sewing machine, a covering machine, and raw materials like fabric and thread.

loans.name: José Isabel

texts.es:
José tiene 71 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casado y tiene 4 hijas.

 José se levanta a las 5:00 AM Junto a su esposa que le apoya en la actividades agrícolas y en el ordeño de las vacas ya que son solo ellos y un hijo que les colabora . El trabajo en la agricultura lo hace durante la mañana en la parcela y en lo que resta del día ordeña las vacas y su esposa realiza los trabajos domésticos.

Él solicita este préstamo a CrediCampo para comprar el abono, veneno, semilla y podrá pagar el alquiler de la tierra además de la arada y de la cosecha podrá obtener ingresos para el sustento de él y su esposa

sus planes a futuro son poner una granja y espera lograrlo con las ganancias de su trrabajo.
texts.en:
José is 71, he studied up to the sixth grade. He is married and has 4 daughters. José wakes up at 5:00 AM with his wife who helps him with the activities relating to farming and the milking of the cows because it is just them two and a son who helps them. He does his farming work in the morning on the land and the rest of the day he milks cows and his wife does the housework. 
He is applying for this loan to CrediCampo to purchase fertilizer, poison, seed and to be able to pay rent on the land as well as the plowing and harvesting fees. He will be able to obtain income to sustain himself and his wife. 
His future plans include building a farm and he hopes to achieve this with the earnings from his work.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer, poison, seed and be able to pay rent on the land as well as the plowing and the harvest fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for manual labor to tend to and weed her property and her coffee crop

loans.name: Alexci Moises

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yanahuara, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio Alexci Moises se dedica al negocio de venta de comida,el socio tiene un restaurant, el socio realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un restaurant. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "San Isidro de Yanahuara" communal bank. The bank is located in the Yanahuara district, which is in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

The member, Alexci Moises, earns his living selling food. He has a restaurant where he prepares different plates like oven-baked chicken, soups, and stir-fried beef. He works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. He has already had this business for eight years, and it is going very well for him. Having a restaurant is his dream. 

He is requesting the loan to buy cooking products like rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The member is happy about the loan and he promises to make his loan payments.

loans.use: to buy cooking products like rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Djiguignouma Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est arachide et mil  avec   NIAGALE, deuxième personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SANANKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Djiguignouma II are married women who average 44 years of age and 4 children each. All live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages in Sanankoroba, second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their sixth farming loan from the MFI, the previous ones have been repaid without problems.

They grow peanuts and millet, just like Niagale, second woman from the left in the standing row in the photograph. With her loan, she intends to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay plowing cost to maintain three hectares.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village, and in Sanankoroba, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers.

Niagale intends to turn an average profit of XOF 175'000 per planting. This profit will enable her to repay her loan, and also to help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pay plowing cost

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dress-making business in the Philippines. Estelita requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, thread, needles, etc. for her business.

Estelita has been in this business for 36 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Sheila Mar

texts.en:
Sheila Mar is 24 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling charcoal in the Philippines. She requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Sheila Mar has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for four years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Sheila Mar aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rabish Group

texts.en:
Rabish is a group which consists of five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is the leader of the group. She is a 44-year-old married woman with 11 children. Her oldest child is 25 years old, and the youngest one is 4 years old. Fatima is an uneducated woman, but she is very dynamic and vigorous. She works as a housewife. Because her family is very large, her house is not organized on most days. She has a strong determination to organize the house and to provide her family with a better life. Her house lacks many cupboards. She can't afford them. After the children come back from school, they throw their clothes in different places around the house. This makes Fatima feel ashamed, especially when she brings visitors inside the house. Also, the house lacks furniture. For this reason, she requested a loan of 50,000 YER in order to purchase a new cupboard for storing clothes. 

Fatima looks forward to furnishing her house. She hopes to provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a new cupboard for storing clothes

loans.name: El Progreso De La Feria Group

texts.es: Rocio es socia de la Nueva Alcancía Comunal “El Progreso De La Feria”  la cual lo conforma 05 personas responsables dedicadas a distintas actividades comerciales. Rocio lleva más de 10 años  dedicándose  a la venta de adornos para hogares como maseteros. Rocio es una madre trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a  su familia.  Su mayor deseo es de ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de insumos como flores, maseteros y bolsas. Rocio de 30 años es separada y tiene 04 hijos. El grupo  “El Progreso De La Feria” agradecen el crédito brindado. Rocio es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polo con rayas celeste y rosadas.
texts.en:
Rocio is a member of the “Progress of the Fair” New Communal Alliance goup, composed of 5 responsible people dedicated to distinct commercial activities.  Rocio has been a member for more than 10 years, dedicated to selling a variety of home adornments.

Rocio is a working mother who with much effort has managed to advance her family. Her greatest desire is to see her children developed professionally. She is requesting the loan to purchase inputs such as flowers, purses and other adornments.

Rocio is 30 years old, separated, and has 4 children. The “Progress of the Fair” [Communal Bank] is grateful for the offer of credit. In the photograph, Rocio is the 1st woman on the left side, wearing the pink and green polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy inputs such as flowers, purses, and other adornments.

loans.name: Remegio

texts.en:
This is Remegio, 50, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Yolanda, a seamstress and a mother to their child. By the grace of God, Remegio has managed to support his child's schooling until college. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remegio oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have a jeepney that has a capacity of 18 persons, which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in boundary every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy new tires for the jeepney and to renew his registration. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.
