Remegio dreams of seeing his grandchildren grow up as he grows old and hopes that his transportation business will last longer. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn. They modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Cresie

texts.en:
Cresie works hard to support her family. Cresie is married and has a buy and sell ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Cresie requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear clothing to sell.

Cresie has been in this business for 26 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cresie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristina is 44 years old and her child is in school.

Cristina has a selling dry goods business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cristina has been in this business for 19 years. Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods like blouses, shorts, t-shirts, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvira is 38 years old and her two children are in school.

Elvira has a buy and sell ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines. Elvira requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ready to wear clothing to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elvira has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready to wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Surriya

texts.en: Surriya is 45 and the mother of five children, living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a petrol (oil) agency in the market. He purchases oil from different petrol stations at a wholesale rate and sells to the customers on a daily basis at a profitable price. He has built up very good relations with his customers and that is the reason the demand for oil from his agency has increased. To cope with the demand, he wants to buy more stock of oil for resale. Moreover he manages his household necessities through this oil sale business. Therefore he decided to increase his current business on a daily basis. He wants to buy more stock of oil for resale. Therefore, Surriya, his wife, requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to support her husband’s business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of oil for resale.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 39 años de edad, pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado, por el hecho que su familia era numerosa y ella no pudo seguir sus estudios, sacrificándose para que sus otros hermanos pudieran hacerlo.  Está casada y su esposo se dedica a las actividades agrícolas,  sus hijos mayores le apoyan en esto y los menores estudian.

Ella realiza oficios domésticos en su hogar, tiene también, crianza de cerdos para la venta después de engordarlos, esta actividad la aprendió gracias a su madre quien se dedicaba a la misma actividad anteriormente; además de eso, le ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura. 

Necesita el préstamo para comprar los insumos agrícolas, ya se acerca la época lluviosa, por lo tanto es necesaria la preparación del terreno, ella cultivan  dos hectáreas de maíz.  

Su sueño es poder tener cada año los medios para trabajar la tierra y que sus hijos pequeños puedan continuar sus estudios y convertirse en personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Isabel is 39 years old and was only able to study up to the sixth grade due to the fact that her family was large; she wasn't able to continue her studies, sacrificing herself so that her other brothers and sisters could study. She is married and her husband makes a living from agricultural activities. Their older children support them in this and their younger children are studying.

She does domestic work in their home and also raises pigs for sale after fattening them. She learned this business from her mother, who used to make a living from the same business. In addition to this, she helps her husband with the agriculture. 

She needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies, as the rainy season is coming so it is necessary to prepare the land. She cultivates two hectares of corn.  

Her dream is to be able to have the means to work the land each year, and for her young children to be able to continue their studies and become people of means in their society.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 39 years old and married with two children.

Janet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Janet has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Janet aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Carlos Daniel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MILENIUM III, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio  tiene 54 años de edad y es casado, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de chocolates, él socio  lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a sus negocio el cual le va bien gracia al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como azúcar, cacao entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y  se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Carlos Daniel belongs to the MILENIUM III communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Calca, province of Calca and department of Cusco.

He is 54 years old and married. He alternates his daily activities with a chocolate-making business. He has been making a living from this business for quite a while and it is going very well thanks to how dedicated he is to his business each day. He wants to keep working in order to keep supporting his family.

He is asking for the loan to buy supplies like sugar and cacao, among other items. He feels grateful for the loan granted and commits to following through with his established payments

loans.use: to buy supplies like sugar and cacao, among other items

loans.name: Ana Lore

texts.en: Ana Lore owns and operates a business venture making and selling food in her community to make a living. After more than seven years in the business, she has been able to sustain it and successfully repay her previous loan used for the business. Aside from this, she has a rice farm and has been with it for many years. To improve her farm, she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles a 38-year-old man. He is married with seven children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He is in the waragi distillation/ brewing business. He has been operating this business for four years in the rural areas. He obtains additional income from a transport business. He is faced with the challenges of price fluctuation and poor roads. He hopes to buy a motorcycle and pay fees for his children. He is requesting a loan to buy more local brew (waragi) to sell.

loans.use: to buy more local brew (waragi) to sell.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 52 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Esterlita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like pork skin, cooking oil, seasonings, etc. for her business.

Esterlita has been in this business for six years. In the future, Esterlita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like pork skin, cooking oil, and seasonings for her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 51 years old, married and has two children.  

She is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries in cleaning her sugarcane farm.

Susan has been farming sugarcane for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers to clean her sugarcane farm

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Hello there! Here is Juliana, a very hardworking, dairy farmer living in the rich highlands of Litein. She lives on her 4 1/2 acres of land with her husband and 3 children, all of whom are school-going age. She has dairy cows, poultry and tea which have been her main sources of income for the past 10 years. She also has a motorbike which she uses to transport people and goods to the town center. She states that her hobby in farming is milking her cows.
Juliana says that this Kiva loan will enable her to expand her poultry farm by purchasing more poultry. This will lead to an increase in egg production and therefore she will get more income. This will give her family a good living standard.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is a 33-year-old father of two boys, ages nine and seven. Both his children are in school. He lives on the border town of Kazungula, located in the Southern province of Zambia.

Kelvin runs his own business, which is a Micro-Distribution Centre (MDC), where he sells Coca-Cola products at wholesale to local retailers and customers. He has been running his business for close to seven years now. Kelvin says he loves his business because it is a way for him to provide for his family’s basic needs like food, shelter, and education. When asked how his community benefits from his business, Kelvin is quick to say that his business provides to other small business owners in his community a place where they can order soft drinks without having to spend any money on transportation to go to Livingstone which is 45 miles away.

Today, Kelvin is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can purchase more stock such as Fanta, Coca-Cola and Sprite for his customers. By purchasing this additional stock, it will help with expanding his business and profit. He says the anticipated increase in his profits will help him provide a better life for his wife and children.

Kelvin has high hopes for the future. He has dreams of being able to distribute a variety of Coca-Cola products on a very large scale to his community.  He thanks the Kiva lenders for providing him with the opportunity to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock such as Fanta, Coca-Cola and Sprite for his customers.

loans.name: Siliva

texts.en:
Siliva owns a boutique in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with five children and three attend school. He gets additional income from farming. He started his business in 2009 so as to provide for his family needs. He hopes to educate his children and expand his business. Limited capital coupled with competition hinder his business.

He is acquiring credit to increase his stock by buying more clothes for selling.

loans.use: to increase his stock by buying more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn lives in Misamis Occidental with her three children. To earn a living, she runs a general store selling goods in her local community. She has been doing this for the past ten years. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro-Credit to buy additional inventory such as canned goods, noodles, and spices. She plans to expand her store in order to gain more income for the family's needs. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as canned goods, noodles, and spices

loans.name: Cherry Veim

texts.en:
Cherry Veim needs to pay for her schooling and other expenses. Her goal is to complete her degree and practice her profession.

Cherry Veim is striving for a better life through her studies. She says that she is requesting this loan to cover her university fees, so that she can study and achieve her goal. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving, which will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Crisostomo

texts.en: Edwin, a father of three, provides sewing services in his village to make a living. For more than 15 years, he earns well to provide for the family.  He needs repairs and sewing materials to improve the services to his customers. With the micro finance loan from GDMPC, his plan was realized. In the future, he wants to acquire a new sewing machine to expand his services.

loans.use: to finance repairs and sewing materials

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 56 years old and married with eight children, one of whom is in school, Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell of bamboo business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to sell

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 39 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jessie has a motorcycle rental business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Jessie has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Meet Wilfred, a farmer living on his three-acre farm in Litein where he lives with his wife and four children, all of school-going age. He has dairy cows, poultry, and tea on his farm, which he has had for five years and he has put up a small retail business. In farming, he enjoys milking his cows, but his biggest challenge is poor breeds.

Wilfred wants this loan to construct a dairy unit because he wants to breed his dairy cows well and keep his animals clean. This will cause his livestock to produce more milk for his family’s consumption and for selling. Wilfred says that through this loan, he will be able to expand his farming, leading to an increase in income. This will serve his family’s needs. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for partnering with Kiva by giving him this loan.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 51 years old. She is married and has four children. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming activities, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for use during rice production.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francince is 33 years old. Her husband works as a farmer, and they have been in the rice production business for the past five years. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production; they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With the profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers during rice production.

loans.name: Sunshine

texts.en: Sunshine is a very dedicated daughter who wants to become successful in the future. She studies in a university in order to fulfill her dreams. Her father works as a driver while her mother is a housekeeper. She needs financial assistance to pay tuition fees. With her GDMPC education loan, she will be able to continue her studies. Hopefully, in the future, she will find a better job according to her desire.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment for auto repair

loans.name: Drita

texts.en: Drita started a small business, with your financial help, selling items to beach-goers last summer. She did well, according to her, and she's very appreciative to all of her lenders. Now she is back needing your help again to paint the inside of the variety store; the season has already started and she is in a hurry to do the final touches to the store.

loans.use: to paint the inside of the small beach type of variety store

loans.name: Virginie

texts.en:
Virginie is 54 years old. She will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming activities, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for rice production.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es: Milagro de 39 años de edad se dedica ala confección de ropa para damas, caballeros e infantil. Su experiencia data desde hace 17 años,  cuando muy joven en el año 1997 aprendió a coser y decidió organizar su taller de modistería., con el fin de apoyar a su esposo en la financiación de los gastos familiares, que hasta ese momento se encontraban a su cargo.  Hoy  compra de contado en almacenes de confecciones especializados y vende a crédito una parte y la otra de contado, de acuerdo con el tipo de cliente. Milagros trabaja todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, porque tiene metas importantes que lograr como la de comprar un mayor número de maquinarias y terminar de remodelar su vivienda. Aunque aumentar la producción es un gran desafío,  así como también lo son  fidelizar su clientela y poder ahorrar.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina de coser, telas, hilos y accesorios para fabricar nuevos diseños y con ello aumentar la productividad y mejorar la calidad de sus productos finales.
texts.en:
Milagro, 39, has a business making clothing for men, women and children.  She has 17 years of experience.  When she was very young, in the year 1997, she learned how to sew and decided to set up a dressmaking workshop so that she could help her husband with the household expenses that he had been in charge of covering.  Today, she buys supplies in cash from the dressmaking supply stores, and she sells in part for cash and in part on credit, depending on the type of customer.  

Milagro works every day from 8am until 8pm, because she has a lot of goals to achieve, such as buying more sewing machines, and completing the remodel work on her house.  However, increasing her production is a great challenge, along with retaining her customers and being able to save.  At this time, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has done through Fundacion  Mario Santo Domingo.  With this loan she will buy a sewing machine, fabric, thread, and accessories so that she can make new designs, increase her productivity, and improve the quality of her final products.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric, thread, and sewing accessories

loans.name: Amandina

texts.es:
La socia Amandina se dedica al negocio de artesania,la socia tambien trabaja como profesora,la socia vende tejidos y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Amandina, earns her living selling artisanal crafts. She also works as a teacher. She sells different types of knit and woven pieces. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. She has already had this business for eight years and it's going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her sales of knit and woven articles. She is requesting the loan to buy knit and woven items.

The member is happy about the loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy knit and woven items

loans.name: Edel Anthony

texts.en:
Edel Anthony is studying in university for a Bachelor of Science in Information and Technology. He is someone who is very dedicated to his studies and wants to become successful in his career. His passion for supporting his family in the future makes him determined to continue despite some hindrances.

Edel Anthony is requesting this loan to pay school tuition fees. His goal is to have a better life and career in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Ell Freeborge

texts.en:
Ell Freeborge is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration at Misamis University, Oroquieta City. He used his previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to pay school tuition fees and other expenses.

Ell Freeborge has requested a new loan to pay for his summer class tuition fees. He wants to finish his studies and find a job that fits his qualifications in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for his summer class tuition fees

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda previously accessed a PHP 10,000 loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another PHP 10,000 loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda hopes to buy another unit of jeepney and dreams of healthy and happy living for her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn money and they modified the jeep into a 20-seat jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Danny Daniel

texts.es: Danny de 30 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de bolsos; Su idea de negocios nació de su familia, pues su madre manufacturaba bolsos y Danny los vendía. Posteriormente cuando Danny estuvo listo, se independizó y se dedicó a generar nuevos y propios ingresos. Hoy tiene un local desde donde distribuye sus bolsos y en ocasiones trabaja en su producción. En la actualidad su mayor clientela corresponde a los visitantes del centro de Barranquilla, a quienes le ofrece créditos y contado, de acuerdo al conocimiento que tenga de cada cliente. Su meta es lograr una infraestructura locativa más cómoda, para generar mayores ingresos y al final conformar su propia familia. Su mayor desafío es posicionarse en el mercado y crecer. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará bolsos de una nueva colección,  para impactar sus ventas y ganar un poco mas.
texts.en:
Danny is 30 years old and has a business selling purses. The idea for his business started with his family, since his mother used to manufacture purses which Danny would sell. Later, when Danny was ready, he began working independently in order to make his own income. He now has a shop from which he distributes his purses, and he occasionally makes them as well.

Currently most of his customers are visitors from the center of Barranquilla, and he extends credit to them, according to his knowledge of each customer. His goal is to have a more convenient infrastructure so that he can generate more income and at last form his own family.

His greatest challenge is to position himself in the market and to grow. Currently, he is seeking a loan through Kiva which is his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the funds to buy purses from a new collection in order to increase his sales and earn a little more.

loans.use: to buy purses from a new collection.

loans.name: Duglas Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo es un joven  muy trabajador de 18 años de edad, en su casa es el mayor, tiene cuatro hermanas, las dos mayores emigraron hacia Estados Unidos, buscando mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Él junto a su madre se dedican a la agricultura para tener el sustento año con año. Sus otras dos hermanas menores estudian. 
El joven trabaja la tierra desde muy pequeño, ya que su padre los abandonó cuando ellos eran apenas unos niños, además de dedicarse a la agricultura él trabaja en una panadería; se levanta a las 5:00 AM de la mañana para ir de casa en casa vendiendo pan, este trabajo lo consiguió gracias a un amigo que lo recomendó.

Utilizará el préstamo para la reparación del techo de su casa, comprando materiales de construcción (teja, clavos y madera).  Al comenzar el invierno su familia sufre las inclemencias del tiempo cuando llueve. Se mojan sus pertenecías, además, que sus hermanas menores sufren de enfermedades respiratorias por la humedad.

Su principal sueño es poder retomar sus estudios, por no tener el tiempo y recursos económicos, no pudo seguir estudiando. Prepararse para obtener un trabajo que le genere mayores ingresos y ayudar a su madre y hermanas.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a very hard-working young man of 18. He is the eldest in his household, has four sisters and the two eldest emigrated to the United States, looking for better living conditions. He and his mother farm to support themselves from year-to-year. His other two sisters go to school. 

The young man has been working the land from a very young age, as his father abandoned them when they were still children. In addition to farming, he works in a bakery. He gets up at 5:00 a.m. in the morning to go selling bread house-to-house. He got this work thanks to a friend who recommended him. 

He will use the loan to repair the roof of his home by buying construction materials (tile, nails and wood). When winter begins his family suffers the hardships of the weather when it rains. Their belongings get wet and his younger sisters suffer from respiratory illnesses because of the dampness. 

His main dream is to be able to go back to school, as because of not having the time and financial resources he was not able to continue studying. This will help him to train for getting a job which will generate greater income and help his mother and sisters.

loans.use: To repair the roof of his home,buying construction materials (tile, nails and wood).

loans.name: Compressor Group

texts.en:
Salome, a mother of one son in school, is in her early 30s. She is a married woman and has been supporting her family by running a cafe business. She is also selling water in her living place by using two storage tanks. Salome has been in these businesses for six years now and is able to make a fair monthly profit. She does the business from 6 am to 10 pm each working day.

This is her third loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. Salome used the previous loans (all of which she paid back successfully) to buy cafe chairs, a table to replace the old one and to replenish her food cooking inventory. Salome received a profit, which she used to plow back into her business to grow and cover part of her home food and school fees expenses. She will use her portion of the loan to repair her business fence and put concrete on the ground floor of her business place. Salome dreams of growing her businesses. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Compressor" which totals eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to repair her business fence and put concrete on the ground floor of her business place.

loans.name: Zoya

texts.ru:
Зоя имеет свой бизнес. Вот уже 11 лет она торгует на рынке мужской обувью. Имея большой опыт в этом секторе, Зоя хорошо подбирает модели, которые люди покупают с удовольствием. У Зои много постоянных клиентов и благодарных покупателей.  

Зоя энергичная, коммуникабельная и деловая женщина на работе, а в своем доме она отличная хозяйка - у нее всегда порядок и уют. Несколько лет назад Зоя потеряла мужа. Преодоление утраты далось Зое не легко, но ей помогала взрослая дочь, которая сейчас живет отдельно.

Зоя планирует расширять ассортимент мужской обуви и для этого просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 20,000 гривен. Зоя надеется увеличить товарооборот и получить дополнительную прибыль. Торговля обувью - единственный источник дохода для Зои, поэтому она планирует и дальше его развивать.
texts.en:
Zoya has her own business. For 11 years she has been selling men’s shoes at the market. Thanks to her long experience in this line of business, Zoe is able to select shoe styles that are popular with her customers. She has a loyal customer base and many satisfied buyers. 
Zoya is an energetic, communicative and business-like woman. She is an excellent homemaker—her house is always tidy and cozy. Several years ago Zoya lost her husband. It was very hard for Zoe to come to terms with this loss, but her adult daughter, who now lives separately, provided support.
Zoya plans to expand the selection of men’s shoes and is applying for a loan in the amount of 20,000 UAH for this purpose. She hopes to expand her sales volume and earn an additional income. Selling shoes is Zoya’s only source of income, which is why she plans to continue growing this business.

loans.use: to increase her  assortment of shoes for sale.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en: Elmer is married with a child. He operates a service-based business running an internet cafe in the community to make a living. His wife helps him and they earn well for the family.  He borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy a unit of computer.  He plans to improve his business by having more computer sets. In the future, Elmer wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
El socio Hector se dedica al negocio de artesania el socio vende tejidos y telares, el socio vende diferentes tejidos, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos y telares.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Hector, earns his living with an artisanal crafts business. He sells different knit and woven pieces. The member works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. He has already had this business for eight years and it is going very well for him. The member's dream is to expand his business of selling knit and woven items. He is requesting the loan to buy knit and woven articles.

The member is happy about the loan and he promises to make his loan payments.

loans.use: to buy knit and woven items

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 39 years old and married with three children. With all of her children currently in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, feed, rice, detergent soap, lotion, sanitary pads, diapers, etc. to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, feed, rice, detergent soap, lotion, sanitary pads, diapers, etc. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, feed, rice, detergent soap, lotion, sanitary pads, and diapers to sell

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie, who is single, has operated a general store business in the Philippines for five years now. She has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

In the future, Josie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Theofila

texts.en:
Theofila, 32 years old, has been farming rice for the past two years. He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and purchase fertilizer in order to increase rice production. Theofila wishes to reinvest his profits in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production.

loans.name: Laylani

texts.en:
Laylani is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Laylani is 44 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Laylani has a business selling slippers in the Philippines. Laylani requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of slippers to sell to her customers.

Laylani has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Laylani would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of slippers to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 30 years old. He will use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne, a 42-year-old married mother of five, will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and purchase fertilizer to increase her rice production. With profits from her farming, Julienne wishes to reinvest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production.

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luis es un agricultor que tiene 57 años de edad, él solo logró estudiar hasta 8° grado, no pudo seguir sus estudios debido a que sus padres no tuvieron la facilidad económica para seguir con sus estudios, ahora él está casado y de dicho hogar tienen dos hijos los cuales ya no viven con él, están acompañados,  su pareja es ama de casa.

La actividad que realiza Luis es el cultivo de maíz y frijol, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre ya que también era agricultor, su padre cuando se dio cuenta que ya no podía cubrir sus gastos educativos tomó la decisión de llevarlo a trabajar  junto con él,  pues había que sostener un hogar y generar ingresos, desde entonces él se ha dedicado a este trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para pagar el alquiler de 1,312.50 metros cuadrados de terreno para cultivar maíz. Él se ha dedicado a este cultivo desde muchos años y le ha generado muchas ganancias y ahora tiene una mejor semilla de mejor calidad, en este trabajo se involucra su esposa quien le ayuda mucho a realizar esta actividad, la distancia que le toca viajar cada vez es al menos 3 kilómetros de su casa ya que está situado en la faldas de un cerro.

Luis tiene un anhelo en la vida que sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y perseverancia lo podrá lograr, es de poder llegar a tener su vivienda digna y que su familia pueda vivir en un lugar más seguro de las lluvias.
texts.en:
Luis is a farmer who is 57 years old.  He was only able to study up to the eighth grade.  He wasn't able to continue with his studies because his parents lacked the economic resources to allow him to continue with his studies.  Now he is married and from this home came two children who no longer live with him.  They have companions.  His wife is a housewife.

Luis makes a living growing corn and beans which he learned from his father who was also a farmer.  His father, when he realized that he was not going to be able to cover his educational expenses, made the decision to take him to work with him, since he had to sustain a household and generate income.  Since then, he has made a living with this work.

The loan he is asking for is to pay the rent on 1,312.5 square meters of land in order to grow corn.  He has made a living growing this way for many years, it has generated lots of earnings, and he now has seeds of better quality.  His wife involves herself in this work and helps him a lot to do it.  The distance he has to travel every time is at least three kilometers from his house since it is situated on the side of a mountain.  

Luis has a wish in his life, that he knows with much effort and perseverance he will be able to achieve, which is to have a proper house and that his family may live in a place where the rains are more dependable.

loans.use: to pay the rent for 1,312.5 square meters of land in order to plant corn.

loans.name: Kibondo Group

texts.en:
Maria is in her late 50s and has six children who are grown. She is a widow and supports her family by managing several businesses. She is managing a café where she sells bites, milk, tea and other food. She also has a shop selling dry food and she has a house for rent with 16 rooms. Maria has been in her enterprises for 10 years now and is able to make a very good profit each month. She has business helpers and is open from 5:30 am to 10 pm daily.

This is her first loan request through Tujijenge Tanzania. Maria is applying for a loan to be apportioned among Kibondo, a five-member group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.
 
Maria will use her portion of the loan to restock her shop with food inventories. Her greatest ambition is to buy a business truck.

loans.use: to restock her shop with food inventories.

loans.name: Lalo Vitorino

texts.es:
El socio Lalo Vitorino se dedica al negocio de carpinteria,el socio hace trabajos como sillas, puertas y ventanas, el socio trabaja desde las 8.00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y el va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de carpinteria.El socio solicita el crédito para comprar madera y herramientas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Lalo Vitorino, makes his living in carpentry.  He makes things like chairs, doors and windows.  He works from  8:00am until 5:00pm.  Lalo has been in the business for a number of years, and it is going very well for him.  His dream is to expand his carpentry business.  He is requesting the loan to purchase wood and tools. ,

Lalo is happy about the loan, and he promises to comply with his repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase wood and tools.

loans.name: Eriberta

texts.en:
Eriberta previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her ornamental plant business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets, and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eriberta hopes for her business to grow and expand and deeply desires to progress in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is 61 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Roberta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.  Roberta has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future Roberta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Bergie

texts.en:
Bergie is 40 years old and married with one child.

Bergie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Bergie has been in this business for eight years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Bergie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Theofile

texts.en:
Theofile is aged 35. He is the father of three children aged between five and twelve.

He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and for fertilizer during rice production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use during rice production

loans.name: Simat's Group

texts.en: Simat’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Simat makes a living cultivating rice, selling groceries at home and doing extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water .

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Clever

texts.en:
Clever is a shop owner in a small village in Kapiri Mposhi District, Zambia. He is requesting a loan for a maize mill to provide a maize milling service to over 300 families in his community.

The maize milling machine takes raw maize (corn) and creates a maize flour which is the staple food in Zambia. Most rural families in Kapiri Mposhi District grow maize on their small farms and store it and use it as their primary supply of food for the year. After the kernels are removed from the cob, they then have to be milled to create flour, which can then be boiled to make what is locally called Nshima. Clever is already a well-respected member in his community and wants to expand his business to offer this maize milling service. 

Rent-to-Own has done market research in Clever’s community and has determined that the location for this equipment is ideal. The closest maize mill is over 10 km away, but is often broken down. This means most potential customers have to travel to other villages, and since most will walk or use their bicycles to travel to the maize mill, it is certain they will prefer to use this maize mill rather than traveling a longer distance. 

Equipment such as a maize mill can be a major boost for many enterprising farmers and shop owners such as Clever, as it allows for him to diversify his business. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a maize mill are very prohibitive. Once he secures a loan, Clever will be able to get a maize mill from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to his farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it. 

This loan will help Clever on the path to building up a viable business that can provide for his family and community throughout the year.

loans.use: to obtain a maize milling machine

loans.name: Samnorn's Group

texts.en: Samnorn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Samnorn makes a living cultivating rice, selling groceries at home and doing extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of the members in this group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water .

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family
