texts.en: Sros’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sros makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water .

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es soltera, vive en el Departamento de Lambayeque junto a sus 3 hijos. 
Al ser madre soltera, desde muy joven ha trabajado con gran empeño para sacar adelante a sus hijos y elevar su calidad de vida.
Hace 1 año Bertha viene dedicándose al negocio de crianza y comercialización de patos de corral, así como de brindar pensión a 3 comensales, por lo que obtiene un ingreso extra que está ahorrando para poder remodelar su casa.
Sin duda alguna Bertha es una mujer emprendedora que quiere cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños: “Construir su casa de material noble”.
Es por eso que está eternamente agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que con ese apoyo ella podrá remodelar su vivienda para una mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Bertha is single.  She lives in the Lambayeque department with her three children.  Being a single mother, she has worked with great effort ever since she was a very young woman in order to get her children ahead and improve their quality of life.

For one year Bertha has been working in the business of raising and selling ducks.  She also provides regular meals for three diners.  That way she gets extra income that she is saving to be able to remodel her house.

Without a doubt, Bertha is an enterprising woman who wants to fulfill one of her biggest dreams, which is to build her house from solid material.  That is why she is eternally grateful to the Kiva lenders.  With this support she will be able to remodel her house so that it will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to remodel her house.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando vive en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, él es una persona respetuosa y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra diferentes productos como por ejemplo trigo, cebada, papa y otros, él pertenece al banco comunal "Intipaqareq II" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas
texts.en:
Armando lives in the Paucartambo province in the Cusco department in southern Peru.  He is a respectful and humble person who devotes himself to agriculture and livestock.  He has various plots of land where he grows different products like wheat, barley, potatoes, and others.  He belongs to the Intipaqareq II communal bank.

He now needs the loan to buy seeds.  He is thankful to all of the lenders for the support provided.  He pledges to make his payments responsibly and punctually.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia Vilma  tiene 51 años de edad y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de zapatos y venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a sus negocio el cual le va bien gracia al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocios, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes para damas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y  se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This partner, Vilma, is 51 years old and is married. She alternates her daily work with a shoe store business and the sale of beauty products. The partner sells her merchandise to her customers who request it from her like friends and family, among others. The partner has made a living from her business for a long time and it does well thanks to the efforts that she puts into her business every day.

The partner would like to be able to keep working so that in this way she continues supporting her family. 

She asks for a loan for the purchase of perfumes for women.

The partner feels grateful for the granted loan, and promises to meet the payments.

loans.use: to buy perfumes for women.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario vive en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, él es una persona respetuosa y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra diferentes productos como por ejemplo trigo, cebada, papa y otros, él pertenece al banco comunal "Intipaqareq II" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas
texts.en:
Mario lives in the Paucartambo province in the Cusco department in southern Peru.  He is a respectful and humble person who devotes himself to agriculture and livestock.  He has various plots of land where he grows different products like wheat, barley, potatoes, and others.  He belongs to the Intipaqareq II communal bank.

He now needs the loan to buy fertilizer.  He is thankful to all of the lenders for the support provided.  He pledges to make his payments responsibly and punctually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Humberto co su credikiva, pues le alcanzó hasta para comprar prendas de vestir, e incluír a su hija en esa actividad comercial, para que tambien generara ingresos. Desde que recibió los finaciamientos de Kiva ha logrado apoyar mas el bienestar de su familia y responder a sus clientes las solicitudes que hacen y que a él le permiten ganar dinero.  Por eso dice a sus finaciadores de Kiva : "gracias por sus préstamos, espero que me ayuden otra vez. " En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará piezas de repuestos para mantener su equipo de trabajo, con ello hará de su credikiva una buena inversión.
texts.en:
Thanks for supporting Humberto with your Kiva loan.  He even had enough to buy clothes and to include his daughter in this commercial activity so that she could also generate income.  Since he received the Kiva loan he has managed to support his family’s well-being more.  He also managed to respond to the requests his customers make, which allows him to earn money.  

That is why he says to his Kiva lenders, “Thank you for your loans.  I hope that you will help me again.”  He is currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy replacement parts to maintain his work equipment.  With this he will make a good investment with his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts to maintain his work equipment.

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en: Nang’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Nang makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Shungu Dzemoyo Group

texts.en:
This is Thrive’s Shungu Dzemoyo Group. Tsitsi is the Chairlady of the group and she is the one seated in the middle with a lovely smile. Tsitsi is 51 years old and lives in Glenview, a high density suburb in Harare, Zimbabwe. She stays with her husband who is now a pensioner and five children.
Tsitsi sells Bibles at very  affordable prices for a living, she has shown us some of her stock in the photo. Her husband is no longer employed and the pension they receive falls short of the family’s needs, especially when it comes to paying school fees for their five children. She is travels to South Africa once in two months for her bibles. She supplies churches, preschools and individuals with bibles of different languages and versions. Due to inadequate financial resources, Tsitsi cannot meet the demand from her customers.
A portion of the group’s USD1550 loan will help Tsitsi grow her small business of bible selling and meet the growing demand. This way she will be able to provide for their family and also to spread the word.

loans.use: To buy bibles and other religious texts for resale

loans.name: Roem's Group

texts.en: Roem’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Roem makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water .

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.en:
Shirley is a member of the Emmanuel group. She became the member of the group when she was identified by the other group member to be a hard worker who could help strengthen their Rosca group. The group continually attends trainings offered at Thrive. She appreciated the training on good spending habits, which has helped her to prepare a budget for her home and business.
Shirley, 54, stays in Budiriro, Harare. Her business has grown from selling snacks and sweets to selling groceries and refreshments since she joined the Emmanuel group. The group has been so encouraging in all her work. She wishes to expand her business and open a groceries shop. Shirley`s husband lost her job in 2008 and since then, she has been providing money for food to the family and paying water and electricity bills.
A Kiva loan can help Shirley continue to sustain her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy provisions for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, compost, and leaf fertilizer and to pay for labor to clear the fields and fertilize her farm.

loans.name: Phol's Group

texts.en: Phol’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Phol makes a living cultivating rice, raising pigs - she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Great Success Group

texts.en: Gugulethu is a thirty four year old woman.  She stays in Glenview, a high density surburb of Harare.  Gugulethu provides pressure pump and tyre services in her local area. She also sells and repairs second hand tyres.  She has been running this business for two years now and it has enabled her to support her family. Gugulethu is married with two children, she is also taking care of three children of her late sister, so her profits barely meet her needs.  Gugulethu`s hard work and ambition led her to buy her own pressure pump.  However her business is still growing and she cannot afford to sell new tyres.  With a kiva loan, Gugulethu will buy new tyres, expand her business and make more profits.  It is her wish to grow the business and create employment in her community.

loans.use: To buy new tyres and other supplies for resale.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Martin vive en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, él es una persona respetuosa y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra diferentes productos como por ejemplo quinua, kiwicha, trigo, cebada, papa y otros, él pertenece al banco comunal "Intipaqareq II" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas.
texts.en:
Martin lives in the Paucartambo province in the Cusco department in southern Peru.  He is a respectful and humble person who devotes himself to agriculture and livestock.  He has various plots of land where he grows different products like quinoa, kiwicha, wheat, barley, potatoes, and others.  He belongs to the Intipaqareq II communal bank.

He now needs the loan to buy seeds.  He is thankful to all of the lenders for the support provided.  He pledges to make his payments responsibly and punctually.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Agustin en la compra de tubería, tornillería y cemento. Con ello actualizó su mercancia y respondió pedidos a la medida de  la solicitud de su clientela. Agustin se siente muy agradecido con los finaciadores,  por la ayuda  que han prestado con su financiamiento. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo finaciamiento mediante el cual comprará nuevos modelos de cerraduras y partes eléctricas, para una vez mas hacer de su credikiva una buena inversión.
texts.en:
Thanks for helping Agustin to buy pipes, hardware, and cement.  With this he updated his merchandise and responded to customized orders from his customers.

Agustin is very grateful to the lenders for the help of the loan.  He is currently applying for a new loan to buy new models of locks and electrical parts.  Once again he will make his Kiva loan a good investment.

loans.use: to buy new models of locks and electrical parts.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia vive en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco al sur de Peru, él es una persona respetuosa y sencilla que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra diferentes productos como por ejemplo trigo, cebada, papa y otros, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Intipaqareq II" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y semillas. Agradece a todos los inversionistas por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas programadas.
texts.en:
Julia lives in the Paucartambo province in the Cusco department in southern Peru.  She is a respectful and humble person who devotes herself to agriculture and livestock.  She has various plots of land where she grows different products like wheat, barley, potatoes, and others.  She belongs to the Intipaqareq II communal bank.

She now needs the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.  She is thankful to all of the lenders for the support provided.  She pledges to make her payments responsibly and punctually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela es una joven  luchadora que ha superado situaciones difíciles, tiene 27 años, dejó sus estudios para buscar un trabajo que le pudiera generar ingresos a su familia, una familia de escasos recursos, ella vive solamente con su padre. Siendo una madre soltera de un hijo, se ha encontrado  con momentos muy duros pero que no le impiden intentar conseguir sus sueños.
Su deseo es tener siempre los medios para poder ayudar a su padre, que está en una edad avanzada y se le dificulta valerse por sí solo, además de darle todo a su pequeño hijo para que crezca saludable y en condiciones dignas.
Esta joven necesita el crédito para invertir en su negocio, comprar insumos que utiliza para la elaboración de pupusas; quesillo, maíz, frijol, entre otros. Con esto pretende mantener y mejorar su iniciativa de negocio.
Ella trabaja desde hace 3 años realizando oficios domésticos, en la casa de una señora en el pueblo, trabaja de lunes a sábado, teniendo que viajar cada fin de semana para su casa; en los días libres tiene una pequeña venta de pupusas.
texts.en:
Angela, 27, is a hard-working young woman who has overcome difficult situations.  She left school to find work that would allow her to generate income for her family, a poor one.  She lives with her father.  Being a single mother of one son, she has encountered difficult times; but they have not stopped her from trying to achieve her dreams.

Her wish is to always have the means to be able to help her father who is already old and finds it difficult to support himself.  In addition, she wants to give her all to her young son so that he may grow up healthy and in favorable conditions.

This young woman needs the loan to invest in her business, to buy supplies for the production of pupusas; cheese, corn, and beans among other things.  With this, she will try to maintain and improve her business initiative.

For three years, she has been working as a domestic in the house of a woman in town.  She works Monday through Saturday and she has to travel every weekend to her house.  On her days off, she has a small business selling pupusas.

loans.use: to invest in her business, to buy supplies to use for the production of pupusas: cheese, corn, and beans among other things.

loans.name: María Milagro

texts.es:
María tiene 36 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora, actualmente vive solo con sus 3 hijos, ellos estudian en la escuela del cantón y ayudan en las labores agrícolas a su madre.

María se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa y además cultiva una hectárea de maíz y frijol ya que le ayudan sus 2 hijos en el manejo del cultivo. Dicha actividad la aprendió de sus padres y la perfeccionó junto con su compañero de vida, quien por tratar de mejorar la condición de vida de su familia se fue a buscar trabajo fuera del país, dejando a María con la responsabilidad de sus hijos.
Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando a María para que pueda comprar los insumos que utilizará en la producción, así también para poder pagar la mano de obra, pues hay algunas actividades un poco fuerte para que ella pueda realizarlas. 
María en un futuro quiere poder establecer un negocio que le sea rentable. Por el momento ella piensa en establecer una tienda de ropa, para poder pagarle los estudios a sus hijos  y así puedan tener una carrera universitaria, para que les sea más fácil defenderse en la vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 36, a very hardworking lady, she lives alone with her three children. They go to school in the area and help her with small agricultural tasks.
Maria takes care of her household and also grows corn and beans on a hectare of land with the help of two of her children.  She learned agriculture from her parents and became an expert thanks to her life partner, who trying to improve the life conditions of his family went in look of work out of the country, leaving Maria responsible for their children.
With the loan Maria will be helped to buy inputs needed in production and she will also be able to pay for labor, because there are some activities that are a bit too hard for her to do. In the future Maria wants to establish a profitable business. She is currently thinking of opening a clothing store and be able to pay for her children’s studies so they can have a university degree and this way be ready to take care of themselves in life.

loans.use: to buy inputs needed in production and she will also be able to pay for labor.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 58 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, está acompañado y tiene 3 hijas, dos de ellas mayores de edad, y la otra hija es menor la cual se encuentra estudiando en la escuela, además Félix es líder de la comunidad y siempre ha trabajado por el bienestar de la misma.
Félix ha trabajado desde que tenía 12 años de edad, él sabe muchas técnicas para cultivar pues ha participado en muchas capacitaciones impartidas por el ministerio de agricultura y ganadería, anteriormente cultivaba tilapia (pez), pero debido a la escasez  de agua, dejó de hacer dicha actividad.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas pues por el momento no cuenta con   el dinero suficiente, y la época de siembra ya comenzó.

En un futuro él desearía poder cultivar hortalizas, para obtener ingresos  constantes, con los que pueda brindarles a sus hijos una buena alimentación y mejor calidad de vida, para que puedan seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Félix, age 58, is a very hard-working man.  He is in a relationship, and he has three daughters.  Two of them are adults, and the other daughter, a minor, is in school.  Félix is a leader in the community, and he has always worked for its well-being.

Félix has worked since he was 12 years old.  He knows many techniques for growing.  He has participated in a lot of training given by the ministry of agriculture and livestock.  He used to have a tilapia (fish) farm.  However, due to the scarcity of water he left this business activity.

He needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies.  At this time he does not have enough money, and the season for planting has already started.

In the future he would like to be able to grow vegetables in order to get constant income.  With the income he would be able to provide his children with good food and a better quality of life so that they are able to continue their education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 35 years old. He is a father of five children. He has been a rice farmer for the past 20 years. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With the profits from his farming, Emmanuel wishes to invest in his business, so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for use during rice production.

loans.name: Lety Michael

texts.es:
Lety tiene 21 años de edad es soltera vive con la mama en casa de familiares en San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar.

Pertenece a la venatnilla Santiagueña esta ubicada en la Parroquia Santiago pertenece al Canton San Miguel A 15 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel en esta ventanilla tiene 12 miembros que se dedican a actividades agricolas como simbre de maiz, frejol  y papas, ademas de esto se dedican a la crianza de animales como gallinas ponedoras y engorde de cerdos.

Lety se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales como: siembra de maiz, frejol y papas, ademas tiene gallinas ponedoras donde los huevos vende y engorda cerdos para luego venderlos. Nesecita el credito para la compra de semillas fertilizantes abonos ademas balanceado para los animales.

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Guaranda y las vende en samiguel en la Feria de los Jueves. Ha enfrentado desafios como las plagas en las plantaciones.

El sueño es que mejoren los cultivos y que gente de afuera conozca sus productos para salir a vender en otras provincias. Le gusta disfrutar de las fiestas con los amigos y familiares.
texts.en:
Lety, age 21, is single and lives with her mother in a relative’s house in San Miguel Province in Bolivar.

She belongs to the Santiaguaeña communal bank in the Santiago parish, which belongs to the San Miguel canton.  It is 15 minutes from the San Miguel office.  There are 12 members in this communal bank.  They devote themselves to agricultural activities like growing corn, beans, and potatoes.  Lety devotes herself to agriculture and raising animals.  She grows corn, beans, and potatoes.  She also has laying hens, and she sells the eggs.  She fattens pigs and later sells them.

She needs the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, and balanced feed for the animals.  She will make her purchases in the city of Guaranda, and she sells at the San Miguel Thursday fair.  She has faced challenges like pest infestations.

Her dream is to improve the crops and that people from father away recognize her products.  She wants this to happen so that she can go to sell in other provinces.  She likes to enjoy parties with her friends and relatives.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, and balanced feed for the animals.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 53 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Linda works very hard to provide for them.

Linda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Linda has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, cooking oil, biscuits, noodles, milk, juice, etc. 

Linda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Pari

texts.en:
Pari is a 54-year-old single woman, from the village of Tivi. She is a hard-worker, who puts much effort for progressing in life. Pari has her own agricultural land where she cultivates nuts and corn seasonally and generates a small income. As this activity is seasonal, Pari also works as a private worker, taking care of the villagers' vineyards and earning compensation for her work. However all this activity is seasonal, as you can observe, and Pari wants to start more stable work. 

Pari requested a loan, and was approved, with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up program gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. Pari decided to start a clothing trading business. She will purchase stock of clothing to sell in her community at increased prices. She will also work on special orders and will get her own customers. Pari will be grateful for getting her chance to generate a more stable income and reach financial stability. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To start a clothing trading business

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina tiene 52 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su pequeña nieta de 11 años de edad. Reina se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace 16 años de edad y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la conexión de la lux eléctrica y para encementar el piso de la vivienda dado que actualmente es de tierra.
texts.en:
Reina, age 52, lives in her own house with her husband and her small 11 year old granddaughter.  Reina has been selling fish ever since she was 16 years old.  This way she earns a living and brings sustenance to her home.

In order to improve their living conditions, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to invest in connecting electricity and to put down a cement floor in her house because it currently has a dirt floor.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and gravel to put down a cement floor in her house and to pay to hook up to electricity.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de 40 años de edad,  tiene su propia miscelánea desde el año 2004. Su actividad comercial es producto de la tradición ocurrida en su familia, pues su madre. Confeccionista y comerciante,  fue quien con su ejemplo  “enseñó a ella y a sus hermanos a valerse por su propia cuenta“. Hoy en día, Teresa  hace reconocimiento a la labor de su madre, pues  dice que ha sido difícil conseguir un empleo. Teresa en su condición de mujer y madre de 2 hijos en las edades de 15 y 20 años, con quienes habita, ha logrado que con el apoyo de su hijo mayor salir adelante y apoyar la educación de su hija. Su meta a mediano plazo es tener un local propio e independiente en un lugar de gran afluencia de público y adquirir su vivienda propia. Su mayor desafío es lograr su crecimiento empresarial y adquirir créditos por  un mayor valor. Para obtener mas ingresos y apoyar a un mas a sus hijos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante la cual comprará pantalones  y camisas en diversas líneas. Con ello su negocio mejorará pues obtendrá mayores ingresos y esto es justamente lo que hace de su credikiva una buena  inversión.
texts.en:
Teresa, age 40, has had her own general store since 2004.  Her commercial activity is a product of a family tradition.  It was her mother, a seamstress and merchant, who was her example.  She taught her and her siblings to take care of themselves.  Teresa now recognizes her mother’s work.  She says that it has been difficult to get a job.  Teresea has two children, ages 15 and 20, and she lives with them.  With the help of her oldest son, she has managed to get ahead and support her daughter’s education. 

Her mid-range goal is to have her own independent place in an area that is very busy.  She also wants to have her own home.  Her greatest challenge is managing business growth and getting loans for a greater amount.  She wants these things in order to get more income and to support her children even more.

This is the reason that she turns to a Kiva loan.  It is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy pants and shirts from different lines.  With this her business will improve.  She will get greater income, and this is exactly what makes her Kiva loan a good investment.

loans.use: to buy pants and shirts from different lines.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 25 años de edad es soltero vive con la mama en casa propia en San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar.

Pertenece a la venatnilla Santiagueña esta ubicada en la Parroquia Santiago pertenece al Canton San Miguel A 15 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel en esta ventanilla tiene 12 miembros que se dedican a actividades agricolas como simbre de maiz, frejol  y papas, ademas de esto se dedican a la crianza de animales como gallinas ponedoras y engorde de cerdos.

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura y a la siembra de maiz y papas, ademas el engorde de cerdos y crianza de gallinas para venderlas. Nesecita el credito para la compra de semillas fertilizantes abonos ademas balanceado de engorde y crianza para los animales.

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Guaranda y las vende en San Miguel en la Feria de los Jueves y los Sabados en Chimbo. Ha enfrentado desafios como las plagas en la produccion.

El sueño es mejorar los cultivos para tener mas ingresos y ayudar a la famjilia economicamente. Le gusta disfrutar de las fiestas con la familia.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 25, is single and lives with his mother in his own house in San Miguel Province in Bolivar.

He belongs to the Santiaguaeña communal bank in the Santiago parish, which is in the San Miguel canton.  It is 15 minutes from the San Miguel office.  There are 12 members in this communal bank.  They devote themselves to agricultural activities like growing corn, beans, and potatoes. They also raise animals like laying hens and fatten pigs.

Miguel devotes himself to agriculture and growing corn and potatoes.  He also fattens pigs and raises chickens to sell.

He needs the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, and balanced feed to fatten and raise the animals.  He will make his purchases in the city of Guaranda, and he sells at the San Miguel Thursday fair and in Chimbo on Saturdays.  He has faced challenges like pest infestations.

His dream is to improve the crops in order to have more income and to help his family financially.  He likes to enjoy parties with the family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, and balanced feed to fatten and raise the animals.

loans.name: Jessica Nacir

texts.es: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, en edad escolar. Se desempeña como bombera en una gasolinera de en la Ciudad de Bilwi. Desde hace aproximadamente 5 años habita en una casa de tambo de madera. Con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda y que su familia viva de manera segura, solicita su segundo financiamiento, para comprar materiales de construcción para cambiar la madera de su vivienda: madera rustica y cepillada, clavos, zinc y para cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es brindarle a su familia una vivienda con las condiciones adecuadas y apoyar al desarrollo profesional y humano de sus hijos.
texts.en:
She is from Puerto Cabezas.  She is 29 years old and the single mother of three school age children.  She works pumping gas at a gas station in the city of Bilwi.  For approximately five years she has lived in a wooden stilt home.

Her objective is to improve her house so that her family can live safely.  In order to do so, she is requesting a second loan to buy construction materials to change the wood of her house.  She will buy crude lumber and planed wood, nails and metal sheeting.  She will also pay for the labor.

Her dream is to provide her family with a house in adequate condition and to support the professional and personal development of her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina tiene 28 años de edad, es una joven muy emprendedora, a pesar de ser madre soltera, ha buscado la manera de poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, quienes son menores de edad, la mayor tiene 8 años de edad y estudia primer grado de educación básica, el menor tiene 5 años y estudia parvularia, La escuela en la que estudian se encuentra a 4 cuadras de distancia de su casa, quien se encarga de llevarlos a la escuela es su tía, ya que Clementina se dedica a brindar sus servicios en una panadería, la cual se encuentra a 3 kilómetros de su casa.

Clementina tiene 5 Años de brindar sus servicios en la panadería, anteriormente se dedicaba a brindar sus servicios como ama de casa, haciendo el oficio del hogar, hasta que encontró el trabajo como ayudante en una panadería, ella tiene que levantarse muy temprano, su horario es de 4:00 AM a 5:00 PM. Los fines de semana se va al mercado a comprar y revender pollos.

Clementina solicita el crédito para comprar productos para vender los fines de semana, pues ella los días sábados se dedica a comprar y revender pollos, de lo que obtiene pequeños ingresos, los que son de mucha ayuda  para cubrir algunas las necesidades del hogar.

Clementina en un futuro desearía poder tener su propio negocio en casa, para no tener que alejarse de sus hijos, pues su trabajo le impide pasar más tiempo con ellos, ella desearía poder construir su propia casa, pues por el momento vive en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Clementina, age 28, is a very enterprising young woman.  In spite of being a single mother, she has sought out the way to be able to get her minor children ahead.  The oldest is eight years old and is in the first grade.  The youngest is five years old and goes to preschool.  The school that they attend is four blocks from her house.  Her aunt takes them to school because Clementina works at a bakery, which is three kilometers from her house.

Clementina has been working at the bakery for five years.  Before that she devoted herself to the household chores until she found work as a helper at a bakery.  She has to get up very early.  Her schedule is from 4:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  On the week-ends she goes to the marked to purchase and resell chickens.

Clementina is requesting to loan to buy products to sell on the week-ends.  On Saturdays she buys and resells chickens.  The small income that she gets is a big help in covering some of the household necessities.

In the future Clementina wishes to be able to have her own business at her house so that she does not have to leave her children.  Her work keeps her from spending more time with them.  She would like to build her own house.  She is now living in her parents’ house.

loans.use: to buy products to sell.

loans.name: Dinora Noemy

texts.es:
Dinora tiene 29 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, a pesar de solo haber estudiado sexto grado, ella se dedica a vender perfumes y artículos de revistas para poder apoyar en los gastos del hogar, su esposo es albañil y es quien cubre la mayor parte de  los gastos, Dinora lucha para poder sacar adelante a su hijo de 3 años y a su niño de 1 año de edad, a quienes les presta mucha atención, ya que son ellos quienes la motivan a seguir adelante.

Dinora realiza esta actividad desde hace 5 años, ella vende los productos y obtiene de ellos el 25% del precio de cada producto,  ella sale a vender a las casas del mismo cantón, aunque es un poco cansado pero es de esa forma como ella obtiene algunos ingresos para apoyar en el hogar. Así también ella apoya en las actividades agrícolas, pues su esposo además de trabajar como albañil trabaja en la agricultura.

Dinora utilizará el crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas que utilizará su esposo en la producción de granos básicos, pues por el momento no cuenta con los recursos suficiente para comprarlos por lo que necesita que se le apoye económicamente. 

Ella en un futuro desea establecer una granja de pollos de engorde, para poder obtener de fondos suficientes para la compra de los insumos agrícolas. Así también aprovechar los desechos de los mismos para fertilizar la tierra, también seguir trabajando para que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Dinora, age 29, is a very hard-working woman.  In spite of only having a sixth grade education, she sells perfume and catalog products in order to be able to help with the household expenses.  Her husband is a bricklayer, and he covers the biggest part of the expenses.  Dinora struggles to be able to get her three year old son and her one year old son ahead.  She pays them a lot of attention because they are the ones that motivate her to get ahead.

Dinora has been doing this business activity for five years.  She sells the products and gets 25% of the price of each product.  She goes out to sell at the houses in the same canton.  Even though it is a little tiring, this is the way she gets some income to help in the household.  She also helps with the agricultural activities.  In addition to working as a bricklayer, her husband works in agriculture.

Dinora will use the loan to buy the agricultural supplies that her husband will use in the production of basic grains.  At this time she does not have enough resources to purchase them.  That is why she needs the financial support.

In the future she wishes to establish a chicken farm to fatten chickens.  She will do this in order to be able to get enough funds to buy the agricultural supplies.  She will also be able to take advantage of their dropping to fertilize the land.  She will also continue working so that her children do not need anything.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies that her husband will use to produce basic grains.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor,  de 30 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene un hijo y reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira con sus padres e hijo. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando maíz, frijoles y café. Esta producción la vende en la misma zona. El piensa en darle asistencia a su finca y ha solicitado un préstamo por 8,000 lempiras para aplicarle foliar y fertilización para  poder sacar mejor cosecha. Su plan es crecer como productor y formar una familia digna.
texts.en:
Victor, age 30, is single and has a son.  He lives in a village in the Gracias municipality in Lempira.  He lives with his parents and his son.  He has always devoted himself to growing corn, beans, and coffee.  He sells this production in the same area.

He plans on providing maintenance to his farm.  He has requested a loan for 8,000 lempiras to apply leaf fertilizer and fertilizer.  He will do this in order to be able to get a better harvest.  His plan is to grow as a producer and to be part of a family he can be proud of.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and leaf fertilizer for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Nidia Ester

texts.es: Desde el año 2008 Nidia emprendió su pequeño negocio, actividad que aprendió de su padre, tambien comerciante, quien le enseñó a su familia "a ser independientes, para que les fuera bien y poder satisfacer sus necesidades". Nidia sueña con ampliar su negocio para contribuír con el desarrollo de su familia, pues aspira a ampliar su circulo de clientes y mas adelante tener  varios puntos de venta.  Los productos principales de su oferta son el calzado, la perfumería, cremas y ropa en general, la cual vende a crédito trabajando todos los fines de semana desde las 2 hasta las 6 de la tarde. En sus ventas utiliza guias especializadas de productos, pues está afiliada a empresas que son sus principales proveedoras y les compra una parte a crédito y la otra parte de contado. Sus vecinos y los referídos de estos son sus principales clientes y con ellos plantea incrmentar sus ventas. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará ropa, calzado y perfumería. con mas inversión impactará sus ventas y con ello obtendría mayores ingresos que son la razón de que un credikiva sea muy efectivo.
texts.en:
Nidia established her small business in 2008.  She learned this business activity from her father, who was also a merchant.  He taught his family to be independent so that they would do well and be able to satisfy their needs.

Nilda dreams of expanding her business in order to contribute to her family’s development.  She wants to widen her circle of clientele.  Later on she wants to have various places for sales.  The main products that she sells are shoes, perfume, creams, and general clothing.  She sells on credit, and she works on the week-ends from two until six in the afternoon.  For her sales she uses specialized product guides.  She is affiliated with companies that are her main providers.  She buys for part credit and part cash.

Her neighbors are the people they refer to her are her main customers.  She plans to increase her sales to them.

That is the reason that she turns to a Kiva loan.  It is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy clothes, shoes, and perfume.  This greater investment will impact her sales.  She will get greater income, which is the reason that a Kiva loan will be very effective.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfume, and creams.

loans.name: Plan 3000 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PLAN 3000” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Miriam es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de refrescos,  venta de carne, servicio de construcción, venta de mantas, servicio de transporte, taller de costura, venta de plantillas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Miriam es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su zona y formo un grupo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre y su hermana hace varios años, ya que ellas comercializaban este producto, mismo que era muy comercial en el mercado. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Plan 3000 communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional center.  It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors.  Miriam is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank engage in are varied and include selling food, selling soft drinks, selling meat, construction service, selling blankets, transportation service, seamstress shop, and selling insoles.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business people where Miriam is a member.  She says that she joined by invitation from a representative of the institution who went to her area and formed a group.

She currently has a business selling blankets.  She says that she learned this business from her mother and her sister several years ago.  They sold this product, and it was very salable at the market.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy wool wholesale).  She will get the wool at the markets in the city of El Alto.  After making the blankets she will sell them at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is in a common-law marriage and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health services and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel tiene 38 años de edad, trabaja fuertemente para sacar adelante a su familia la cual la conforman, su esposa que trabaja en el mercado, sus 3 hijos y 1 hija, de ellos solo un hijo es mayor de edad el cual lo apoya en las labores agrícolas. 

Fidel se ha dedicado a trabajar como albañil desde que tenía 14 años de edad, así también se dedica en su tiempo libre a cultivar la tierra, él siembra maíz y frijol, en esta actividad le apoya su hijo quien ya es mayor de edad.

El crédito lo utilizará para comprar insumos agrícolas, anteriormente él junto a su hijo hacían fertilizante artesanales, pero debido a que su hijo estudia y él trabaja todo el día no lo han podido elaborar, así que solicita apoyo para comprar los fertilizantes, pues ya comenzó la época de siembra y no cuenta con los fondos para comprarlos.

En un futuro Fidel quiere dedicarse a cultivar hortalizas, pero por el momento está trabajando como albañil para poder ahorrar y más adelante establecer su parcela, donde cultivará pepino, pipían, rábano y repollo, los que piensa comercializar en las casas vecinas y en el mercado que trabaja su esposa.
texts.en:
Fidel, age 38, works very hard in order to get his family ahead.  His wife works in the market, and he has three sons and one daughter.  Only his oldest son helps him with the agricultural work.

Fidel has been working as a bricklayer since he was 14 year old.  He uses his free time to cultivate the land by growing corn and beans.  His son, who is now an adult, helps him with this business activity.

He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies.  Previously, he and his son made fertilizers.  However, due to the fact that his son goes to school and he works all day, they have not been able to make it.

That is why he is requesting help to buy the fertilizers.  The season for planting has already started, and he does not have the funds to buy the fertilizers.  

In the future Fidel wants to devote himself to growing vegetables.  However, for the moment he is working as a bricklayer in order to be able to save.  Later he will establish is plot of land where he will grow cucumbers, pumpkins, radishes, and cabbage.  He plans to sell them at neighboring houses and at the market where his wife works.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina, 44 years old, is married and has four children, two in school. Antonina works very hard to provide for them. 

For the past 20 years, Antonina has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Antonina would like to save enough money to expand her business and to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is a hardworking 19-year-old man. He is studying at a university, taking BS Elementary Education. 

Jeffrey has three siblings and he is someone who is very dedicated to his studies and the love of his family. His father works as a motor cab operator and he works at various things to move forward. 

Jeffrey is requesting this loan to pay his school tuition fees. His goal is to continue working and to encourage his siblings to continue studying so that they both prepare themselves and become professionals.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

Janet would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Janet's business profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. Janet looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Janet hopes that her business will yield increased profits and dreams that her children will be able to finish their education until college. She meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized in fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina, 50 years old, is married and has eleven children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 11 years, Ludivina has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from selling artificial flowers.

Ludivina has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store. Ludivina has previously borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Abia

texts.en:
Abia, 35 years old, will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer for rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. Abia wishes to use the profits from his farming to invest in his business so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lydia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lydia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her store

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marites is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, spices, cooking oil, vegetables, etc., for her business.

Marites has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, spices, cooking oil, vegetables, etc., for her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 27 years old. She is married to a farmer and they both have three children; they all go to school. She will use the Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer for use during rice production: they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during rice production.

loans.name: Gjelina

texts.en:
Gjelina is seeking your financial help to prepare the agricultural land and to buy corn seeds for seasonal planting. She does agriculture/animal husbandry for earning an income; she’s got pigs and sells piglets; she plants in large quantities beans and corn and in small quantities seasonal veggies and she works for pay as well in a fish factory, whereas her husband works in construction. 

Gjelina is 45 and a mother of three, 19, 15 and 13; all of them go to school. Prior to the current location, they lived in very rural Albania where villagers did not even have electrical power and the roads to the village were tiny ones and unpaved. “It was very difficult living in our previous village back then, yet, after we left about fifteen years ago, things took a better turn. The roads are much better now and vehicles go all the way up and also there is electricity going to every household," said Gjelina.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and prepare the agricultural land for planting

loans.name: Clyndel

texts.en:
Clyndel started the business two years ago. This loan will be used to  buy more grocery goods. This will allow her to keep her business open in order to continue stocking up with more products, and with a greater variety to satisfy her customers' diverse tastes and needs. This loan will result in higher sales and a higher income for Clyndel.

Clyndel tells us that her biggest desire is to continue working at her store, offering better service and new products to her customers. By doing this, she will have more financial stability and can enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to  buy more grocery goods.

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.en:
Juvenal is 32 years old. He will use the Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer for use  during rice production: he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during rice production.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during rice production.

loans.name: Elrynn Joy

texts.en:
Elrynn Joy  wants to improve her living situation in the future. She studies in a university taking Elementary Education. She  has three siblings who are still depending on her parents. She is determined to finish her course in order to gain a better job and wants to help her siblings to provide a better education in the future. She wants to become a good teacher in the future.
 
She has joined GDMPC and has requested a loan to pay her tuition fees. She is thankful enough to GDMPC for being a part of her journey.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees

loans.name: Jeneta

texts.en:
Jeneta is  married with four children and lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a general store in the local community to earn a living. 

She has been in her business for six years, earning well enough that she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods

loans.name: Jerelyn

texts.en:
Jerelyn is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education at a university and wants to improve her family's living situation in the future. She is determined to become a good teacher and wants to help her parents as they get old.
 
She has joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative and borrowed a loan to pay her tuition fees. She is thankful to GDMPC for being a part of her journey.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education in a university and wants to improve her family's living situation in the future. Her parents earn from working in a utility as government employees, but because Joy has a big family of six siblings, their income is not enough to afford to send all of them to school. Joy was determined to finish her course in order to gain a better job, and she wants to help her parents when they get old. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to pay her tuition fees. She is thankful to GDMPC for being a part of her journey.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Lambert

texts.en:
Lambert is 31 years old. He is married with three children. He will use the Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer for use during rice production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.name: Asiel

texts.en:

He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. He wishes to invest the profits from his farming in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a used boat and nets for fishing. His previous nets were stolen.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is 48 years old. She and her husband work as rice farmers. She will use this Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers for use during rice production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. She wishes to invest the profits from her farming into her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production.

loans.name: Al- Ikhla Al- Rawtha Group

texts.en:
Al- Ikhla Al- Rawtha is a group that consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They requested a loan of 260,000 YER from AMB.

Maryam is the leader of the group. She is a 34-year-old engaged woman, living with her family in their own house. She has a health diploma. Recently, she has been an employee in a private hospital in the capital city of Sana'a. From this job, she receives a good salary. In reality, this salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. 

Unfortunately, the house where she lives is very old and it needs renovation from the inside and her father is unable to renovate the house. For this reason, Maryam applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase paint to renovate the house from the inside.

Maryam looks forward to expanding her business more through opening her own clinic beside the hospital where she works.

loans.use: to purchase paint to renovate the house from the inside.

loans.name: Emile

texts.en:
Emile is a 30-year-old married father of one child who has been working in manufacturing aluminum since ten years ago. In 2007, he established his own business and he developed it in a well-managed way.

He is working hard on developing his factory to stay capable of covering his family's needs and to improve their living. Thus, for this reason he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy updated machines necessary for his business development.

Emile is working hard to develop his business, and to make sure that he can provide his family with the necessary things they need.

loans.use: To buy updated machines necessary for his business development.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is very thankful for the loan assistance previously extended to her. She used that loan to buy spare parts and accessories for her Jeepney and to maintain it. Her earnings were a big help to her family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, for 13,000 Philippine pesos, to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance for her Jeepney. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Analyn dreams of good health and easy living for her family. She also hopes that their business will always be operational. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies. 

Note: Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater Jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, Jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her Jeepney.

loans.name: Enma Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia Enma Beatriz  se dedica al negocio de artesania,la socia vende  tejidos,chompas,mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Enma Beatriz works in the handmade crafts business. She sells weavings, sweaters, blankets, and looms. She sells different weavings and works from 8:00 a.m. until  7:00 p.m. She has been in this business for 8 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand the business selling weavings and looms. She is asking for the loan to buy weavings, sweaters and looms. 

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy weavings, sweaters and looms.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 23 years old. He lives in a sector in Misamis Occidental with his five siblings and his parents. He is a university student majoring in Elementary Education. He is only one step away from graduation. He is planning to find a better job after he graduates. He wants to earn a better income in order to support his family financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis that is not helping them to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Michael has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees.

loans.name: Mwiiuria Self Help Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with three school-aged children, and in her mid-thirties. She has been a farmer for eight years. She keeps a dairy cow that has just calved and also plants beans in her small plot of land. She wakes up early in the morning to milk her cow and sells the milk at a local shopping center.

Elizabeth is a member of the Mwiiuria self-help group in Kerugoya. She intends to use this loan to buy a solar lamp. This is not her first loan through Juhudi Kilimo. She used the previous loans, which she is currently paying back, to buy a dairy cow and construct a zero-grazing housing unit. 

Elizabeth believes that this solar lamp will supply her family with an inexpensive source of light and make them safe from ailments brought about by smoke from kerosene lamps. This will greatly improve her life. She will use the money saved from using the solar-powered lamps to offset some of her children’s school fees and home food expenses.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp for use in her home.

loans.name: Bidii Kamugunda Self Help Group

texts.en:
Wallace is 41 years old. He is married and has four children. His children go to a local public school and in their spare time they help their parents on their farm. He is a member of the Bidii Kamugunda Self-Help group.

Wallace started farming 14 years ago and he says that this is the best legacy his father has given him. He keeps one dairy cow and plants maize and beans in his 3-acre farm. He will use the loan to purchase solar lamps from d.light. He says that the lamp uses the sun to charge so he will no longer have to buy paraffin from the local shopping centre. He wakes up early in the morning to milk his cow, and this lamp will give him good light when he is milking. The lamp will also give his son good light to study at night. 
 
It is his dream to continue growing his farm and to diversify in other investments, to increase his sales, and to enable his children to go to school so that they can find formal jobs.

loans.use: Purchase d.light lantern

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 52 years old. She is married with four children. She will use this Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers for use during rice production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. She wishes to invest the profits from her farming in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production.

loans.name: Dilcia Marina

texts.es:
Doña Dilcia tiene una edad de 34 años, es ama de casa y agricultora dependiendo sus ingresos económicos de la actividad del café la cual asistió a la escuela hasta quinto grado ya que sus padres no tenían los suficientes recursos económicos para apoyarle y que ella pudiera continuar estudiando. De su matrimonio tiene tres hijos quienes viven con ellos y por los cuales agradecen a Dios por estar estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad. Como anteriormente se menciona su negocio e ingresos para sus familia dependen de la producción de café la cual ejercen desde hace 20 años siendo su padre quien le heredara el terreno donde tiene su cultivo. Como único problema visto en esta actividad son las plagas que atacan este producto de no estar asistido y la roya pues la competencia no es factor problema ya que cada productor tiene sus clientes y su propio mercado pues la zona es muy conocida por la producción de café.
Doña Dilcia solicita en esta ocasión el apoyo económico por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva para poder comprar los insumos y demás productos que ayuden a la protección de su plantación pues en esta temporada es el florecimiento de la misma y las lluvias lo mejor para poder regar y abonar. Los planes que doña Dilcia tiene a futuro seguir mejorando sus cultivos de café mediante la ampliación de su propiedad, nueva siembra de plantillas ya que esto vendrá a incrementar las ganancias y mejorar el futuro para su familia
texts.en:
Dilcia, age 34, is a housewife and a farmer.  Her financial income is dependent upon her coffee business.  She went to school through the fifth grade because her parents did not have sufficient financial resources to support her, and she was not able to continue her education.  She has three children from her marriage.  The children live with them, and she is grateful to God that they are going to the community school.

As mentioned earlier, her family’s business and income depends upon the production of coffee, which they have been doing for 20 years.  Her father left her the land where she has her crop.  The only apparent problem in this business activity is the pest infestation that attacks this product when not cared for and the ‘roya’ [coffee rust].  The competition is not a problem, and each producer has their customers.  Her own market is an area that is well-known for coffee production.

Dilicia is now requesting financial support from the different Kiva lenders.  This is so that she will be able to buy supplies and the other products that help protect her crops.  During this season it is the flowering of the plants and the rains that make it the best time to be able to water and fertilize.

Dilcia’s plans for the future are to continue improving her coffee crops by expanding her property and to plant new pants.  This will bring an increase in the profits and improve the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to take care of her coffee crops.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is age 48. She is married with four children. She has spent 20 years in the business of producing rice. She has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers for use during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. She wants to invest the profits from her farming in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production.

loans.name: Tumanyane Group

texts.en:
Peace is an old client, aged 40 years and a member of the Tumanyane group. She has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 (five hundred thousand shillings only) to buy fertilizers to add to her banana plantation. She is a farmer with a banana plantation and a cow for milk. She is married with two children, aged 19 and 11 years. Both attend school at the moment.  

Peace is a hardworking woman from Bushenyi, and her clients are the town people who regularly buy matooke (bananas) and milk from her. The bananas are a staple food in the area; it is a type of plantain that is cooked. She is also a salary earner at the Ishaka Adventist Hospital and works as a nursing assistant there. Her dream is to attain financial stability to enable her to educate her children and give them a better life. She is faced with the challenge of unfavorable conditions which are unpredictable, but is determined to do her best and achieve her targets when given the loan money.

In the photograph is the Loan Officer at the center with a name tag and one other member who opted not to get a loan during this cycle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa wants to buy welding tools for his welding profession. He works for pay at a service shop where they repair mainly agricultural tractors, as seen in the photograph. He also owns his own shop where he offers services for smaller agricultural equipment.
Musa is a married father of four who does welding and also agriculture as his professions; in particular, he plants fodder and vetch and sells it to locals. The village where he resides doesn’t have much agricultural land for planting, thus most of the locals engage in fishing since their village is located by Lake Ohrid. Some of the locals own little taverns where they serve only fish and other local meals such as corn bread and pickles.

loans.use: to buy tools for his welding profession

loans.name: Najla

texts.en:
Najla, 64, is a widowed mother of four children. She has made special medical and beauty creams and hand crafts for the last 16 years  to support her family and cover almost all of their living expenses.

Najla's business is developing gradually, but she needs external support to increase her production. She is acquiring a loan to buy special raw material necessary for her products which will increase her inventory. She hopes to continue to develop her products and be able to reply to different customers' requests.

loans.use: To buy special raw materials necessary for her to make medical and beauty creams.

loans.name: Ibtissam

texts.en:
Ibtissam is a 51-year-old married woman whose husband works in carpentry. She is a mother of five children to whom she is devoted faithfully with her husband to provide them a good quality of living. 

In 2003 Ibtissam established a grocery shop to cover the increasing demands of her family with fourteen years of experience. Her business faced delays in its launch due to some health problems.  Now her business is going well. 

Ibtissam is an ambitious woman who believes in growing opportunities; thus she acquired a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car for work-related purposes, which will help her buy more products from several dealers with special prices. 

She hopes to stay capable of developing her business to make sure she can cover almost all of her family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy a car for work-related purposes, which will help her buy more products from several dealers with special prices.

loans.name: Karlo

texts.en:
Karlo previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories, and for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another loan, this time for 15,000 PHP, to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Karlo hopes to operate one more jeepney unit and dreams to give his children a quality education. He meets up every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Mbayuwayu Group

texts.en:
Ally is a businessman, aged mid thirties with two schooling daughters. He has had a business of gengeduka (produce stall), selling fruits, vegetables, and other shop items. He has been in this business for three years now and is able to make a good profit each month. Ally runs his business from 7 AM to 8 PM daily. 

He is requesting a fourth loan through Tujijenge Tanzania which he will use to buy genge fruits and vegetables to resell. Ally used the previous loans (all of which he paid back successfully) to maintain his business stock of fruits and vegetables.  His capital is now greater than before and he serves more people, though people still demand yet more additional products. He is so thankful for Kiva's loan support. He dreams that one day he will be able to open a big shop selling the same and other items. Ally gains a profit which he used to cover school fees and home food expenses.
