He will share this loan with his loan group, Mbayuwayu, which totals twelve members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy genge fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Klodiana

texts.en: Klodiana previously bought a dairy cow with your financial help; now she needs your help again but this time is to cover for the medical expenses of a surgery she has been scheduled to have soon, on her herniated disc.

loans.use: to pay for a surgery she has been scheduled for

loans.name: Mukandekezi

texts.en:
Mukandekezi is aged 54. She will use the Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer for use during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for use during rice production.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 25 years old. He is married with one child. He will use the Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer for use during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during rice production.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Hello World!!!  Here is Stella, a very energetic farmer living on her two acre farm in Chuka. She is married and has four children. On her farm she has dairy cows, poultry, maize, bananas, these are her main source of income.  Stella also has a personal retail business. Farming is her hobby, but more especially attending to her farm and animals. Her greatest challenge comes about when there is lack of enough rainfall, and also marketing her farm produce.
Stella has a desire to expand her farm by bringing in more poultry which will increase production of eggs and thus increase income. This increase in income, Stella says, will allow her to increase output and therefore increase income and so her family will have improved living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Gs Amor Y Paz Group

texts.es:
La Señora Margarita, tiene 55 años de edad, habita en la comunidad de Flor del Valle en el Oriente de Honduras es Madre de 6 hijos, Su actividad es la Producción de Plátano, cuenta con más de 25 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad, con el crédito que a solicitado lo usara para Compra de Abono y Fertilizante y le contribuirá a tener una mayor producción y mejorarar sus ingresos en su hogar, además de ayudarle a cumplir sus compromisos financieros contraídos.
Doña Margarita su sueños es darle una buena educación profesional a sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños.
José, Henrry, Gerardo, Francisco y  Javier son muy unidos en su grupo y todos se dedican a la agricultura ya que es una zona productiva y es lo que la mayoría de personas de la comunidad hace en el sector.
Todos ellos tienen sueños de salir adelante y mejorar su situación económica ya que les gustaría apoyar mas a sus familias.
texts.en:
Margarita is 55 years old.  She lives in the community of Flor del Valle in eastern Honduras.  She is the mother of 6 children.  Margarita has a business producing bananas.  She has more than 25 years of experience in this line of work.  She will use the loan that she has requested to buy chemical and organic fertilizers.  This will help her to increase her production and her household income.  In addition, this will enable her to satisfy some financial obligations that she has.  

Margarita dreams of providing her children with a good professional education and improving their living conditions.  The support that she is receiving from this loan will help her to achieve these goals.

Jose, Henry Gerardo, Francisco and Javier are very united in this group.  They are all farmers, because this is a fertile area, and so this is what most people do who live in this area.  All of them have dreams of getting ahead and improving their financial situation, because they would like to provide more support to their families.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Twanzana Kasenyi Group

texts.en:
Wilson, 32, is married with four children and one more dependent who is an orphan. They all attend school.  His major source of income is a retail business. He started his retail business in the year 2003 with high hopes of earning enough to educate his five children and look after his family. He is a hardworking man who earns additional income from selling pork at his butcher.  

Wilson is a member of the Twanzana group and is a first-time borrower. He has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX. He hopes to use the loan money to buy more items for his retail business which is located close by where he lives with his family. His major challenge is competition from other retailers. Despite the challenge of competition, Wilson is determined to work hard and compete to be able to achieve his long time dream.

In the photograph, ten group members are featured with the loan officer in the center with an ID badge.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise for his retail shop

loans.name: Makah 2 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Makah 2 and consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.
 
Makya is a 45-year-old married woman. She is the leader of the group. Makya lives with her family in their own house. She is an uneducated woman, but she is very dynamic and vigorous. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. Many years ago, Makya and her husband purchased land and later built their own house. The family lives in their own house, but the yard is not a paved surface. Makya is requesting a loan of 25,000 YER to purchase paving for the yard of their house. 

Makya's dream for the future is to build another floor on their home and renovating them. She hopes to send her children to a private school.

loans.use: to buy paving for the yard of their house.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MILENIUM III, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio  tiene 58 años de edad  tiene 3 hijos y  es soltero, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una institución púbica, él socio  lleva buen tiempo trabajando para esta institución el cual le va bien gracia al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la educación de sus hijos.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y  se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The loan recipient is a member of the village bank MILENIUM III, located in the district and province of Calca, in the state of Cusco. He is 58, single and has 3 children. He works for a public institution and has been there for some time. It's going well because of his daily dedication to his job. He wants to continue this work so that he can support his family.

He asks for a loan for his children's education. He feels grateful for the loan and promises to meet his payments.

loans.use: to support his children's education

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр начинал свой бизнес около 20 лет назад. Он купил одежду и продал ее на рынке в одном из близлежащих сел. После этого он закупил большое количество обуви, которая к сожалению не пошла. Александр был вынужден продать ее по низкой цене, чтобы вернуть вложенное. Так методом проб и ошибок Александр нашел свой товар и покупателей к нему.

Сейчас Александр занимается выездной торговлей. В основном он продает женскую и мужскую кожаную обувь. Торгует в нескольких небольших селах, а также на привокзальной площади в своем городе. 

Александр хочет развивать свой бизнес дальше. Он просит предоставить кредит в размере 25,000 гривен для закупки летней обуви. В дальнейшем Александр планирует открывать новые торговые точки, увеличивать торговый оборот, улучшать быт своей семьи.
texts.en:
Alexander started his own business almost 20 years ago.  He initially bought clothing, which he resold at the market in a nearby village.  He later bought a large quantity of shoes, which unfortunately didn't work very well.  He had to sell his merchandise at a low price, just to recuperate his investment.  This is how, by trial and error, he finally found the right merchandise to sell and the customers to sell it to.  

Alexander now works as an itinerant retailer, selling mostly women and men's  leather shoes.  He sells his merchandise in several small villages as well as in his own town, in front of the train station.  

Alexander wants to continue to develop his own business.  He is taking a loan of 25,000 hryvnia to buy summer shoes.  In the future, he is planning to open new retail outlets, to increase his working capital and to improve the day-to-day living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of summer shoes.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallos, pollos, gallinas, cerdos, su negocio se encuentra en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 33-years old. She lives with her children in the Oyotún District, a rural zone whose population make their livings in agriculture, sales and livestock. The district is located in the Chiclayo Province, which is a part of the Lambayeque Region on Perú's northern coast.

María Mercedes makes her living raising and selling animals, like ducks, roosters, chickens, hens and pigs. Her business is located in the back of her home. She has requested a loan of 2 000 nuevos soles (USD $725) to purchase animal feed to fatten her animals and thereby earn a greater income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a 35-year-old woman with three children who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has owned his tailoring shop for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Ghazala also provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute to the household.
 
Ghazala needs sewing supplies such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, and machine oil for her business use, but cannot afford to purchase them. She has applied for a loan that will enable her to purchase these accessories and help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Ghazala is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies such as needles, thread and machine oil for her own use at her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Anaclet

texts.en:
Anaclet is 24 years old. He has spent seven years in the rice production business. He will use this Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers for use during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to use during rice production.

loans.name: Donancia

texts.en:
Donancia is 40 years old. She is a mother of three children, and they all go to school. She will use this Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers for use during rice production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming he wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for use during rice production.

loans.name: Kaniziyo

texts.en:
Kaniziyo, 32,  is a father of four. He will use his Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers for use during rice production: He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during rice production

loans.name: Jorge Enrrique

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 27 años de edad, no estudió pues sus padres nunca lo motivaron a ir a la escuela, hasta hoy ahora él se propuso aprender en un programa de alfabetización que se impartió en la comunidad, el que el aprovechó y aprendió a defenderse con lo de leer y escribir, está acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, es la que se encarga de cuidar los pequeños, los niños no van a la escuela todavía, en casa solo vive el núcleo familiar.

Él  se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, por el tipo de actividad de la zona es que se dedican solamente a la agricultura, ha sido un hombre responsable que sabe de su compromiso como padre y esposo, el trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, nadie más se dedica a la actividad, y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 AM a 11:00 AM.

El préstamo será invertido en la preparación de la  tierra para la siembra, hoy que viene la época de invierno, con el préstamo pagara personas quien le ayuden con los trabajos, lo demás del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para el cultivo del maíz. 

El poder tener primero lo más necesario para la familia, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad del arrendamiento de la tierra y la compra de los insumos que necesitará.  Con la prestación de servicio que realiza y con las cosechas del de cultivo pagará la cuota del crédito y ahorrará para los gasto de la familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 27-years old.  He never went to school, as his parents never encouraged him to do so.  Until now.  Jorge decided to go to a literacy program being offered in his community.  He took advantage of the opportunity and learned to hold his own in reading and writing.  Jorge is married.  His wife is a homemaker and takes care of the little ones.  The children don't go to school yet.  Only the nuclear family lives in their home. 

Jorge makes his living in agriculture.  He has dedicated himself to this business for more than 20 years.  Where he lives, the people only work in agriculture.  Jorge has been a responsible man who is aware of his obligations as a father and a husband.  His work is close to his house, and he gets there on foot.  He works alone, and does so from 6:00 AM to 11:00 AM.

The loan will be invested in preparing the land for planting, as winter is approaching.  With the loan, Jorge will also pay people to help him with his work and invest the remainder in supplies for growing corn. 

Jorge's first priority is to have the things his family needs most.  He hopes to keep working, as long as god provides him with the gifts of life and health.  The loan will help Jorge to meet his needs of renting his land and purchasing the supplies he will need.  With the work he does and the harvest of his crop, Jorge will pay off his loan and save for the family's expenses.

loans.use: to prepare his land for planting and to pay people to help him with his work.  The remainder of the loan will be invested in the purchase of corn-growing supplies.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 1 hijo, vive en su casa propia en el distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza y piqueos en local destinado para su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de maíz amarillo que le permita la elaboración de Chicha de jora, una bebida típica de costa del Perú.
texts.en:
Lucrecia, 50, is married and has one son. She owns her home in the district of La Matanza, a community dedicated to farming, commerce and cattle. It is located in the province of Morropon in the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

She sells chicha de jora [corn beer], beer, and snacks in a store based in part of her home. She has asked Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to buy yellow corn that she will use to make the chicha de jora, a typical drink on the coast of Peru.

loans.use: to buy yellow corn to make chicha de jora [corn beer].

loans.name: Maria Melva

texts.es:
María Melva tiene 45 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, junto a su esposo y 02 hijos en el domicilio se ubica aproximadamente a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Pucara, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La comunidad donde vive el cliente es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se conocen y dan buenas referencias la señora María.

Se dedica a la venta de leche fresca, carne de cerdo, bebidas y crianza de animales menores, actividad que realiza hace 15 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para ganado lechero, lo que le permitirán tener una mejor producción de leche para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Melva, 45, owns the home of rustic materials where she lives with her husband and 2 children, about 15 minutes outside the city of Pucara. The people of this area, located in the province of Jaen in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru, are farmers, merchants and cattlemen.

The community where she lives is a small rural zone where everyone knows each other and gives good references for Maria.

She sells fresh milk, pork, drinks, and raises small animals. She has been doing this work for 15 years. She asks for a loan of 700 soles to buy balanced feed for her dairy cows, which will increase their milk production for her customers.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for dairy cows.

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es: María tiene 62 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien siempre ha estado al pendiente de su familia para dar mejores condiciones de vida. María trabaja la tierra cultivando principalmente, repollos, maíz, frijoles, maicillo, etc. De esta forma ha llevado el sustento a su familia y en la actualidad es lo que le permite continuar apoyando la economía de su familia. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea encementar el piso de la vivienda y  construir un servicio sanitario para lo cual necesita materiales como: arena, cemento, grava, ladrillo, teja, madera y hierro.
texts.en: María is 62-years old and lives in her own home with her family.  She is a very hard-working woman who has always watched out for her family to give them the best life conditions.  María works the land, primarily growing cabbage, corn, beans, sorghum etc.  This is how she has supported her family and is currently what allows her to continue helping with the family's finances.  Out of a desire to improve their life conditions, María is requesting a loan from FUSAI.  She wants to cement their home's floor and to build a bathroom, for which she needs materials such as: sand, cement, gravel, brick, tile, wood and iron.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, gravel, brick, tile, wood and iron to cement her home's floor and to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Carlos Alexander

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, la necesidad de tener ingresos al hogar lo obligó a dejar la escuela y dedicarse a la agricultura junto a su padre y hermanos, está acompañado, su pareja es la que se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y al cuido de los niños, solo la niña de 8 años va a la escuela los otros se quedan en la casa.

Él  se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 18 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, él vive en la cuidad pero su actividad productiva es la agricultura, ha sido un hombre responsable, está criando a sus 3 hijos sin abandonarlos como muchos padres lo hacen hoy en día, el trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa y el recorrido lo hace a pie, siembra en las tierras de su padre que es con quien realiza  la actividad, y su horario de trabajo es de 6: AM a 11:00 am.

El préstamo será invertido para la preparación de la  tierra para la siembra, hoy que viene la época de invierno, con el crédito comprará insumos para el cultivo del maíz ya que lo demás del trabajo es la ganancia que les queda el poner ellos la mano de obra. 

Él sueña con tener lo más necesario para la familia, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudará en satisfacer la necesidad de la compra de los insumos.
texts.en:
Carlos, 32, studied through the fifth grade, but his family needed money so he left school to join his father and brothers working on the farm. He is married and his wife is in charge of the household chores and the childcare - only one of their children, 8 years old, is in school; the rest stay at home. He has been farming for more than 18 years, although he lives in the city. He has been responsible and is raising his three children without abandoning them like many fathers do these days.

He works near his home and commutes on foot, planting on his father's land, with whom he still works. He works from 6am to 11am. The loan will be used to prepare the land for planting. Winter his coming and he will use the money to buy inputs to plant corn, since the rest of the work left is to put in the labor.

He dreams of having all the necessities for his family, which is why he hopes to continue working as long as God gives him health and life. The loan will help him meet a need to purchase these inputs.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting, and to buy inputs for growing corn.

loans.name: Theophile

texts.en:
Theophile is 33 years old. He is married with two children. He has spent more than 10 years in rice production. He will use his Kiva loan to buy more fertilizers for use during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Gapitariza

texts.en:
Gapitariza is 52 years old. She is married and has six children. She will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer to use during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer, in order to increase production. She wishes to invest her farming profits in her business, so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs, during maize production.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomás tiene 51 años de edad, es natural del Distrito de Santo Tomas de Cutervo vive al lado de su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad; dicho Distrito cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en la empresa Sr. Cautivo De Ayabaca, la ruta que realiza cliente es Santo Tomas - Jaén, cuenta además con experiencia en el rubro, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su camioneta rural con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Tomás is 51-years old. He is a native of the Santo Tomas de Cutervo District. He lives with his wife and their two young children who are 8 and 3-years old, respectively. The district Tomás lives in has both water and electricity. It is located in Cutervov Province, which is a part of the Cajamarca Region in the Perú's northern mountains.

Tomás makes his living offering transportation services to passengers in the Sr. Cautivo De Ayabaca company. His route is from Santo Tomas to Jaén. Tomás has a lot of experience in this line of work. He is requesting a loan of 3 000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of tires and to provide maintenance for his mini-van. This will help him to generate a greater income and to thereby improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase tires and provide maintenance for his mini-van.

loans.name: Kihungye Tukore Hamwe Group

texts.en:
Esau is a new client, age 55, and is a member of "Kihungye Tukorehamwe" group, which literally means "let us join up and work together." He is married with four children, ages 18, 16, 14, and 10, who all attend school. He is a hardworking farmer from Mitooma District. His regular customers are the people in Mitooma town and Kashenshero, a neighboring trading center. He has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX to buy fertilizers to use in his plantations. He is faced with the challenges of drought and banana disease, which has affected him so much. However, he has engaged in coffee planting and animal rearing since his banana plantation has been affected. When given the loan money, he hopes to get high quality yields and in the long run become financially stable in order to look after his family.

In the photograph are the group members and the loan officer in the center with a tag. Two of the members have not taken loans during this cycle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Julia Arely

texts.es:
Julia es una joven de 22 años de edad,  que estudio  hasta noveno grado no pudo continuar sus estudios;  porque salió embarazada esto le trunco su sueño de seguir estudiando y alcanzar su sueño de su carrera y como no contaba con el apoyo de sus padres opto por acompañarse, es madre de un hijo de 2 dos años de edad, su compañero de vida se dedica a trabajar en un carro de motorista y  también a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos como el frijol y el maíz, en su vivienda vive junto a su hijo y su  esposo  y son las únicas personas que dependen de ella.

Julia tiene una tienda de la canasta básica en su vivienda desde hace ya 2 años, el negocio lo tiene gracias a una iniciativa que tuvo su padre de instalar su propia tienda y lo hizo gracias a él. El negocio le genera buenos ingresos económicos para su familia, aparte de dedicarse a esta actividad ella también se dedica hacer peinados, cortes, tintes de estilista, es otra fuente de ingreso que tiene, gracias a que su negocio lo tiene en su casa ella no tiene que salir de su casa para trabajar lo habré a las 7 de la mañana y lo cierra a las 7 de la noche comenta que en los tiempos libres de su esposo le apoya en las actividades de en la tienda.  


El préstamo Julia lo utilizara para invertirlo en su negocio, ella quiere comprar ropa para ponerla a la venta en su negocio específicamente comprara ropa para damas niños y caballeros, pues es un producto que sus clientes le preguntan y ella no lo tiene, pero gracias al préstamo le ayudara a satisfacer una necesidad y un sueño de tener su propia tienda de ropa para ofrecerles una gran variedad y estilos a sus clientes. 

Julia desea seguir estudiando en la universidad y terminar su carrera de sus sueños y a la vez estudiar en una escuela de cosmetología, para ampliar más sus conocimientos relacionados en la cosmetología. También, desea ampliar más su tienda y algún día tener más locales de negocios, estos sueños los lograra con las ganancias de su negocio y con mucho trabajo junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Julia is a young woman of 22 who wasn't able to continue her studies after 9th grade because she got pregnant. This cut short her dream of finishing school and becoming a professional, and since she didn't have the support of her parents she decided to take care of herself.

She is the mother of a 2 year old, and her husband works as a chauffeur and also a farmer of basic grains like beans and corn. The small family lives together at home. Julia has a store in their home where she has been selling basic groceries for 2 years. Her father had the idea to install her own store and helped her to do it. The business generates good income for her family. Apart from this, she also does hairstyling and cuts as another source of income. Thanks to having the business in her home, she doesn't have to leave the house to go to work. She is open from 7 am to 7 pm, and her husband helps her in his free time.

Julia will use the loan to invest in her store. She wants to add clothing, specifically men's, women's and children's clothing, because her customers ask for it and she doesn't have it. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to satisfy a need and a dream of having her own clothing store where she can offer a great variety of styles to her customers. She wants to keep studying at the university and finish the degree of her dreams. She also wants to go to cosmetology school to increase her knowledge in that area. She also hopes to amplify her store and one day to have more locations. These dreams will be realized with the profits from her business and with a lot of hard work together with her husband.

loans.use: to buy women's, children's and men's clothing, a product in demand from customers that she doesn't currently carry.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
Since 1997, William has been operating a hardware shop in addition to being a farmer as his major source of income. He grows crops like maize, beans and cassava. He has been able to construct a house to rent, which brings him extra income.

He approached Ugafode for a loan of 3,000,000 to buy fertilizers and seedlings to plant. He expects to pay back the loan using income from selling his crops (in the harvest season).

His dream is to construct a good residential house and educate all his children up to university level. He says, however, that he faces the challenges of weather changes and lack of enough capital. He thanks the Kiva lenders for the overwhelming support. He is hard working.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Bat-Orgil

texts.en:
Mr. Bat-Orgil is 41 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, the second-largest city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2004. His wife runs a grocery store, next to their home. Their children both study at college.

He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT. He will use the loan to buy a plot of land for his elder son. This will enable his son to build his own house and get married. Also, his son will grow vegetables and raise livestock on his land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land, for his elder son.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de  Yanahuara, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Josefina; la socia tiene 72 años de edad y es viuda; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a sus animales  para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

 La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimento y cuyes para su negocio.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Josefina is a member of the communal bank “San Isidro de Yanahuara”. It is located in the Yanahuara district, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

She is a 72-year-old widow. She alternates her daily activities with her business raising animals. She has had this business for years, and it has been going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. 

Josefina raises animals and then sells them to her clients. She wishes to continue working so she can keep supporting her family. 

Josefina is requesting this loan to buy feed and guinea pigs for her business. She is happy for the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy feed and guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Nazha

texts.en:
Nazha is a 45-year-old Palestinian, and a married mother of two. Since Palestinians have limited access to many working sectors in Lebanon, her and her husband were forced to work in agriculture and tend to their crops. Seven years ago she started her own business, to increase her income and develop her living.

Nazha is a hard worker, and her devotion to her children pushes her to provide them a better education in a private school. She acquired a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to settle a part of her children's tuition fees. One day she hopes to cover all the area needs and diversify her vegetable production.

loans.use: to settle a part of her children's tuition fees

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 45-year-old, married mother of six. Her husband sells potatoes in a market. As a Palestinian refugee, Fatima is barred from most working sectors in Lebanon. So, she decided to use her embroidery talents to make some income. For 13 years, Fatima has been selling her embroidery designs to a non-profit organization, in an effort to help make her family more financially stable. She wishes that she had heard of Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, earlier, because her business could have used some help in the past.

Fatima acquired her desired loan. She will use it to buy a car, to provide her with transport she needs to expand her business further.

She hopes that, one day, she can have her own separate shop, where she will be able to display all of her products in a beautiful and attractive way.

loans.use: to buy a car that she needs in order to expand her business further.

loans.name: Anathalie

texts.en:
Anathalie is 56 years old. She is married and has five children. She will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer, in order to increase production. She wishes to invest her farming profits in her business, so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs, during maize production.

loans.name: Montaha

texts.en:
Montaha is a 59-year-old married mother of five. She is a Palestinian refugee, and her husband works in electricity installations. She opened a grocery store 13 years ago which has a good amount of regular clients in the camp that range from neighbors to family friends. All of her clients find Montaha's shop to be a good source of daily goods. Her business is doing quite well, and the revenues earned from it have helped improve her family's living standards.

Montaha has successfully repaid three loans with Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua in the past, and now she intends to purchase a car with the loan that she acquired. This will allow her to search for better products with special, encouraging prices. At the same time, she will help her husband in his business transportation business.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Djiguiyagnouma Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et mil   avec  MINATA AMADOU,  première personne assise  de la droite vers la gauche  de  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SANANKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Djiguignouma III are married women who are, on average, 41 years old and also have an average of four children each.  They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, a village located in Sanankoroba, in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They work with Kiva's Partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their fifth farming loan from the MFI, and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Minata Amadou, seated first from the right in the photo, grows groundnuts and millet.  She plans to use her loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing to maintain 3 hectares of land.  After the harvest, she sells her crops in her village and in Sanankoroba.  Her customers are resellers and consumers.

Minata Amadou is expecting to make an average profit of 90,000 CFA francs per planting.  This profit will enable her to repay her loan, and also to help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of plowing, and to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 44-year-old, married woman. She has two children, one of them attending school. Florence sells crude salt, which she has been doing for 10 years, plus she manages rental units for additional income. She began her business to earn money for school fees, to educate her children to meet her dream. Florence is a hard-working person. Change in weather is a challenge she faces.

Florence is asking for a loan to buy salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy crude salt to sell.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is 34 years old and a married woman. She is running a business, selling milk. She has done this work, with her husband, for 10 years. She has four cows in milk. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the cows and performs the task of collecting milk from them, while her husband sells it to different places, on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together, to support their family.

She has six children; four of them are school-going. She needs to earn much more, to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing, and education. In order to make larger profits, she requested a loan of PKR 50,000. She will use this amount to buy one more cow, to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in milk-production capacity, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more cow, for dairy purposes

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is 54 years old and a married woman. She has been running a business, buying and selling animals, for many years. She buys baby animals, such as goats, sheep and calves, at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out, near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries).

She has gradually improved her business, with the support of Kashf Foundation. Recently, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more cattle. She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of improving her standard of living through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 34 years old and a married woman. She has four children. She has been running a beauty parlor for a period of about 10 years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Through providing her best services, she has become very famous in her street, and she counts a good client list.

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetic products for the parlor. For this reason she obtained her second loan, in the amount of 30,000 PKR, to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams of bleaching and whitening, in large quantities. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy hair and skin care products for use at her salon

loans.name: Mabis De Jesus

texts.es: Mabis  de 45 años de edad habita al sur de la ciudad  y se dedica a la venta de ropa a crédito. Mabis es viuda y madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 24 y 27 años, con quienes habita al sur de la ciudad.  Desde hace 4 años una amiga de Mabis, comercializaba mercancía procedente de una región fronteriza de Colombia, y le propuso negociar con ropa. Así inició y hoy tiene grandes sueños como el de tener un almacén, para mas adelante comprar su casa propia. Su mayor desafío es lograr incrementar sus ventas además de fidelizar a  su clientela y ahorrar.  Para ello Mabis se levanta todos los días e inicia su trabajo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y vende a crédito a su mayor clientela, que son vecinos y referidos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará Ropa como jeans faldas, camisas, blusas y pantalones, con los cuales planea incrementar sus ventas y así mismo sus utilidades, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Mabis, 45 years old, lives south of the city and makes a living selling clothing on credit. She is a widow and the mother of three children, aged 24 to 27, with whom she lives.
 
Four years ago, a friend of Mabis, who was trading goods coming from a region bordering Colombia, proposed that she start dealing in clothing. Thus, Mabis began and today she has great dreams, such as that of owning a store so that she can buy her own house in the future. 

Her greatest challenges are to increase her sales, in addition to fostering  loyalty among her customer and saving.  In order to achieve these goals, Mabis gets up every day and starts working from 8 in the morning until 6 in the evening. She sells on credit to most of her customers, who are neighbors and referrals.

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first funding from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so that she can buy clothing, such as jeans, skirts, shirts, blouses and pants. Her plans are to increase sales and profits, thereby making a successful investment with her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as jeans, skirts, shirts, blouses and pants.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
La socia Carlota se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Carlota, has a grocery store business. The member sells staples, such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. The member works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. The member has had this business for five years and it is doing very well. The member’s dream is to expand her grocery store business. The member is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

The member is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Nissan Group

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a mother of two sons and one daughter, two of them are in school. She is in her early thirties. For six years now, Mwanakombo has supported her family by running two businesses (selling fruits and selling clothing). She works from 8AM to 7PM daily and is able to make a good profit each month.

Mwanakombo has been a customer of Tujijenge Tanzania for five years now. Her family life and businesses are now better than before because she is able to easier pay her kids' school fees and meet other basic needs. With her previous loans - all of which were paid back successfully - she bought more inventories so as to grow her businesses. She earned a profit which she used to buy a plot of land where she is now building. She also paid part of the school fees for her kids and family's food expenses. Mwanakombo will use this loan to restock both of her businesses with new items. Her ambition is to greatly increase her business capital.

She will share this loan with her group, Nissan, which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock both of her businesses with new items.

loans.name: Wazeeran

texts.en:
Wazeeran, age 57, is a married woman. She has three children. She deals in a business of livestock. She has been running this business for many years, with the support of her husband. She buys small animals at low prices, and after raising them a year or two, she sells them to the people of her locality. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk, to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business, to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000, which she will use to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her second loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali, who is a 50-year-old married woman, lives in the village of Ksovrisi. She has a five member family and only one source of income, Lali's son's fixed salary which is hardly enough to meet their basic needs and cover their everyday expenses. In the region, there is a high unemployment rate but self employment helps inhabitants to make living, so the family decided to start their own business. Lali has requested a loan of 2,000 GEL to purchase stock of wood and open a furniture factory. They have already rented a place and bought all the needed merchandise, but they need an investment to start the factory up.

This new business initiative will be lucrative for this motivated woman and her family. They will be able to get a significant source of income from their factory. Lali and her family rely on the goodwill of lenders and will highly appreciate your help for sustaining this desired business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wood and start making furniture.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de mano de obra como obrero de construcción civil, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 100 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el cultivo de arroz y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Andrés is 51 and lives in the district of Buenos Aires, a community dedicated to agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry which is located in Morropon Province within the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.  

Andrés offers services in manual labor as a civil construction worker.  He is requesting a loan of 1,100 nuevos soles to purchase fertilizer for rice cultivation and through this, to have a timely service to offer to his clients.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for rice cultivation

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Erdenetsetseg, 50 years old, lives with her younger son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a nurse at a hospital for more than thirty years. Her younger son is an engineer but currently studying in order to advance his degree. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as cement, planks and fiberglass for a house renovation. After the renovation, she and her younger son will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Seneyiriwaton Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  8 membres du groupe  SENEYIRIWATON II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SAFECORE, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l‘arachide  et mil avec  BIRON MINATA , première personne assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de SANANKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Seneyiriwaton II group are married women who are, on average, 45 years old and also have an average of three children each. They all live in polygamous families in Safecore, a village located in Sanankoroba, in the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

They work with Kiva's Partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their fourth farming loan from the MFI.

Biron Minata, seated first from the left in the photo, grows groundnuts and millet. She plans to use her loan to buy fertilizers and seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing to maintain two hectares of land. After the harvest, she sells her crops to resellers and consumers in Sanankoroba. 

Biron Minata is expecting to make an average profit of 195,000 CFA francs per planting. This profit will enable her to repay her loan, and also to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of plowing, to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: María Olimpia

texts.es:
María tiene 69 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, se casó a la edad de los veinte  años pero el matrimonio no le duró mucho tiempo, procreó tres hijos con su pareja, los que ya son mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven en el extranjero y una hija ya está casada pero vive cerca de ella. Actualmente vive con unas nietas que la cuidan y están con ella siempre, sus hijos son los que la sostienen hoy en día. 

Ella no tiene ningún tipo de negocio, ya su avanzada edad no se lo permite ya que anteriormente era su actividad favorita, desde pequeña su padre le enseñó los trabajos de la tierra, ya por su edad solo se dedica al cuido del hogar y de sus animales de corral, es la que se encarga de todos los quehaceres del hogar.

El préstamo es solicitado para comprar insumos para la agricultura y pago de mano de obra que realiza el trabajo.

Ella sueña con ver su casa cada vez mejor, lo que le dará satisfacción el ver todo lo que ha querido realizado, ya que nos expresa que mientras viva quiere tener las comodidades que no tubo cuando era joven.
texts.en:
Maria is 69 years old, and studied through sixth grade. She got married at the age of 20, but the marriage did not last very long. She had three children with her husband. All of her children are now adults; two of them live outside of the country, and the other daughter is married but lives close to Maria. Currently, Maria lives with some of her granddaughters, who she takes care of and who are always with her. It is Maria's children who now support her. 

Maria does not have any type of business, and her advanced age does not allow it though previously it was her favorite activity.  Since she was a little girl, her father taught her farm work, but now due to her age she can only work in taking care of her home and her barnyard animals.  Maria is the one in charge of all of the household work.

She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies for agriculture and to pay for labor to accomplish this work.  

Maria's dream is to see her house improve over time, which will give her satisfaction to see everything she wanted done while she is alive, and to have the amenities she did not have when she was young.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and pay for labor

loans.name: Zynab Al-Wadi Group

texts.en:
This group is called Zynab Al-Wadi. It consists of five women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 220,000 YER from AMB.

Zynab is a 47-year-old widow living with her children in their own house. She is the leader of the group. She works as a housewife, and her husband passed away several years ago. He was the sole breadwinner of the family, and recently the oldest child became the breadwinner of the family. He is an employee in the private sector. Zynab and her husband had purchased a piece of land and built their house on it. This cost them a lot of money, and unfortunately, they couldn't purchase windows for the rooms, kitchen and bathroom. This causes the rain, sunshine, flies, fireflies and bad bugs to come into the house and cause the family sickness. Zynab needs financial support to improve the conditions of her house and make it safer. As a result, Zynab is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase windows to complete the renovation of their house and looks forward to doing so.

loans.use: to purchase windows to complete the renovation of their house.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She is a hardworking mother who helps her family by doing hand embroidery work in her community. She has been doing it for the past eight years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Sakina earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of thread in different colors along with packs of sequins, beads and pearls. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors along with packs of sequins, beads and pearls.

loans.name: Tumennasan

texts.en: Mrs. Tumennasan is 34 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. Tumennasan has been running an auto repair shop for ten months and her husband works at a cement factory. The house her family lives in has deteriorated over the years and it needs some repair. Therefore, Tumennasan is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy bricks in order to renovate her house. By encasing her house with bricks, it will protect the house from the cold and storms. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and release less smoke into air, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Kweterana Group

texts.en: Grace is a 30-year-old married lady with 4 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She deals in selling fresh foods alongside weaving and farming. She faces the challenges of high taxes and lack of a market. She has a vision to educate all of her children to higher levels of learning. Grace needs a loan to add stock of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Asdeqa Bihan Group

texts.en:
Asdeqa Bihan is a group which consists of three women from Sana'a, Yemen. Last year, this group applied for its first loan from Kiva lenders. After they finished the repayment of the installment of the first loan, they applied for a second Youth loan of 240,000 YER from Kiva lenders. The first loan assisted the group in make a real improvement inside the family. They are very thankful to Kiva lenders for their first loan.

Reem is the new leader of the group. She is a 25-year-old single woman. Reem is educated with a university education. She couldn't find a job in order to improve the condition of her family. She hopes to open a cafeteria beside her house, but she doesn't have enough financial support to do that. She is very dynamic and vigorous. Her family lives in a humble house. Their house lacks many appliances and furniture, and most of them are very old. She can't afford that, so she wants to purchase furniture for the house. Unfortunately, the family doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, Reem requested a loan of 80,000 YER in order to purchase some home appliances such as a new cupboard for the kitchen of the house.

Reem looks forward to opening a cafeteria beside her house in order to help her family with the house expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new cupboard for the kitchen of her house.

loans.name: Rashidan

texts.en: Rashidan is a 57-year-old hardworking woman. She is involved in the work of hand embroidery, and she makes beautiful patterns for the people in her community. Her designs are in high demand and she has managed to gain a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, Rashidan requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way, she would be able to consistently cater to more customers, and she is hopeful that she will increase her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors, and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim, age 35, is a married woman.  Six years ago she started her general store business as her husband’s income is not sufficient to bear their household expenditures. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for 50,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Shamim wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a 46-year-old married woman. She started a small general store at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts for years. She is the mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of juice, rice, oil and sugar along with cleaning products such as soaps and detergents. It will allow her to meet the demands of her customers consistently. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of juice, rice, oil and sugar along with cleaning products such as soaps and detergents.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 27-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all the household expenses, so she initiated her business selling milk. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter tiene 43 años de edad, reside en el Distrito de Morropón, desde hace más de 20 años, la vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio, ubicada en la Provincia de del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de mano de obra como maestro de construcción civil, desde hace varios años, junto a su esposa tienen una bodega que ofrecen cerveza, Walter ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción como ladrillos y cementos para terminar de construir una parte de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Walter is 43 years old, and has lived in Morropón District for more than 20 years. Life in the community is quiet, and most people earn their living in agriculture, livestock, and trade. Morropón District is located in the province of the same name, part of the Piura Region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Walter works as a master builder, and for several years he and his wife have also had a store selling beer. He is seeking a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy construction materials such as bricks and cement, in order to finish building a part of his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as bricks and cement for his home.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen, age 37, is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She has been running this business with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Gs Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
La Señora Luisa, tiene 47 años de edad, habita en la comunidad de La Fortuna en el Oriente de Honduras es Madre de 2 hijos, Su actividad es la Cria de Cerdos, cuenta con más de 5 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad, con el crédito que nos a solicitado lo usara para Compra de cerdos y concentrad, esto le contribuirá a tener una mayor producción y mejorarar sus ingresos en su hogar, además de ayudarle a cumplir con sus compromisos financieros contraídos.
Luisa su sueños es darle una buena educación profesional a sus hijos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños.
Los demás integrantes se dedican a la Agricultura y lo integran; Brenda, Pedro, Fidel, Marco y Trinidad.
Ellos son amigos y tiene una buena relación y comunicación por eso han decidido unirse para salir adelante juntos.

Trojes, Honduras Abril 2014
texts.en:
Luisa is 47 years old and lives in the community of La Fortuna in the east of Honduras. She is mother to two children. She works rearing pigs, and has earned her living this way for more than five years. She will use her part of the loan that has been requested to buy pigs and concentrated feed. This will help her to increase her production and so improve her household income, as well as to meet her financial commitments.

Luisa's dream is to give her children a good professional education and to improve their living conditions. The support that the loan gives her will help her to achieve those dreams.

The other members of the group, named Brenda, Pedro, Fidel, Marco and Trinidad, earn their living in agriculture. They are all friends, and have good relationships and communication with each other. Because of this, they have decided to form a group to move forward together.

Trojes, Honduras, April 2014

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed for her business.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto tiene 60 años de edad, vive en el caerío de Malacasi, una zona rural del distrito de Salitral; es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz. Ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo, actividad que realiza hace más de 15 años, contando con clientela fija, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en compra de cerdos pequeños para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecer su carne, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 60 years old. He lives in the small village of Malacasi, in a rural part of the Salitral District. It is an area where the local people work in agriculture, livestock, and trade, and which has basic services such as water and electricity. It is located in the Morropón Province, part of the Piura Region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Gilberto earns his living selling pork. This has been his occupation for more than 15 years, and he has regular customers. He has requested a loan of 2,500 nuevos soles to invest in buying young pigs in order to fatten them up and sell their meat, which will generate a greater income for his family.

loans.use: to buy young pigs in order to fatten them up and sell their meat.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Doña Lucia es una mujer luchadora la cual está acompañada y es madre de familia de 2 hijos quienes asisten a la escuela de la comunidad y le ayudan a realizar las diferentes tareas que se desarrollan en el campo como. Ella tiene una edad de 39 años y un grado de educación primaria completo gracias al apoyo de sus padres. Doña Lucia se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo y producción de café desde hace más de 15 años como herencia de sus padres que igual se dedicaban a esta actividad ya que es la única fuente económica que en su comunidad y en las diferentes familias que ahí habitan existe. Al final de la temporada su cosecha es vendida a los beneficios de café más cercanos pues son los encargados de comprar el café en la zona con la cual muchas familias se encuentran satisfechas. 
Sus planes son comprar su propio vehículo para transportarse a su propiedad y en el mismo llevar su cosecha, insumos y demás cosas que sean útiles para el cuidado de la plantación ya que normalmente pagar flete y esto hace que sus costos se incrementen. También la compra de un pedazo más de tierra de esa forma seguir sembrando y ampliando más sus cultivos de café, implementar nuevos métodos que conlleven a la disminución de costos sobre el mantenimiento y producción del grano de café haciendo de este atractivo pero con mejores ganancias sobre el mismo al momento de su venta. Por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, foliares, formula cafetalera, urea entre otros que den una mejor y mayor protección a sus cultivos de café para obtener una buena producción al final de la temporada.
texts.en:
Lucia is a hard-working woman who lives with her partner and her two children who attend the community school and help with the agricultural work.  She is 39 years old and has an elementary education thanks to the support of her parents.  Lucia is in the coffee growing business.  She has been in this business for 15 years having learned it from her parents who also work in this activity, which is the only source of income in the community for different families living there.  At harvest time Lucia sells her produce to coffee dealers in the area who buy the coffee.

She has plans to buy her own vehicle to transport  the supplies and other necessary tools for her plantation since she usually has to pay for transportation at harvest time which increases her costs.  She also wants to buy a patch of land to continue planting and expanding her coffee crop, using new methods to decrease costs in maintenance and coffee bean production, making it more attractive in an aim to increase profits.

The loan she is requesting now is to provide better care for her coffee plantation so she will have an abundant crop at harvest time.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Mario Alexander

texts.es:
Mario de 24 años de edad,  estudio hasta bachillerato no pudo continuar con los estudios universitarios porque decidió trabajar para ayudar económicamente a su familia, debido a su situación  no podía continuar estudiando, es soltero tiene una niña de 1 año de edad que vive con él,  en su casa solo habitan su hija y  la mamá de Mario.

Mario se dedica a la carpintería decidió poner este pequeño taller debido a que trabajo en un taller de carpintería y obtuvo experiencia recibió un título que lo acredito para poner su propio taller, tiene dos años de experiencia. Mario comenta que debido a que el taller lo tiene en su casa  no tiene un horario de trabajo definido a veces trabaja hasta noche cuando tiene mucho trabajo, pero que no ha establecido un horario fijo.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar madera, martillos, taladro,  para poder realizar mejor su trabajo, y desea poner otro local y poder tener empleados que puedan hacerle funcionar el taller.

Mario desea para un futuro poder tener una carpintería de alto prestigio,  tener más locales los cuales le beneficiaran para el sostenimiento económico de su familia, desea que su hija pueda estudiar una carrera para que pueda sostenerse en un futuro, comenta que también él desea seguir con sus estudios universitarios para tener un mejor futuro él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is 24 years old. He studied as far as high school, but could not continue to university as he decided to work to support his family financially, and because of their situation he was not able to continue studying. He is single and has a one-year-old daughter who lives with him. He, his daughter, and his mother make up their household.

Mario earns his living as a carpenter. He decided to establish his small workshop as he had worked in a carpenter's workshop and gained experience. He earned a qualification that accredits him to have his own workshop, where he has two years' experience. Mario comments that, as he has the workshop in his home, he does not have fixed working hours, and sometimes works into the night when he has a lot of work.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy wood, hammers, and a drill, to enable him to carry out his work better. He hopes to open another workshop and to be able to employ staff to work there.

In the future, Mario wishes to have a well-renowned carpentry workshop, and to have more branches. These will help him to maintain his family financially. He wishes his daughter to be able to study for a degree so that she can support herself in the future, and he mentions that he too hopes to continue with his university studies so that he and his family can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy wood, hammers, and a drill, to enable him to carry out his work better

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goods for her store such as liquors, fried  foods, sweets, and grain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a 42-year-old married woman. She has seven children. She has been doing tailoring for the past five years to assist her husband financially. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet their household expenses. That is why she started her business at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread along with packs of buttons and laces, etc. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Aisha hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family through all her hard work in her business

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread along with packs of buttons and laces, etc.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto de 58 años de edad,  habita en Barranquilla y se dedica a la producción y ventas de comidas rápidas, desde hace un poco menos de dos años, cuando decidido a emprender una actividad productiva independiente, para dejar de ser empleado. En su negocio vende hamburguesas, pizzas, perros calientes etc.  durante todos los días desde las 4 de la tarde, hasta las 11 de la noche.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado a los vecinos de su barrio, que son sus principales clientes y sus compras las realiza directamente a proveedores de productos alimenticos y salsamentarías, quienes le ofrecen mejores alternativas en precio y calidad.
