Roberto tiene como meta  ampliar su negocio y un gran desafío que es el de posicionarse en el mercado de las comidas rápidas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará harina, salsa y refrescos, con el fin de lograr mejores precios por la compra en volumen haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Roberto, 58, lives in Barranquilla and he makes and sells fast food.  Less than two years ago he decided to start his own business and no longer work for someone else.  He sells hamburguers, pizza, hot dogs, etc. every day from 4:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m.  His sales are made on a cash basis to neighbors in the area who are his main customers.  He buys his ingredients directly from food and sauce suppliers who offer the best price and quality.

Roberto's goal is to expand his business.  His greatest challenge is to position himself well in the fast food market.  He is requesting his first CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation which he will use to buy flour, sauces and soft drinks.  His aim is to get better prices y bbuying in bulk, which will make the loan a successful investment.

loans.use: To buy flour, sauces and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine, a display cabinet and raw materials.

loans.name: Djiguignouma V Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJIGUIGNOUMA V  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le arachide et mil  avec   BINTOU ,première personne debout de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SANANKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 185.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djiguignouma V Group are all married women who are, on average, 37 years old and have three children.  They live in polygamous families in the village of Bougoula, in Sanankoroba (the second administrative region of Mali).

All the women want to improve their businesses during the winter months so they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their sixth loan, the previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Bintou (standing on the far right in the photo) grows peanuts and millet.  She plans to use her loan to buy seed and other agricultural products, and pay for labour costs for three hectares of land.  She sells her produce in the village and in Sanankoroba, to retailers and consumers.

Bintou expects to make an average profit of 185,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  She will use this to repay her loan and help her husband with the day-to-day costs of their household.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs and buy seeds and other agricultural products.

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
BENDIYA  est un groupe de l’association Danaya du quartier Bamananking, de Ouelessebougou. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 51 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de Kadiatou qui est assise de la droite vers la gauche. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à Ouelessebougou dans la  Préfecture de KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : tomates,  oignons, poivres et choux.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire. 
Kadiatou, qui la présidente du groupe et très connue à Ouelessebougou, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (tomate, oignon, poivre, aubergines et choux).  Elle s’approvisionne à Ouelessebougou auprès des grossistes et vend ses condiments à Ouelessebougou, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.    
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
The Bendiya Group is part of the Danaya Association in Bamananking, a district of Ouelessebougou.  The women, who are members of the group, know one another through family and local ties.  They are, on average, 51 years old and have three children.  All the women are married and live in large, traditional families in Ouelessebougou, in the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

The women have all been operating as retailers for several years and are much sought after for their products, tomatoes, onions, pepper and cabbages.  In order to respond to the growing demands of their customers, the group began working with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago.  This will be their fourth group loan.

Kadiatou (sitting on the far right in the photo) is the group president and sells food ingredients.  She is very well-known in Ouelessebougou and is an excellent saleswoman.  She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of food products (tomatoes, onions, pepper, aubergines and cabbages).  She buys her supplies from wholesalers in Ouelessebougou, and resells them in the same town.  She sells on a cash or credit basis to various customers.

Kadiatou hopes to make a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA which will enable her to repay her loan and reinvest in her food business.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Jader Wadid

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Jader en su negocio de venta de licores, con su credikiva él pudo comprar refrescos, bebidas que fueron encargadas por sus clientes y por eso logró aumentar su capital de trabajo, sus ventas y sus utilidades. Sus ingresos familiares han mejorado notablemente y el negocio se fortalece cada vez mas. Jader dice a sus financiadores : "  Muchas gracias por ese importante apoyo, espero seguir recibiendolo para continuar progresando." En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva nuevamente a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará a solicitud de su clientela licores, refrescos y variedades. Su inversión prevee ser muy provechosa pues se acerca el segundo semestre del año y requiere estar preparado con un fondo de efectivo suficiente para no ser inferior a la demanda de la temporada.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Jader in his liqueur sales business. With his Kiva loan he was able to buy soft drinks, drinks which his customers were asking for and so he was able to increase his working capital, his sales and his profits. His family income has notably improved and the business is getting stronger and stronger. Jader says to the lenders:

"Thank you very much for this important support. I hope to continue receiving it to continue making progress."

Currently he is applying for a new Kiva loan, with which he will buy, by request of his customers, liqueurs, soft drinks and novelties.

This investment is expected to be very profitable, as the second part of the year is approaching and he needs to be ready with adequate supplies, to have no less than the demand of the season.

loans.use: to buy liqueurs, soft drinks and novelties.

loans.name: Gs Buena Vista El Prado Group

texts.es:
El Señor Elmo tiene 52 años de edad, es padre de cuatro  hijos convive con su esposa , Su actividad es la producción y  venta de plátano, cuenta con más de 10 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad alterna a la caficultura este tipo de actividad tiene un muy buen mercado tanto local como nacional y fuera de las fronteras de nuestro país ya que trojes esta fronterizo con Nicaragua.
Don Elmo con el crédito que solicita le contribuirá a tener una mayor producción de sus productos, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros contraídos. Con este préstamo el comprara abono y fertilizantes para la tierra de sus cultivos.
Don Elmo su sueños es darle una buena educación profesional a sus hijos  y mejorar las condiciones de vida de el y su familia, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños.
Los demás integrantes se dedican también a la producción de Plátano  y caficultura y lo integran; Rufino, Erlyn y Humberto.
 Trojes, Honduras Abril 2014
texts.en:
Señor Elmo is 52 years old, the father of four children, living together with his wife. He works in banana production and sales. He has more than 10 years working in this area, which he alternates with coffee growing. This type of work has as good a market locally and nationally as well as beyond the borders of our country as Trojes is on the border with Nicaragua.

Don Elmo will use the loan to have better production of his products. This will enable him to increase his earnings to cover his family expenses and his financial contracts. With this loan he will buy manure and fertilizer for the land of his crops.

Don Elmo's dream is to give a good, professional education to his children and improve the living conditions of his family. With the help of the loan he receives this will help him reach his dreams.

The other members also work in banana production and coffee growing and they are: Rufino, Erlyn and Humberto.

Trojes, Honduras, April 2014

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for the land where they grow crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment and make adjustments to his first business premises where he will give kung fu classes, bringing about a social revolution and keeping young people away from armed gangs

loans.name: Gs Brisas Del Rio 1 Group

texts.es:
La Señora Darcis es una persona honesta, responsable vive con  sus  hijos en un municipio al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  elaboración y venta  de  tortillas.
Darcis el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de Maíz  y leña, Con el préstamo ella espera  el aumento de las ventas debido a que contara con más materia prima  en  esta  temporada alta que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan y así cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo desea  que  mejore la calidad  de vida, y  Se vea reflejado  con esta inversión.
Darcis en unos años espera que su negocio este posicionado como la tortillería  más grande y  conocido como única de su municipio  y poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se conviertan en personas de bien para la  sociedad.
Emérita  su negocio es pulpería  y  elaboración  y venta  de  baleadas.
Rosa su negocio es   venta  de  tortillas  desde hace 3 años.

Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo del 2014
texts.en:
Darcis is an honest, responsible person. She lives with her children in the south of Honduras. Her business is making and selling tortillas.

Darcis needs the loan to buy flour and firewood. With this loan, she hopes to increase sales as she will have more primary ingredients in this high season with which to provide for customers who visit, and thus cover her necessities. She also wants to improve her quality of life, and she sees that possibility with this loan.

Darcis hopes that in a few years, her business will be positioned as the biggest and best-known tortillería in the town, and to be able to continue supporting her children so that they become good people in society.

Emerita's business is a a grocery store and making and selling baleadas [wheat flour tortillas].

Rosa has been in business selling tortillas for 3 years.

Choluteca, Honduras – May 2014

loans.use: to buy flour and firewood for their business.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Luis es un hombre de mil batallas vividas a lo largo de su vida. Vive en el municipio de Fredonia, Antioquia acompañado por sus 5 hijos.
Se dedica a un negocio de café-bar en una vereda de dicho municipio, allí ofrece servicio de bebidas, licor, golosinas y frituras, el sitio es bastante frecuentado por campesinos de la zona.
El decidió iniciar con este negocio por la necesidad de trabajar al ver que por su avanzada edad se le dificultaban algunas tareas y ya no podía realizarlas.
Es un hombre humilde y servicial, con gran reconocimiento en la región.
El solicita un préstamo para darle una renovación a su negocio comprando silla y estanterías, en realizar trabajos de pintura y cambio de imagen al local y por ultimo en la compra de inventario de licores y frituras para vender.
De esta forma tendrá siempre los productos disponibles para sus clientes y aumentara sus ventas.
texts.en:
Señor Luis is a man who has fought a thousand battles throughout his life. He lives in the community of Fredonia, Antioquia, and has five children.

He has a café-bar in a small village in his community, where he sells drinks, spirits, sweets and fried food. The premises is very popular with people living in this rural area. He decided to set up this business because he needed to work but found that because of his age, certain jobs were difficult and he was unable to do them. He is a humble and helpful man, with a great deal of knowledge of the region. 

Luis is requesting a loan to renovate his business, buying chairs and shelves, painting and changing the image of the premises, and lastly, buying more stocks of spirits and fried food to sell. in this way, he will always have products available for his customers and increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy chairs and shelves, and to paint the premises and buy spirits and fried food.

loans.name: Alcira Maria

texts.es: Alcira de 35 años de edad se dedica a la venta de productos capilares y cosméticos desde el año 2013, cuando un familiar suyo, que habita en la capital de Colombia, le propuso la apertura de un negocio similar en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Alcira decidida inició su propia aventura empresarial, comprando a distribuidores mayoristas, para vender en un mercado doméstico donde impactan sus ventas, hoy sus vecinos son sus principales clientes  pues Alcira tiene su propio almacén donde ellos pueden escoger lo que necesiten.  Su meta es ampliar la variedad de sus productos y finalmente comprar su vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará champú, esmaltes tintes, cremas y colonias. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará porque se incrementarán sus ventas y con ello sus utilidades.
texts.en:
Alcira, 35, has been selling hair care products and cosmetics since 2013, when a relative who lives in the capital [i.e. Bogotá] suggested her to open such a business in Barranquilla [a city on the Caribbean].

Alcira decided to do so and started her own entrepreneurial adventure. She bought from wholesalers and started selling locally. Her customers are mainly her neighbors, since Alcira has a store where they can pick whatever they need. Her goal is to widen the variety of the products she sells and be able to buy her own house.

Alcira is applying for a CrediKiva, which will be her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy shampoo, nail polish, creams and perfumes. This investment will help her to improve her business because both sales and profits will increase.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, nail polish, creams and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Luis Andres

texts.es: La historia de Luis se remonta desde su juventud cuando solo tenía 15 años de edad, cuando inicio sus labores como vendedor ayudo por sus tíos y hermanos que lo involucraron y lo envolvieron en este mundo mercantil tiempo después logro constituir su propio negocio con el cual lleva 12 años oferta productos desde tenis, juguetería, ropa íntima, bolsos entre otros, solicita un crédito para la compra de variedad de surtido para mejorar la variedad y calidad de algunas de sus líneas de venta, también para cubrir eventos como día de la madre, día del padre. Su principal sueño es poder construir su casa propia dándole la mejor calidad de vida posible a sus tres hijos, la mayor la evidenciamos en la foto junto a Luis y seguir prosperando en el tiempo.
texts.en: Luis' story started in his youth. When he was only 15 years old he started working as a salesman, helping his aunts and uncles and siblings who involved him and took him into the commercial world. A while later, he was able to build his own business, which he has had for 12 years. He offers products from tennis shoes, toys, underwear, bags, and more. He is asking for a loan to buy a variety of stock to improve the selection and quality of some of his sales lines. He also wants to cover events such as Mothers' and Fathers' Day. His main dream is being able to build his own house, giving his three children the best possible life and continuing to prosper in life. The oldest is seen in the photo with Luis.

loans.use: to buy a variety of piñatas, toys, tennis shoes and clothing for Mothers' and Fathers' Day season.

loans.name: Gs Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.es:
La señora Emelida  es una mujer emprendedora, y dedicada a su negocio,  el cual es la venta de abarrotería desde hace 3 años, esto lo realiza en su casa de habitación, ella cuenta con los clientes principales de su zona, se levanta muy temprano para atender su negocio, ella tambien se dedica a la venta de huevos de gallina criolla, cuajada, maíz y frijoles, como tiene variedad su negocio es muy visitado.
Doña Emelida está solicitando 3,000.00 lempiras para la compra de maíz, frijoles, azúcar, leche y pan para abastecer su negocio y con esto darle un impulso al mismo.
Doña Emelida sueño es poder comprar una refrigeradora ya que hay productos que le gustaría vender pero necesitan refrigerarse para que no se arruinen, ella solicita el préstamo de forma grupal con las siguientes personas.
Delmy se dedica a la venta de plata, ropa y zapatos desde hace 3 años.
Nely se dedica a la venta de chorizo en masa desde hace 1 año.
Santos se dedica a la venta de donas, desde hace 1 año.
Elea se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 16 años.
Todas ellas no cuentan con el capital suficiente para sus negocios y se unieron para comprobar que a unión hace la fuerza.
Danlí, Honduras – Abril  2014
texts.en:
Señora Emelida is a very enterprising woman, who is dedicated to her 3-year-old business selling groceries. It is located in her home, and her customers are mainly people living in the area. She gets up very early to attend to her business, and also sells creole hens' eggs, curd cheese, corn and beans. She is very popular because she sells such varied items.

Emelida is requesting 3,000.00 lempiras to buy corn, beans, sugar, milk and bread to stock her business and give it a boost. Her dream is to to able to buy a refrigerator, because there are products she would like to sell but that need to be kept cold so that they don't go off. She is requesting the loan as part of the following group of people:

Delmy, who has made a living selling silver, clothing and shoes for three years.
Nely, who has made a living selling sausage rolls for one year.
Santos, who has made a living selling doughnuts for one year.
Elea, who has made a living selling tortillas for 16 years.

None of them have enough capital for their businesses and have come together to show that there is strength in unity.

Danlí, Honduras – April, 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, sugar, milk and bread for her business.

loans.name: Gloria Estella

texts.es:
Gloria tiene el sueño y el objetivo de ser independiente.
Ella trabajaba en casas de familia haciendo aseo por días u horas con el fin de obtener ingresos para su familia, pero actualmente tiene el proyecto de montar un negocio de producción y venta de arepas de queso y de choclo.
Con esta actividad podrá tener un trabajo estable que le aporte los recursos necesarios para la educación y crianza de sus hijos.
Ella solicita un auxilio económico para comprar materia prima como maíz y queso, comprar una plancha para asar, un molino eléctrico, realizar adecuaciones a su cocina para trabajar más cómodamente y comprar una pipeta de gas.
Todos estos elementos le permitirán realizar su sueño de tener su propia empresa.
Este oficio lo aprendió al lado de su madre quien le enseño las recetas y agradece profundamente a estas entidades que apoyan el crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Gloria's dream and goal is to be independent. She used to work in people's homes for days or hours to earn income for her family, but now her project is to open a business selling cheese and corn arepas. 

With this activity she will be able to have a stable job that brings in the income she needs to educate and raise her children. She is asking for financial help to buy ingredients such as corn and cheese and a press for cooking, as well as an electric grinder and to make improvements in her kitchen to work more comfortably and buy a gas tank. All of this will allow her to make her dream come true of having her own business. She learned this trade at her mother's side. She taught her the recipes. She is deeply grateful to these entities that support business growth.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as corn and cheese, to buy a press for cooking, an electric grinder, and to make improvements in her kitchen and to buy a a gas tank.

loans.name: Yenifer

texts.es: Yenifer de 27 años de edad habita en el municipio de Soledad donde tiene un negocio; ella ofrece servicios de video juegos, desde que su cónyuge de condición militar, falleció dejándola viuda y con una pequeña hija de 3  años de edad. Así fue como Yenifer con ahorros propios,  compró televisores, juegos tecnológicos y emprendió su actividad,  impulsada por la necesidad de ofrecerle un mayor bienestar a su hija.  Hoy funciona en un local de una  segunda planta y trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, tratando de ofrecer a sus clientes un servicio permanente y de calidad.  Sus compras las hace de manera permanente, porque requiere innovar, por eso sus metas están relacionadas con adquirir tantos juegos como sea posible. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará Xbox y un equipo PlayStations, toda esta inversión es con el fin de incrementar sus ventas, las que poco a poco la llevarán al cumplimiento de sus sueños de prosperidad..
texts.en: Yenifer is 27 years old. She lives in the own of Soledad, where she has a video game business that she has had since her spouse died. He was in the military and he left her a widow with a 3 year old daughter. Then Yenifer, with her own savings, bought televisions and technological games and started this  activity, driven by the need to offer her daughter more well being. Today she has it in a locale in the second floor and she works from 8 in the morning until 7 at night, trying to offer her customers a permanent, quality service. She makes her purchases permanently because she needs to innovate. That is why her goals are related to buying as many video games as possible. Right now, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy an Xbox and a PlayStation, This investment is to increase her sales, which little by little will make her dreams of prosperity come true.

loans.use: to buy an Xbox and a PlayStation.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis es una mujer de 36 años que cansada de la monotonía del hogar tomo al decisión junto con su esposo de montar un negocio en el cual ella pueda aportar un grano de arena al hogar, se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar como arroz, panela, huevo, aceite, frijoles y pastas el capital para montar la empresa lo obtuvo gracias a su esposo pero se enfrenta con una dificultad y es que tiene que reubicar su negocio ya que es un establecimiento hecho con tablas pero está muy oculto y muchas personas no logran captarlo, con este prestamos se beneficiara enormemente Denis ya que puede vender más víveres aportando capital en su hogar para el mantenimiento, educación y vivienda de sus tres hijos
texts.en: Denis is a 36-year-old woman, who, tired of the monotony of home life, made the decision with her husband to set up a a business through which she can do her bit for the household. She makes a living selling groceries such as rice, blocks of sugar cane sweet, eggs, oil, beans and pasta. She obtained the capital needed to set up the business from her husband, but she is faced with a problem. She needs to relocate her business, as it is an establishment made of wooden boards, but is it very hidden and many people are unable to find it. This loan would be of great help to Denis, as it will enable her to sell more groceries, bringing money into her home for maintaining, educating and providing for her three children.

loans.use: to relocate her business, as it is currently located in a site that the majority of people are unable to find.

loans.name: Seneyiriwaton  I Group

texts.fr:
Les  8 membres du groupe  SENEYIRIWATON I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SAFECORE, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
Les spéculations cultivées sont  l‘arachide et mil  avec  SALY YIRIBATIE , deuxième personne  debout de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de SANANKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Seneyiriwaton I Group are all married women who are, on average, 42 years old and have four children.  They all live in polygamous families in the village of Safecore, in Sanankoroba (the second administrative region of Mali).  

The women would like to improve their agricultural businesses during the winter months, so they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their fourth loan.

Saly Yiribatie (standing second from the left in the photo) grows peanuts and millet.  She plans to use her loan to buy seed and other agricultural products, and pay labour costs for two hectares of land.  She sells her produce in Sanankoroba to retailers and consumers.

Saly Yiribatie expects to make an average profit of 175,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  She will use this to repay her loan and help her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs and buy seed and other agricultural products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as soles, uppers, leather glues, faux leather, buckles, lacemaking thread etc.

loans.name: Noemy Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Noemy manifiesta que como ahorradora y beneficiaria de los servicios y productos que ofrece la cooperativa COMIXMUL se siente muy feliz de formar parte de tan buena institución misma que aconseja a sus demás amigas y compañeras de trabajo en el campo que no están afiliadas, que lo hagan ya que ninguna otra institución va a apoyarles como lo ha hecho la cooperativa con ella impartiendo capacitaciones, talleres técnicos para formar micro empresas entre otros servicios de los cuales se siente muy agradecida. Ella agradece grandemente por haberle apoyado con los fondos Kiva ya que con dicho apoyo ella planto una manzana de tierra y dio asistencia a la plantación vieja para aumentar la producción y obtener excelentes resultados. Es por la misma ocasión que ella nuevamente se acerca a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para solicitar un segundo financiamiento para nuevamente invertir en sus cultivos de café en esta nueva temporada los cuales necesitan fertilizantes, abono, foliares entre otros insumos que son de gran ayuda para el crecimiento y desarrollo de la planta incluyendo su protección.
texts.en: Noemy says that as a saver and beneficiary of the services and products offered by COMIXMUL, she is very happy to be a part of the institution. She herself counsels her friends and other farmers who aren't members, telling them to join because no other institution is going to support them like the cooperative has supported her. It has given her trainings and technical workshops for forming micro-businesses, as well as other services for which she is very grateful. She is enormously grateful for the support with the Kiva funds. With it, she planted a plot of land and helped her previous plantings to increase production and obtain excellent results. It is for the same reason that she is approaching the COMIXMUL cooperative again to ask for a second loan so she can invest again in her coffee crops for this new season. She needs fertilizer and foliar sprays, among other things, that will be a big help for growth and development of the plant, including protection.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and foliar spray to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and accessories to stock her business.

loans.name: Seneyiriwaton Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  7 membres du groupe  SENEYIRIWATON III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SAFECORE, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l‘arachide  et mil avec  FA SALI , première personne assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de SANANKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 185.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Seneyiriwaton III Group are all married women who are, on average, 49 years old and have four children.  The women live in polygamous families in the village of Safecore, in Sanankoroba (the second administrative region of Mali).  As they would like to improve their agricultural businesses during the winter months, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their fourth loan.

Fa Sali (sitting on the far left in the photo) grows peanuts and millet.  She plans to use her loan to buy seed and other agricultural products, and pay the labour costs for two hectares of land.  She sells her produce in Sanankoroba to retailers and consumers.

Fa Sali expects to make an average profit of 185,000 francs CFA over the loan period.  This will be used to repay her loan and help her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to pay labour costs, and buy seed and other agricultural products.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
SOUTOURA est un groupe de l’association MINATATON de KELEYA. Il regroupe  des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de MARIAM  qui est la première personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KELEYA dans la  Préfecture de BOUGOUNI (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : tomate, choux, carotte, poivre et oignon. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire. 
MARIAM, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à KELEYA, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, acheter 10 paniers de tomate et 3 sacs d’oignon.  Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnant et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à KELEYA, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
The Soutoura Group is part of the Minataton Association in Keleya.  The women members know one another through family and local ties.  They are, on average, 37 years old and have four children.  All the women are married and live in large, traditional families in Keleya, in the Bougouni prefecture (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali).

The group members have all been selling food products (tomatoes, cabbages, carrots, pepper and onions) for several years, and are much sought after.  They aim to respond to the growing demands of their customers, so they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their eleventh group loan.

Mariam (standing on the far right in the photo) is the group president and sells food ingredients.  She is an excellent saleswoman.  She plans to use her loan to buy ten baskets of tomatoes and three sacks of onions, from wholesalers locally and in the surrounding villages.  She makes her sales on a cash or credit basis to both men and women in Keleya.

Mariam hopes to make a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan and reinvest in her food business.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Yury Estefania

texts.es:
Yuri es una humilde joven de 24 años de edad la cual desde muy joven decidió emprender su vida lejos de su familia y hoy en día vive con su pareja con la cual tiene un pequeño hijo de dos años de edad, al ser una pareja joven han tenido dificultades para el sostenimiento de su hogar y es por esta razón que hace poco tiempo Yuri comenzó con la venta de gallinas y pollos para aportar un capital a su hogar, al tener un buen movimiento de ventas, monto una tienda donde distribuye abarrotes, legumbres y granos y ya que es la única tienda en ese sector las ventas han sido muy buenas, ante tal éxito Yuri quiere potenciar su local y es por esto que solicita un crédito para la compra de legumbres, abarrotes y granos comprando más variedad de productos que normalmente no los vende.
Su principal sueño es tener un autoservicio para beneficiar a todo el sector y que su calidad de vida mejore brindándole a su pequeño hijo que podemos ver en la foto una excelente vida y apoyo
texts.en:
Yuri is a 24-year-old humble young woman who, since she was very young, decided to set out on her life far from her family and now lives with her partner with whom she has a young child, two years old. Being a young couple, it has been difficult to sustain their household and because of this, a little while ago, Yuri began to sell hens and chickens to bring in some capital to her household.  Having good sales, she opened a store where she sells groceries, vegetables and grains and since it is the only store in this area, sales have been very good. With such success, Yuri wants to strengthen her shop and to do this, she asked for a loan to purchase vegetables, groceries, and grains, purchasing more varied products that the normally doesn't sell.

Her primary dream is to have a self-service shop to benefit the whole area and that her quality of life improves offering her young son, who can be seen in the photo, an excellent life and support.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, groceries, and grains are not commonly sold in her store, attracting a greater variety of customers.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita tiene 58 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida. Ella se dedica a la agricultura y venta de leche, de esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y apoya con la economía de la familia. Felicita solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un corredor en su vivienda dado que cuando llueve el agua se filtra. Con el monto solicitado comprará lamina galvanizada, polines, hierro, cemento, arena y ladrillo,etc.
texts.en: Felicita is 58 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner. She works in agriculture and selling milk and in this way sustains her household and helps the family economy. Felicita asks for this loan from FUSAI to invest in constructing a passageway in her home since when it rains, the water comes in. With the amount she has requested, she will purchase galvanized metal sheets, purlins, iron, cement, sand, and bricks, etc.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheets, purlins, iron, cement, sand, and bricks, etc., to build a passageway for her home.

loans.name: Angel Hector

texts.es:
Angel tiene 41 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive los padres en San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar.

Pertenece a la venatnilla Santiagueña esta ubicada en la Parroquia Santiago pertenece al Canton San Miguel A 15 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel en esta ventanilla tiene 12 miembros que se dedican a actividades agricolas como simbre de maiz, frejol  y papas, ademas de esto se dedican a la crianza de animales como gallinas ponedoras y engorde de cerdos.

Angel se dedica a la agricultura y a la siembra de maiz,cebada, papas, trigo y habas, ademas a la crianza de chanchos,gallinas,vacas lecheras y borregos. Nesecita el credito para la compra de semillas fertilizantes abonos ademas balanceado de engorde, crianza para los animales y vacunas para evitar las enfermedades de los animales.

Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de San Miguel  y vende en la Feria en San Miguel. Ha enfrentado desafios como las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos.

El sueño es mejorar los cultivos para aumentar los ingresos. Le gusta pasar con la familia y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Angel is 41 years old, single, has no children, and lives with his parents in the San Miguel province of Bolivar.  He belongs to the Santiagueña communal bank which is located in the Santiago Parrish in the San Miguel Canton, 15 minutes from the San Miguel Office.  This communal bank has 12 members who make a living through agricultural work like planting corn, beans, and potatoes.  In addition to this, they also raise animals such as laying hens, and fatten pigs.

Angel makes a living in agriculture by planting corn, barley, potatoes, wheat, and broad beans.  He also raises pigs, chickens, dairy cows, and sheep.  He needs the loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, and manure, in addition to feed for fattening and raising the animals, and vaccines for avoiding sickness among them.  He makes his purchases in the city of San Miguel and sells his products in the San Miguel Fair.  

He has faced challenges like plagues and sickness of his crops.  His dream is to improve his crops so that his income increases.  He likes to spend time with his family and play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and manure, in addition to feed for fattening and raising the animals, and vaccines for avoiding sickness among them.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 28 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Pomahuaca, en casa propia de material rustico junto con su conyugue y sus dos menores hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad, de los cuales el primero cursa secundaria y el otro primaria en colegio del Distrito, cuenta con muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Oscar es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, ubicado en el Caserío Yambolon - Pomahauca, con una experiencia en el rubro de 6 años.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para utilizarlo en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha.
texts.en:
Oscar is 28 years old. He lives in the Pomahuaca district, in his own house made of rustic materials. He lives with his wife and their two children, who are 12 and 8 years old. Both children go to the district school - one to primary school, and the other to secondary school.

Oscar’s personality as well as his work have a very good reputation in his community. This community is located in the Province of Jaén which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Oscar works in farming, especially on his coffee plantation which is located in the village of Yambolon – Pomahuaca. He has approximately six years’ experience.

He has asked for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles which he will use for farming, for procuring and using pesticides, fertilizers, and to pay for hired laborers for the harvest.

loans.use: to continue farming, to procure and use pesticides.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty emprendió su aventura de negocos  desde el año 2012, cuando por necesidad  de aumentar sus ingresos  familiares, decidió emprender un negocio de producción y ventas de comidas rápidas, dulcería, miscelanea  y ventas de minutos a celulares. Sus ventas de productos de miscelanea, dulceria y minutos, las realiza diariamente en su vivienda, de manera directa al consumidor, mientras la venta  de comidas rápidas, la realiza acompañada de un familiar los fines de semanas. Sus principales compradores son sus vecinos y transeúntes por los que trabaja 12 horas diariamente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un creidkiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  insumos para comidas rápidas, dulcería, recargas y planes de minutos. Con este crédito aumentará su capital de trabajo , el surtido ofrecido será mejor y las ventas y utilidades reflejaran un incrmento importante. Su meta continua es lograr fortalecer su negocio y continuar mejorando sus ingresos y sus utilidades.
texts.en: Betty began her business adventure in 2012 when, because of the need to increase her family income, she decided to open a store that produces and sells fast food, sweets, miscellaneous goods, and also sells cell phone minutes. She conducts the sales of miscellaneous products, sweets, and daily minutes in her home, directly to the consumer while the fast food she sells with the help of a family member on weekends. Her primary customers are neighbors and passers-by for whom she works 12 hours every day. At the moment, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase supplies to make fast food, sweets, and cell phone charges and minutes. With this loan, she will increase her working capital, the stock she offers will be better, and her sales and profits will show a significant increase. Her on-going goal is to strengthen her business and to continue improving her income and profits.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for fast food, sweets, and cell phone charges and minutes.

loans.name: Om- Arafat Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om- Arafat. It consists of four women, from Sana'a, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising women. They took a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Rahmia is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of four children, living with her family in their own house in Sana'a. She is the leader of the group. Rahmia is an uneducated woman but she is a very dynamic and active woman. She has a lot of housework. Her house lacks a washing machine so she always washes the family's clothes with her hands. This work makes her very tired. Rahmia can't afford to live in this condition. She asked her husband to buy a washing machine for the house. Unfortunately, her husband's income is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. For this reason, Rahmia applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a washing machine to help her wash the clothes.

Rahmia looks forward to renovating the house of her family. She also hopes to provide her children with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine to help her in washing clothes.

loans.name: Anindita Self Help Group-2

texts.en:
Rina (hand raised) 42, lives in Kailashpur village, South 24, West Bengal. She has studied till eighth grade. She is married and has a son and two daughters. Her son has completed his 12th grade and graduated and her daughters are still going to school.

Rina started her Badri bird business (parakeet birds) few years back.  She is a member of “Anindita” Self-Help Group. She is asking for a loan to construct a shed and to buy feeding pots and feed. 

She hopes for the fulfillment of having a big shed with more birds, and to run the business on a larger scale. She also wishes to give good education to her children.

The other member from the same group, Tapati, is requesting a loan for pond digging. The loan will definitely help these women to bring more stability for their families.

loans.use: to construct a shed and to buy feeding pots and feed

loans.name: Maliton  I Group

texts.fr:
Les  7 membres du groupe  MALITON I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOKORO, un des villages de KELEYA, dans la Préfecture de BOUGOUNI (Région de Sikasso, République du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution les, prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le gombo, l’arachide et le riz  avec  SIRA , deuxième personne  debout de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau de KELEYA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Maliton I Group are all married women who are, on average, 41 years old and have five children.  They live in polygamous families in the village of Bokoro, in Keleya district, Bougouni prefecture (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali). 

The group members would like to improve their agricultural businesses during the winter months, so they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their fourth loan, all the previous loans were fully and correctly repaid.

Sira (standing second from the right in the photo) grows okra, peanuts and rice.  She plans to use her loan to buy seed and other agricultural products, and pay the labour cost for 0.25 hectares of land.  She will sell her produce in Keleya to retailers and consumers.

Sira expects to make an average profit of 35,000 francs CFA over the loan period, which she will use to repay her loan and help her husband provide for the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to pay for labour, and buy seed and other agricultural products.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 42-year-old single female with four children who all go to school. Margret sells crude salt and works seven days a week, 12 hours a day. She has been in business for 10 years. Margret began the business to sustain her family and needs money to buy salt to sell. She has hopes of educating her children despite the challenge of unpredictable weather changes.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Genaro

texts.es:
Pedro  vive en el distrito de San jose de los molinos, Ica; Perú. Cada día trabaja con mucho esfuerzo en su empleo como obrero en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder sacar adelante a sus abuelos, ya que actualmente vive con ellos.

Pedro esta agradecido con los prestamistas ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida  y seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un negocio propio y mejorar su calidad de vida de sus abuelos.
texts.en:
Pedro lives in the district of San José de los Molinos, Ica, Perú. Every day, he works with much effort in his job as a worker in an agricultural estate in his city, with which he can have income to help his grandparents get ahead, since he lives with them currently.

Pedro is grateful to the lenders since, thanks to their help, he will be able to make some improvements on his house and in this way will be able to improve his quality of life and continue working to realize his greatest dream: to have his own business and improve his grandparents' quality of life.

loans.use: to make improvements on his house.

loans.name: Kotessa Group

texts.fr:
KOTESSA est un groupe de l’association KANKELE de Ouelessebougou. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’habillements à l’image de Djenebou qui est la première personne assise de la gauche vers la droite  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles au quartier  BAMANANKING de Ouelessebougou. 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente d’habillement : tissus et pagne. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt solidaire. 
Djenebou, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à Ouelessebougou, excelle dans la vente d’habillements. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 12 pièces de tissus.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses habits à Ouelessebougou, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir le reste dans son activité d’achat vente d’habillements.
texts.en:
Kotessa Group belongs to Kankele Association of Ouelessebougou. It regroups married women who got to know each other through bonds of kinship and community. They average 41 years of age and five children each, and live in large traditional families in Bamananking, in Ouelessebougou.

They've been in the retail business for several years, and are very much in demand in their business. They buy and sell clothing: fabrics and pagnes (colorful African cloth).

They run various businesses, such as buying and selling clothing, just like Djenebou, the woman sitting on the left in the photograph.

Eager to satisfy the growing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. They are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan).

Djenebou is the group's president and is very well known in Ouelessebougou. She excels in selling clothing. She intends to use her loan to buy twelve lengths of fabric.

She gets her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and retails her clothes in Ouelessebougou, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 20'000, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her clothing business.

loans.use: to buy 12 lengths of fabric

loans.name: Nelfi Esther

texts.es:
Nelfi es una astuta empresaria que aprovechando unas tierras que le quedaron pro herencia las puso a producir inmediatamente con cultivos que distribuye en la plaza de mercado, no contenta con la demora en la producción de cultivos decidió adecuar un espacio para la venta de pollos y cerdos con los que se apoyaría económicamente en las épocas difíciles de cosecha. 
Nelfi es una mujer de 35 años de edad madre de 4 hijos, con una gran aspiración la cual es tener un negocio bien estructurado para acercarse masa este objetivo solicita un crédito para la compra de alimentos para animales, compra de pollos y cerdos para tener un buen material de trabajo y hacer atractivo su negocio al público buscando siempre destacarse entre la competencia
texts.en:
Nelfi is an astute businesswoman who is taking advantage of the land she has inherited. She immediately put it to use with crops that she sells in the market square. Not content with the delay in crop production, she decided to use the space to sell chickens and pigs which will help her economically during the difficult times of the harvest.

Nelfi is a 35-year-old woman and mother of 4 children, with the great aspiration to have a well-structured business and, to get closer to achieving this objective, she asks for a loan to purchase animal feed, buy chickens and pigs in order to have good working material and make her business attractive to the public; she is always looking to stand out from the competition.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed, pigs and chickens to build her business and stand out from the rest.

loans.name: Drake

texts.en:
Drake, aged 46, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with four children and all attend school. He deals in produce and works six days a week. He started his business in 2011. A restaurant supplements his income. He hopes to expand his business. Weather changes and price fluctuations hinder his business.

He is acquiring a loan to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase Herbalife products to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia de 45 años de edad,  es casada, su esposo se dedica a la ganadería. La cliente es panificadora y agricultora, con ella se involucran sus hijos, aparte de ese negocio se dedica a criar cerdos y ganado. El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas. Mejorara su vida ya que podrá cultivar. Ella planea en un futuro que el cultivo se desarrolle en buen estado y tenga alta producción.
texts.en:
Lidia is 45 years old and married. Her husband works in ranching. She is a baker and farmer, and involves her children in her work. Apart from this business she raises pigs and cattle.

She will use the loan to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticides and weed-killer. This will improve her life as she will be able to grow crops. She plans a future in which her crops develop in a good condition and in which she has a high level of production.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticides and weed-killer.

loans.name: Pritilata Self Help Group-2

texts.en:
Narendrapur is a rural village of the South 24 Paraganas district in West Bengal, India. The four active women entrepreneurs of this village formed a Self-Help Group (SHG) named “Pritilata”. This SHG is managed by the local NGO “Sabuj Sangh” to expand their existing business. Kakali, the lady standing second from left with hand raised, is an energetic lady in her forties and lives with her husband, son and a daughter. Her son is about to complete his B.A.  while her daughter is studying in 10th grade. 

Kakali has been running a rice mill. Her husband also helps her to manage this unit. People in her community come to her for rice husking. She earns an annual net income of around 40,000 INR from the business. Out of this income she has been able to manage her household expenses in a decent manner. Kakali is now planning to increase her income by expanding the business as there is a growing demand in the locality. Kakali wants to buy another mini rice-huller machine from the loan amount to give better service to the customers. She is certain that this will generate a good income for her because in her locality most people do paddy cultivation.

Kakali hopes to save enough money to repair her house and give better education to her children.

The other three members of the group, Archana, Parul and Kajol are requesting a loan for rice mills and paddy cultivation.

loans.use: to buy mini rice-huller machine

loans.name: Mah Jabeen

texts.en:
Mah Jabeen is 44 years old and is a married woman. She has been in business running a beauty parlor for many years. She offers many options to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Through providing great services, she has become very famous in her street.

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetic products for the parlor.  For this reason, she applied for a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful that she will be able to cater to more customers time after time.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been selling crockery for the past seven years with her husband (pictured here). They offer various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls etc. Her husband helps her by selling them to the people of their community and in the local market. They make enough income to contribute to the family income. For the improvement of their business Shamim contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 40,000. It will allow her to purchase more crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Sarajibon Self-Help Group-2

texts.en:
Sudipa Rani (hand raised) is 27 years old, married, and has a son and daughter. Her daughter is studying in 4th grade and her son goes to pre-school. Sudipa Rani is in the decorating business. She and her husband rent the decorating items for marriages, ceremonies, etc... They earn around 70,000 INR per annum.

Sudipa Rani is the featured borrower of the “Sarajibon” Self-Help Group which consists of five other member. This group is managed by the local NGO “Sabuj Sangha”. Sudipa Rani is requesting a loan to buy more decorating items to attract customers. 

Sudipa Rani is happy and grateful to the investors for their support. Sudipa Rani's dream is to have a large-scale decorating business, where she can comfortably offer her services to customers.
 
The other five members will use their portion for pond digging and repair, paddy cultivation, grocery shop and pisiculture.

loans.use: to buy more decoration items such as lighting

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María Mercedes tiene 60 años de edad, reside en el Caserío Pedregal, desde hace 20 años, vive en casa propia junto a su conyugue, una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, además del comercio; ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica María Mercedes es a la venta de fruta de temporada y conyugue se desempeña como obrero agrícola actividad que realizan desde hace más de 10 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de fruta de temporada y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 60 years old and lives in Caserío Pedregal. For 20 years, she´s lived in her own home with her spouse in a rural part of the district of Buenos Aires. Life in the community is calm and they work in farming and ranching, in addition to trading. It´s located in the Morropon Province which is part of the Piura Region on the north coast of Peru. 

María Mercedes works in selling seasonal fruits and her spouse works as an agricultural laborer, which he´s done for over 10 years. She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy seasonal fruits in order to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit

loans.name: Maliton  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  7 membres du groupe  MALITON II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOKORO, un des villages de KELEYA, dans la Préfecture de BOUGOUNI (Région de Sikasso, République du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution les, prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont  le mil, arachide et riz  avec   KABADJE, 3 eme personne debout de la droite vers la gauche  de  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de KELEYA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Maliton II Group are all married women who are, on average, 41 years old and have five children.  They live in polygamous families in the village of Bokoro, in Keleya district, Bougouni prefecture (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali).

As they want to improve their agricultural businesses during the winter months, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their fourth loan, the previous loans were all fully and correctly repaid.

Kabadje (standing third from the right in the photo) grows millet, peanuts and rice.  She plans to use her loan to buy seed and other agricultural products, and pay for labour for two hectares of land.  She sells her produce in Keleya to retailers and consumers.  

Kabadje expects to make an average profit of 175,000 francs CFA, which will be used to repay her loan and help her husband provide for the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, and buy seed and other agricultural products.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Santa Gema se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Tarqui  en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 16 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Ángela es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para ella y para que su marido lo utilice en el negocio, él marido se dedica a la venta  de mariscos y pescado por libras, todos los días en la madrugada el se va hasta las playas de la localidad a comprar los mejores mariscos para luego revender al por mayor y también lleva a entregar a restaurantes y hoteles de la ciudad donde ya tiene sus clientes, ella por su parte se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y zapatos lo cual lo realiza puerta a puerta,  ella se gana algo por su cuenta  que le sirve para sus gastos personales y para los estudios de su hijo. Llevan más 12 años dedicados al comercio con lo cual salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar mariscos, ropa y zapatos. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ellos financian sus negocios con los créditos. Sus sueños es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Santa Gema credit group meets every two weeks in the Tarqui neighborhood in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are visited by many people year-round and for being a city with an unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

In this place, lives Ángela, who is 39 years old, married and in this relationship has a 16-year-old son who studies in the secondary school.  Her husband is a businessman.

Ángela is a very good wife who takes out this loan for herself and for her husband to use in business. The husband works selling shellfish and fish by weight. Early every morning, he goes to the local beaches to purchase the best shellfish to later resell in bulk and also to deliver to restaurants and hotels in the city where he has customers. For her part, she works selling clothing, cosmetics, and footwear which she does door-to-door. She earns something for herself, which helps with her personal expenses and with her son's studies. They have worked for more than 12 years with these businesses, with which they get ahead.

This loan is to purchase shellfish, clothing, and footwear. She has 4 loan cycles with the credit group and she likes it because in this way they finance their business with loans. Their dream is to have a large store.

loans.use: to purchase shellfish, clothing, and footwear.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 8 y 16 años en la ciudad de Barranquilla . Desde hace 10 años emprendió su aventura de negocios, pues toda la vida ha estado en el tema de la pescadería y el cultivo de tunerculos en el campo. De allí se desprende el hecho de haber emprendido un negocio del cual tiene experiencia como la venta de pescado, en el cual su cónyuge le ayuda, pues tambien ofrecen comidas rápidas y carnes asadas, además de pescado y queso. Sus compras la realizan en el municipio del Magdalena, donde los compran de contado y los traen a la ciudad de Barranquilla, para comercializarlo entre sus clientes. Su meta es educar a sus hijos y esta es la razón por la cual quiere impulsar su negocio, para generar muchos mas ingresos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comrpará pescado, queso, e insumos para elaborar comidas rápidas. Con esta inversión planean incrmentar el volumen de sus ventas y aumentar su capital de trabajo, lo cual hace de su credikiva una buena inversión.
texts.en: Armando lives with his spouse and their two children, ages 8 and 16, in the city of Barranquilla. For the last 10 years, he has undertaken a business adventure, since his whole life has been in the theme of fishing and growing tubers in the countryside. From there, he got the idea of launching a business from which he has experience such as selling fish His wife helps him, since they also offer fast food, grilled meat, in addition to fish and cheese.  They make their purchases in the municipality of Magdelana, where they purchase supplies in cash and bring them to the city of Barranquilla to sell them to their customers. The goal is to educate their children and this is the reason for which he wants to propel the business, to generate much more income. He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will purchase fish, cheese and supplies to make fast food. With this investment, they plan to increase their sales volume and expand their working capital, which makes their Kiva loan a good investment.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cheese and a fast food cart.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes tiene 60 años de edad, reside en el Caserío Pedregal, desde hace 20 años, vive en casa propia junto a su conyugue, una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, además del comercio; ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica María Mercedes es a la venta de fruta de temporada y conyugue se desempeña como obrero agrícola actividad que realizan desde hace más de 10 años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de fruta de temporada y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 60 years old. She has lived in the village of Pedregal for 20 years. She lives in her own house together with her husband, in a rural area in the district of Buenos Aires. Life in this community is quiet and the people mainly work in farming and livestock, and also in trade. The community is located in the province of Morropón, which belongs to the Piura region on the north coast of Peru.

María Mercedes sells seasonal fruits. Her husband works as a farm laborer. They have worked like this for 10 years. 

María Mercedes has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles in order to buy seasonal fruits and by this to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits.

loans.name: Alexander De Jesus

texts.es:
Alexander es un hombre humilde y trabajador que ha vivido toda su vida en el campo, tiene 29 años de edad y tiene un enfoque claro en su vida.
Con mucho esfuerzo logro montar una tienda de abarrotes y víveres en una vereda del municipio de Montería, Córdoba. Desde allí pone toda su vocación de servicio para atender a las personas de la vereda que van en busca de productos para su hogar.
Tiene la necesidad de comprar un enfriador para mantener productos como carnes frías y pulpas en buen estado y poderlos ofrecer a sus clientes siempre en perfectas condiciones, adicional desea abastecerse de productos básicos de la canasta familiar para aumentar su inventario y tener productos disponibles para la venta.
Tiene grandes planes para su futuro y quiere generar empleo a mediano plazo.
texts.en:
Alexander is a humble and hard-working man who has lived all of his life in the country.  He is 29 years old and has a clear focus in life.

With great effort he managed to start a store for groceries and food on a lane in the town of Monteria, Córdoba.  From there he focuses his vocation for service to tend to the people on the lane who are in search of products for their home.  

He needs to buy a refrigerator in order to keep products like cold meat and fruit in a good state so that he is able to offer them to his customers in perfect condition.  He also wishes to stock up on basic products like staple goods so that he can increase his inventory and have more products available for sale.  

He has big plans for his future and wants to generate employment in the medium-term.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and stock up his store with staple goods.

loans.name: Milagros Leonor

texts.es:
Milagro vive en la ciudad de Chincha, día a día trabaja en un supermercado de su ciudad como empleada, con lo cual puede solventar sus estudios superiores ya que actualmente se encuentra en la universidad.

Milagro esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá solventar algunos gastos personales, con lo cual podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar su carrera y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Milagro lives in the city of Chincha. She works day to day as an employee in a supermarket in the city, which allows her to afford her higher education at university currently.

Milagro is grateful to Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help that they´ve provided, she will be able to resolve some personal expenses, with which she can improve her quality of life and keep fighting to be able to make her big dream a reality: “Finish her degree and be a great professional.”

loans.use: to resolve personal expenses

loans.name: Bensodia Group

texts.fr:
BENSODIA  est un groupe de l’association DANAYA de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et légumes  à l’image de KADIATOU qui est la seule  personne debout  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles au quartier  BAMANANKING dans la  Sous-Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : tomate,  oignon et choux.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire. 
KADIATOU, qui est un membre du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 paniers de tomates.  Elle s’approvisionne sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.    
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Bensodia Group belongs to Danaya Association of Ouelessebougou. It regroups married women who got to know each other through bonds of kinship and community.

They average 33 years of age and three children each, and live in large traditional families in Bamananking, in Ouelessebougou Subprefecture (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They've been in the retail business for several years, and are very much in demand in their business. They sell tomatoes, onions, and cabbages.

They run various businesses, such as buying and selling condiments and vegetables, just like Kadiatou, the only woman standing in the photograph.

Eager to satisfy the growing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago. They are seeking their fourth solidarity loan (group loan).

Kadiatou is a member of the group who's very well known in Ouelessebougou. She excels in selling vegetables. She intends to use her loan to buy five baskets of tomatoes.

She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers, and retails her condiments in Ouelessebougou, for cash and on credit, to a mixed-gender clientele.

She hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 15'000, which will enable her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy 5 baskets of tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her maize and coffee crops.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana, age 27, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a married woman. She has been running a business selling juice with the support of her husband. She has been doing it for many years and makes good money to run their household. She is a mother of two children and is eager to provide them a better standard of living. 

In order to improve her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a 40,000 PKR loan. This will be used to purchase another juicer machine with the packs of sugar and flavors. It would help her to cater to more customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase another juicer machine with the packs of sugar and flavors.

loans.name: Wiñay Huayna Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “WIÑAY HUAYNA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nelly ella es soltera y tiene 42 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labiales y perfumes.

Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunión porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de huevos, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de tejidos.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the “WIÑAY HUAYNA” communal bank, located in the Cusco district, province, and department.

Nelly is 42 years old, single, and has a son.  She works her beauty products business and sells lipstick, creams, and perfumes and works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm.  She’s been doing this for several years and her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her beauty products.  She is asking for this loan to buy creams, lipsticks, and perfumes.

The other members whose pictures were added to the photograph had their pictures taken after the meeting due to work commitments.

The other members sell eggs, clothing, and have grocery stores and weaving businesses.

She is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this means and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn es soltera y vive en Chincha junto a sus padres.
Ella trabaja desde hace 2 años en una Financiera como Auxiliar de Plataforma.
Es una joven muy amable y emprendedora. 
Su más grande sueño es poder apoyar a sus padres y brindarles todas las comodidades que ellos merecen para mejorar su nivel de vida.
