Es por eso que Evelyn está muy agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva, con el apoyo otorgado y aprovechando el día de la madre comprará algunos artefactos para implementar su hogar y para que sus padres vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Evelyn is single and lives in Chincha along with her parents. She has worked for two years at a financial institution as a platform assistant. She is a very amiable and enterprising young woman. Her greatest dream is to be able to support her parents and provide them with all the comforts they deserve to improve their quality of life.

Thus, Evelyn is very thankful to the Kiva lenders. With the support provided, and taking advantage of mother's day, she will buy some items to improve her home so her parents live better.

loans.use: to buy items to improve her house.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 37-year-old  married male with six children; four attend school.  He lives in Kasese Uganda. 

Jackson owns a carpentry work shop on a busy street and works seven days a week and eleven hours a day. He began the business to have a source of income.  Business expansion is his dream. Jackson is hard working however, competition is a challenge.

He requests a loan to pay school fees

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo owns a boutique and a retail shop in Hoima Uganda.  He is married with two children; one attends school.  He earns additional income from farming. He started the business in 2010 to improve his standard of living. 

He hopes to  expand the business.  Weather changes hinder the business. 

He requests a loan to increase his stock and buy more clothes and general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to increase his stock.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 31-year-old  married man with four children; three  attend school. Julius operates a textile business to sell ladies' and men's clothes.  He also farms to earn additional income. 

Julius began the business to generate income for his family and requests a loan to buy clothes to sell. Julius is affected by competition and high rental costs but hopes to have a well-known boutique in his town.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger amount of fruit and vegetables in order to strengthen his business.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María, está acompañada, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y uno de sus hijos, los cuales tienen una actividad económica independiente, todos aportan para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ella tiene un local en el mercado municipal en el que vende frutas, verduras y granos básicos lo hace con la ayuda de una hija, ya cuenta con 30 años de experiencia.
El préstamo le permitirá efectuar la compra de mercadería fresca cada vez que necesite abastecer su negocio y así continuar trabajando por un tiempo, comprara güisquiles, papayas, pepinos, naranjas, elotes, coliflor, uvas, manzanas, arroz, frijol, maíz, etc., de esta manera sus ventas e ingresos serán mejores y cancelara puntualmente las cuotas de su deuda.
Su aspiración es mantener su negocio funcionando, tener mejores utilidades que utilizara para mejorar el estilo de vida familiar y apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan trabajar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Maria is married. She lives in her own house with her spouse and one of her children who are financially independent. All of them contribute to pay the bills. She has a stall in the town market where she sells fruits, vegetables and basic grains. She does this with the help of her daughter and she has 30 years experience.

The loan will allow her to make the purchase of fresh merchandise that she needs to stock her business and to keep working for a while. She will buy güisquiles (a gourd), papayas, cucumbers, oranges, corn, cauliflower, grapes, apples, rice, beans, corn, etc. In this way her sales and income will be better and she can punctually pay off her debt.

Her aspiration is to keep her business running, to have better income that she can use to improve her quality of life and support her children so they can work in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy güisquiles (a gourd), papayas, cucumbers, oranges, corn, cauliflower, grapes, apples, rice, beans, corn, etc.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom has successfully built her business selling fabric with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has a  good number of customers and earns money to contribute to the family income. A previous Kiva loan helped her to expand her business. 

This is her 5th loan cycle and she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase bundles of fabric in different colors. It will allow her to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of different colored material.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has done this for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. She requests a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another cow. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help to generate more income. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 49-year-old married woman. She has sold  milk with her husband for the past five years. She has one buffalo, which she uses to produce milk to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate additional profit. 

Kalsoom has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase another buffalo. 

Kalsoom hopes that this loan will bring positive changes to her business and is eager to provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina has successfully built her sewing business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. 

She has built a strong customer base and makes a good income to contribute in the family income. She used a previous Kiva loan to purchase sewing items. 

She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase spools of thread, packs of zippers, laces, and buttons. It will help her to sew dresses on time and generate a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, packs of zippers, laces, and buttons.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne  41 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers  de La ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments et des articles divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur  7ème  prêt solidaire. NOELLIE 1ère femme debout de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 1 rouleau de bazin, 10 pantalons, 15 boîtes de pommade, 20 foulards et 15 paires de chaussures en plastiques. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 22 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
On average, the women of the Danaya group are 41 years old with five children and live in extended traditional families in Lafiabougou, one of the quarters of San/Segou (in the fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).
These women met through the family and work in the commerce of condiments and various articles. Having correctly repaid the previous loans, the Danaya group women request their seventh solidarity loan. Noellie is the first woman standing looking from left to right in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy one role of traditional bazin fabric, 10 pairs of trousers, 15 boxes of cream, 20 scarves, and 15 pairs of plastic shoes. She buys her stock locally from the wholesalers. She sells her merchandise to her mixed clientele for cash and often on credit.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 22 000FCFA which she will use for health care expenses, food, school fees, and the remainder she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy various articles.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana and her husband are farmers. They keep a greenhouse where they cultivate sunflowers. Near the greenhouse Liana and her husband also keep a grape yard. Agribusiness is the only source of income for this family and it helps to cover daily costs. 

Besides her husband, Liana's family also includes their three children and her parents-in-law. 

The requested loan of USD 700 is very important for them. They plan to purchase fertilizer and seeds and hire workers for land cultivation.  As this is Liana's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds and to hire workers for land cultivation.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is fifty four years old and lives in Hoima Uganda. He is married and has six children; four attend school. 

He is a taxi driver and works six days a week. Farming supplements his income. He hopes to complete his commercial house. Weather changes hinder his business.  He requests a loan to improve his commercial house.

loans.use: to improve his commercial house.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is twenty six years old and lives in Hoima Uganda. He is a single hardworking man who runs  a drug shop.  He is a civil servant who desires to expand his business. Limited capital affects his business.

He requets a loan for home improvement.

loans.use: to pay for home improvement.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius lives in Hoima Uganda. He is a married hardworking man with the responsibility to take care of five children; three attend school. 

He has a boutique to sell clothes and shoes.  He earns additional income from farming. Weather changes and fluctuating prices affect his business.

He requests a loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy  clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Gs Mirian P Group

texts.es:
La señora Mirian es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio el cual es la venta de ropa americana de segunda mano, esto lo realiza desde hace mas de 13 años, sus principales clientes son vecinos y amigos de su comunidad, su negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante, y cuenta con el apoyo de una hija la cual se encarga de comprarle el fardo de ropa.
Doña Mirian solicita el apoyo del préstamo para la compra de un fardo de ropa americana para la temporada, ella sueña con tener una pequeña caseta en su casa de habitación para atender a sus clientes desde la comodidad del hogar, ella solicita el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas:
Rosa se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general es su casa de habitación desde hace 4 años.
El señor Jose el vende verduras de manera ambulante desde hace  2 años.
en la fotografía aparece una amiga de ellos tres que decidió tomarse una fotografía con ellos para estar listo y participar en el grupo en la siguiente ocasión.

Danlí, Honduras – Abril 2014
texts.en:
Mirian is a working woman, dedicated to her business in which she sells secondhand American clothes. She´s done this for over 13 years. Her main customers are neighbors and friends in her community. Her business is mobile and is supported by her daughter who is in charge of buying the bundle of clothes.

Doña Mirian is asking for the loan support to buy a bundle of American clothing for the season. She dreams of having a small stand in her house to help her customers from the comfort of her home. She is asking for a group loan with the following people:

Rosa has sold groceries from her house for 4 years.

Jose has sold vegetables as a street vendor for 2 years.

In the photo is a friend of theirs who decided to take the photo with them to be ready to participate in the group for the next time.

Danlí, Honduras – April 2014

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothing for her business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from Lernagog village. She lives alone as her husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country and their children are married and live with their families.
 
Anna runs her family's farm. It includes livestock of two pigs, 20 sheep and 20 chickens. The gathered milk and meat is sold in local markets and Anna is able to gather income for her daily costs.
 
This requested loan of USD 1,000 is very important for Anna to purchase five piglets and forage for the livestock to enlarge her agribusiness. Anna took a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her agribusiness is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Anna has been approved for this loan. She has been approved  within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for five piglets and forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Wajida  Al- Waytat Group

texts.en:
Wajida  Al- Waytat is a group that consists of five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB.

Wajida is the leader of the group. She is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children. Wajida is an uneducated woman, but she is very dynamic and vigorous. She works as a housewife. Wajida's family is very large. This makes the house not organized on most of days. Her house lacks many home appliances. She can't afford that. The members of the family have no places to hang their clothes. They hang the clothes on the windows and this negatively affects the house organization, which makes Wajida feel ashamed, especially when she meets visitors inside the house. Also, the house lacks some furniture. For this reason, Wajida requested a loan of 50,000 YER in order to purchase a new cupboard for the clothes and a bed for the bedroom.
 
Wajida looks forward to furnishing all her house. She hopes to send her children to a private school.

loans.use: to purchase a new cupboard for the clothes and a bed for the bedroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicken, garlic, onion, etc.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BADEGNA ont en moyenne  45 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers  de La ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales et des articles divers. Les femmes du groupe BADEGNA sont à leur  1er  prêt solidaire. ADIARATOU 2ème femme  de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 2 cartons de savon, 20 jupes, 10 paires de chaussures en plastiques et 5 paires de colliers en caoutchouc. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 13 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group BADEGNA are women who average 45 years of age and 4 children each. They all live in extended traditional families in LAFIABOUGOU, a district of the city of SAN, in the region of SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They know one another through ties of kinship, and they conduct income-generating activities such as buying and selling cereals and various other merchandise. This is their 1st group loan. 

ADIARATOU (2nd from the left in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy 2 cartons of soap, 20 skirts, 10 pairs of plastic shoes, and 5 sets of rubber necklaces. She buys her stock on location from wholesalers. She sells for cash, although often on credit, to a clientele that consists of both men and women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 13,000 FCFA, which she will use to pay for healthcare and tuition. The remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise for resale.

loans.name: María Judith

texts.es: María una mujer admirable y luchadora que por destino a la vida perdió a su esposo, pero para ella no fue motivo para recaer en la depresión y siempre pensando en su hijo de 10 hijos encontró la manera de generar ingresos y ser una mujer independiente, con un  dinero recaudado monto una tienda de accesorios y ropa la cual ha tenido mucho éxito por sus novedosos estilos y diseños. Solicita un crédito para la compra de ropa, calzado y accesorios para brindarles a sus clientes diferentes estilos y marcas a la hora de adquirir un productos, su principal sueño es poder tener una vida tranquila y placentera junto a su hijo proyectándose como una propietaria de un gran almacén de variedades
texts.en: Maria is an admirable and hard-working woman who, through life's destiny, lost her husband. But for her, this was not a reason to fall into depression and she was always thinking of her 10 year old son. She found a way to earn income and to be an independent woman. With money raised, she started an accessories and clothing shop which has had much success due to its new styles and designs. She is requesting a loan to buy clothing, shoes and accessories to provide her customers different styles and brands while purchasing products. Her main dream is to be able to have a quiet and pleasant life with her son becoming an owner of a great shop of a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store like shoes, clothing, and accessories, always looking to provide a great variety of products available for her customers.

loans.name: Djedouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJEDOUMA ont en moyenne  30 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO II l’un des quartiers  de la ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments et des céréales. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJEDOUMA sont à leur  6ème  prêt solidaire. BINTOU 1ère femme assise de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 20Kg de riz, 10Kg de fonio, 5Kg de pomme de terre, 5Kg d’oignon et 1 demi paquet de Cube Maggi. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djedouma group are on average  31 years old with three children and all live in extended traditional families in Santoro 11, one of the quarters of San/Segou (in the fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).
These women met through their families and work in the commerce of condiments and cereals. Having correctly repaid their previous loans, the women of this group request their sixth solidarity loan. Bintou, who is the first woman sitting looking from left to right in the photo; plans to use her loan to buy 20 kg of rice, 10 kg of fonio (small grains similar to quinoa) 5 kg of potatoes, 5 kg of onions and half a packet of Maggi cubes. She buys her stock from wholesalers. She sells her merchandise to a clientele of men and women for cash and often on credit.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20 000FCFA which she will use for healthcare, food and clothing expenses, and she will reinvest the remainder in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments and cereals.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Emily, a very hardworking farmer living in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya with her three children. She has a two-acre piece of land where she raises dairy cattle and poultry and grows tea, maize, and bananas, and she also has a personal retail business. Her favorite part in farming is tending her farm and livestock. Her greatest challenge is lack of proper farming skills.

Emily would like to expand her farm in a way that will bring in more income because she has a family to take care of. That’s why she needs this Kiva loan to enable her to purchase more poultry for more egg production. She says that this income will also help her expand her farm enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Merriam

texts.en:
Merriam manages a variety store and a hog-raising business. She also involves herself in a networking business as an additional source of income. She is happily married and blessed with two children. Her eldest child is married while her youngest child is still single and currently working. The couple is grateful because, through their hard work and determination, they were able to let their two children finish their studies. 

Now, she wants to keep her variety store profitable, so she is asking for additional capital of 20,000 PHP. She hopes to obtain this amount in order to purchase stocks of grocery items such as cases of soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil and ingredients to sell. She knows that by offering a more complete variety of grocery items within her locality, she could be able to generate better income and provide all her customers' demands. She is looking forward to approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as cases of soft drinks, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil and ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 45-year-old single mother of seven children age 21, 18, 15, 13, 10, 8, and 6. They are residents of a rural area near the lake shores. She operates a retail shop at a landing site, a business she has been doing for 10 years now.

She has approached Ugafode for a loan of 2,000,000 to buy a motorcycle to ease her transport to and from the landing site. This she anticipates will expedite her service delivery and efficiency.

Her dream for the future is to set up a big wholesale shop at the landing site since there is none at the moment. She faces challenges of poor transport to her place of business at the moment but with the motorcycle this will change. She thanks Ugafode for the financial support rendered to low-income earners.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Hamed

texts.en:
Hamed is a 41-year-old married man with five children, living with his family in Sana'a, Yemen. He studied till elementary school, but he couldn't complete his study. Recently he has been an employee in the public sector. He is a talented and responsible professional man. He has a high determination inside himself to get ahead. 

The salary that he receives from his job is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. For this reason, Hamed decided to purchase a taxi for transportation in order to improve the condition of his family and to save money for his children. From his salary, Hamed could accumulate a good amount of money to purchase a taxi, but unfortunately it still was not enough. For this reason, Hamed requested a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a taxi for transportation to help him to improve the condition of his family. 

Hamed hopes to provide his family with a lot of money. He dreams to open a supermarket in the capital city of Sana'a.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABALY ont en moyenne  35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU l’un des quartiers  de la ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SABALY sont à leur  2ème  prêt solidaire. DIARRAH 1ère femme de la gauche  vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 50 mètres de tissus légers, 20 paires de colliers en caoutchouc et 20 bracelets en caoutchouc. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 16 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women forming the Sabaly group are on the average 35 years of age, with three children. They live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou, a neighborhood in the town of San in Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). 

They know each other as relatives and work selling miscellaneous items. After having duly reimbursed their first loan, the group members are on their second solidarity loan. Diarrah, the first one from left to right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 50 meters [57 yards] of lightweight cloth, 20 sets of elastic necklaces and 20 elastic bracelets. She stocks up locally from wholesalers. She sells to a mixed clientele, for cash and often on credit.
She envisages an average monthly benefit of 16,000 West African francs, which will be used to cover expenses related to health, food, school fees, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous articles.

loans.name: Jozsef David

texts.es:
Jozsef vive en la ciudad de Chincha, trabaja como vendedor en una empresa de su ciudad, trabajo quie le permite tener ingresos para salir adelante.

Jozsef esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá solventar algunos gastos personales y mejoras en la vivienda donde vive, con lo cual podrá ir mejorando su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Estudiar una carrera y poder tener su negocio propio”.
texts.en: Jozsef lives in the city of Chincha.  He works as a salesperson for a business in the city.  This works allows him to earn an income to get ahead.  Jozsef is grateful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to their support, he will be able to cover some of his personal expenses and repairs in the house that he lives in.  With this, he will be able to continue improving his quality of life and continue fighting to make his biggest dream of studying for a professional career and starting his own business a reality.

loans.use: to cover personal expenses.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a 33-year-old married woman with four children who all go to school. Oliver operates a retail shop on a busy street. She works seven days a week, 12 hours a day and has been six years in business. She also owns rentals and does farming for additional income. 

Oliver began the business to support her family and wants a loan to buy rice, sugar, jerry cans and soap to sell. Educating her children and business expansion are her dreams, only to be challenged by limited capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, soap and jerry cans to sell.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 43 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge tiene 2 hijos uno de 16 y 8 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico contando con servicios de agua en Caserío el Arenal, una zona rural del Distrito del Distrito Santo Tomás, cliente mantiene buenas relaciones con los miembros de su comunidad, vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la actividad agropecuaria. Ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Wilmer es la cría y comercialización de ganado vacuno, cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro, su ganado vacuno lo comercializa en la plaza de ganado del distrito de Santo Tomas y en su propio Caserío.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 500 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado vacuno y posteriormente comercialización, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 43 years old, and has a stable home with his spouse.  He has two children, aged 16 and 8.  They live in a house that they own made of rustic materials with running water in the Arenal village, a rural zone in the Santo Tomás district.  The client maintains good relationships with the members of his community.  He lives in a small community that is dedicated to agriculture.  The community is located in the Cutervo province which is part of the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern sierra.  

Wilmer raises and sells cattle.  He has extensive experience in this field.  He sells his cattle in the cattle plaza of the Santo Tomas district, and in his own village.  

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 4,500 nuevos soles to purchase cattle that he will later sell.  With this, he will obtain greater earnings that will allow him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: purchase cattle.

loans.name: Zadoki

texts.en:
Zadoki is a 45-year-old Ugandan man married to Priska. They have five children and four attend school.

Zadoki is a farmer who has grown coffee since 2002. He is a resident of a trading centre in a rural area.
 
He has approached Ugafode for a loan of three million UGX to invest in his business of growing coffee so that he can generate more income. He will hire labour to cultivate the garden and also buy seedlings for planting. These will raise his sales margin after harvest and will therefore increase his income.

His dream for the future is to educate all his children and acquire more land for his farming, but he faces challenges of price fluctuations and coffee diseases.

He is confident that with this further financial boost from Ugafode, his dreams will eventually turn into reality. He is hardworking.

loans.use: To hire labour and buy seedlings.

loans.name: Ruth Estela

texts.es:
Ruth, de 32 años decidió iniciar con un negocio de salón de belleza con la ilusión de darle a su hijo de 16 años un buen futuro y educación.
Tiene su negocio desde hace algún tiempo y aprendió del oficio capacitándose en el SENA (Servicio Nacional De Aprendizaje) y actualizándose en diferentes temas de belleza.
Es una mujer con ideas frescas y con alta capacidad de trabajo y dedicación.
Ella pide un préstamo para comprar un puesto para realizar Spa de uñas, adicional necesita comprar insumos como cremas y tratamientos para la y el cabello.
Estos elementos le permitirán atraer un mayor número de clientes y atenderlos de una manera cómoda.
Su principal desafío es la falta de capital para invertir.
texts.en:
Ruth, 32, decided to start a beauty salon business with the goal of giving her 16 year old son a good education and future. She has had her business for some time and learned the work through training at SENA (National Learning Service) and has been performing different beauty services.

She is a woman with fresh ideas and with a high capacity for work and dedication. She is requesting a loan to buy a chair to start a nail spa. Additionally, she needs to buy some resources like creams and treatments for nails and hair. These items will allow her to attract a greater number of customers and attend to them in a comfortable manner. Her main challenge is the lack of capital to invest.

loans.use: to buy a chair to start a nail spa and buy resources like hair and skin creams.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
EsEsperanza tiene 67 años de edad sin hijos dependientes, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, una persona de buenas referencias, tiene una familia unida, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería desde hace varios años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 800 nuevos soles para la compra de animales para negocio y alimentos balanceados para una mejor producción de leche para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 67 years old and does not have dependent children.  She lives in a house that she owns in the Cayaltí district.  She is a person with great references and has a strong family.  Her community is dedicated to agriculture, commerce and cattle.  It is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

She has worked in commerce, agriculture and cattle for many years.  She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,800 nuevos soles to purchase animals for her business and animal feed to improve her milk production to offer her customers.

loans.use: purchase cattle and animal feed.

loans.name: Roxana Guisela

texts.es:
Guisela tiene 21 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, es madre soltera cuenta con un hijo de 3 años de edad en el distrito de San Felipe, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, la comunidad es tranquila se dedicada a la agricultura y comercio, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza es la venta de combustible al menudeo, lo compra a cisternas que abastecen semanalmente a grifos de la zona y la venta lo realiza en su domicilio, es una mujer emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevo soles para invertir en compra de mayor cantidad de combustible, con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Guisela is 21 years old. She lives in a house constructed with simple, rustic materials in the district of San Felipe. She is a single mother and her son is three years old. She has water and electricity at home. The community where Guisela lives is a calm place where people work in agriculture and commerce. It is located in the province of Jaén, which belongs to the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru.

Guisela sells fuel in small quantities. She buys it from the tankers that supply fuel to the local pumping stations and sells it at home. She is an enterprising woman. She requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles [PEN] at Epydme Alternativa to buy more fuel in order to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fuel to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne 39 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 2ème  prêt solidaire. BINTOU 2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 boîtes de concentrée de tomate, 20 Litres d’huile alimentaire, 25 Kg de Sel et 20Kg de piment. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 16 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group BENKADI are women who average 39 years of age and 4 children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the city of BLA, region of SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They know one another through ties of kinship, and their income-generating activity is buying and selling condiments. This is their 2nd group loan. The first one was correctly repaid. 

BINTOU (standing 2nd from the left in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy 3 cans of tomato paste, 20 liters of cooking oil, 25 kg of salt and 20 kg of pepper. She buys her stock locally. She sells for cash, although often on credit, to a clientele that consists of both men and women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 16,000 FCFA, which she will use to pay for healthcare and food. The remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia, one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Alice is married and has four children. She is a teacher. Both she and her husband practice farming. They have been farming for five years now and they are currently growing maize, potatoes, groundnuts, sugarcane and bananas on their farm. Alice is excited about beekeeping as the bees will aid in pollinating their crops.

This is Alice's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay school fees for her children and to invest in livestock. Alice's hope for the future is to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kamukuywa, a small town in Kitale County. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya, and at over 6,300 feet above sea level, is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started projects planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Mary is married and has four children. She is a business lady and she also undertakes farming with her husband. They have been farming for 15 years now and they are currently growing maize, millet, potatoes, sweepstakes and sugarcane. Mary is excited about beekeeping as the bees will aid in pollinating their crops.

This is Mary's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to boost her business. Mary's hope for the future is to to build a house and to take her children through school up to college.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kamukuywa, a small town in Kitale County. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda, and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and maintenance of tree cover by the area’s residents has helped both preserve the region’s soil and ensured that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Mary is married and has three children. She is a Village Elder as well as a Church Elder. Both she and her husband practice farming. They have been farming for 30 years now and they are currently growing maize and vegetables on their farm. Mary is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income through the sale of honey.

This is Mary's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay university fees for her last born child. Mary's hope for the future is to finish building her house.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
Mario de 33 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a hacer tortillas y venderlas en la colonia,  también es la que se encarga el cuidado de los niños. Dos de sus tres hijos asisten a la escuela. 

Él  se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 15 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, su padre por medio de las correcciones que le hacía fue como lo hizo que fuera una persona de bien para la sociedad, también trabaja como albañil en la zona de forma esporádica, por el tipo de actividad de la zona es que se dedican solamente a la agricultura. Mario ha sido un hombre responsable, a criado a sus 3 hijos sin abandonarlos como muchos padres lo hacen hoy en día.

 El trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, nadie más se dedica a la actividad, y su horario de trabajo es de 6 am a 10 am.

El préstamo será invertido en la preparación de la tierra para la siembra, hoy que viene la época de invierno, con el préstamo pagara personas quien le ayuden con los trabajos, lo demás del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de  abono, semillas, pesticidas y herbicidas para el cultivo del maíz. 

Su deseo es tener primero lo más necesario para la familia, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad del arrendamiento de la tierra.
texts.en:
Mario is 33 years old and has a ninth grade education.  He is married, and his spouse works making tortillas and selling them in the town.  She also is in charge of raising their children.  Two of their three children attend school.  He works in agriculture, and has over 15 years of working in this business.  Through his disciplining, his father raised him to be a good person in society.  He also works sporadically as a mason in the region.  Most people in the region devote themselves solely to farming. 

Mario has been a responsible man.  He has raised his three children without abandoning them like many fathers do nowadays.  His work is close to his home, and he walks there.  No one else works with him, and his schedule is from 6am to 10am.  

The loan will be used to prepare the land for planting since winter is approaching.  With the loan, he will pay people to help him with his work, and the rest will be used to purchase manure, seeds, pesticides and herbicides for growing corn.  His dream is to first have his family's necessities for which he hopes to always work as long as God grants him health and life.  The loan with help him to satisfy the needs of his leased land.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting by paying for labor to help him with his work.  The rest of the loan will be used to purchase manure, seeds, pesticides and herbicides to grow corn.

loans.name: Alliance Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe ALLIANCE ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments et des articles divers. Les femmes du groupe ALLIANCE sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire. AWA 1ère femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 carton d’allumette, 50Kg de sucre et 50Kg de farine de blé. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 11.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Alliance Group average 35 years of age and 3 children each. They all live in extended traditional families in Bla, Ségou Cercle (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship. Their businesses consist in buying and selling condiments and various products. They are seeking their first solidarity loan (group loan).

Awa is the woman on the left in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy one carton of matches, 50 kg of sugar, and 50 kg of wheat flour. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers. She sells for cash and often on credit, to a clientele comprising women and men.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 11'000, to be used to cover healthcare expenses, food, clothing, and school expenses. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 1 carton of matches, 50 kg of sugar, and 50 kg of wheat flour

loans.name: Gs Las Marianas Group

texts.es:
La señora Ligia es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio ella vende de tajaditas de plátano desde hace mas de 7 años, este proceso lo realiza en su casa de habitación  y sus principales clientes son personas que viven en su barrio,  y también  abastece de producto a muchas pulperías que se encuentran en el municipio de Jacaleapa.
Doña Ligia a logrado obtener bastante clientela razón por la cual llegan hasta su casa  para consumir su producto y solicita el préstamo para la compra de plántanos y manteca.
Doña Ligia su sueño es poder obtener una rayadora de plátano. Ella solicita el préstamo de forma grupal con las siguientes personas;
Dina se dedica a la repostería venta de pastel y panadería desde hace 10 años.
José se dedica a la venta de ropa americana nueva y zapatos desde hace 9 años.
Marianela se dedica a la venta de cosméticos,  cremas,  aritos y ropa americana  desde hace 15 años.
Todos ellos formaron el grupo para fortalecer su amistad y comunicación.
Danlí, Honduras – Abril  2014
texts.en:
Ligia is an entrepreneurial woman who is dedicated to her business. She has sold fried slices of plantain for more than 7 years. She cooks in her home and her main customers are people who live in her neighborhood. She also supplies her products to many of the grocery stores in the Jacaleapa municipality.

Ligia has managed to obtain many customers who come to her home to consume her products and she is requesting the loan to purchase plantains and butter. Ligia's dream is to be able to purchase a plantain slicer. 

She requests the loan as part of a group, which is comprised of the following people: Dina, who has baked pastries and sold cakes and bread for the past 10 years, José, who has sold new, American clothing and shoes for the past 9 years, and Marianela, who has sold cosmetics, creams, earrings, and American clothing for the past 15 years. They formed the group to strengthen their friendship and communication.

Danlí, Honduras - April 2014

loans.use: to purchase plantains and butter for her business.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura de 56 años de edad habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas. En su menú se encuentran deliciosos alimentos que prepara para servirlos, al desayuno, o al almuerzo.  Su negocio nació cuando Maura observando que en su barrio existen muchos negocios informales, como talleres, almacenes, tiendas de artículos, decidió ofrecer a los empleados de estos la posibilidad de alimentarse.  En la actualidad tiene un aviso informativo dirigido a sus clientes para darles a conocer su menú y también utiliza el volanteo para atraer nuevos compradores. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito todos los días desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. Su mayor desafío es lograr tener un capital suficiente, para aumentar su producción e incrementar su oferta, de tal manera que impacte las ventas. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará una nevera e insumos para preparar alimentos. Inversión que le proporcionará la mejor forma de almacenar los cárnicos y productos que requieren almacenarse refrigerados, para ofrecer a su clientela una mayor calidad y seguridad alimentaria.
texts.en:
Maura is 56 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla.  She works making and selling food.  On her menu one can find delicious meals that she prepares and serves for breakfast and lunch.  Her business started when Maura noticed that in her neighborhood there were many informal businesses like workshops, warehouses, and convenience stores, and she decided to offer their employees an option to feed themselves.  Currently, she has an informative announcement directed at her customers to let them know about her menu.  She also uses the leaflets to attract new customers.  She makes her sales in cash and on credit everyday from 9am to 3pm.  Her greatest challenge is obtaining the necessary capital to increase her production and her offerings in order to impact her sales.

For this reason, she has sought a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase a refrigerator and supplies to prepare meals.  This investment will provide her with the best way to store meats and other products that require refrigeration so that she can offer her customers the higher quality and food safety.

loans.use: purchase a refrigerator and supplies to prepare food.

loans.name: Ponciano Antonio

texts.es: Entre su ganado y la frescura del campo hace diez años Don Ponciano inicio la siembra de maíz y frijoles, él es habitante de la comarca La Joya en la ciudad de Teustepe. Tiene 28 años es casado y padre de dos hijos. Es un señor emprendedor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está a la espera de la nueva cosecha que se aproxima y se prepara para la siembra de frijol es por eso que él solicita un crédito para comprar semillas de frijol, ya que desea que esta cosecha sea buena y así logre obtener mejores ganancias y ofrecerle así un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Between his cattle and the freshness of the countryside, Ponciano started growing beans and corn 10 years ago. He lives in the La Joya region in the city of Teustepe. He is 28 years old, married, and has two children.

He is an entrepreneurial man and has a great desire to move forward. He is waiting for a new harvest that is quickly approaching and is preparing to plant beans. This is why he has requested a loan to purchase bean seeds. He hopes that his harvest is good so that he can earn more money and provide a better future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase bean seeds.

loans.name: Segundo Eloy

texts.es:
Segundo Eloy tiene 20 años de edad, vive en casa familiar con padres y hermano en el distrito de Cayaltí una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de jornalero agrícola por zonas y alrededores, también brinda servicio de transporte mediante una mototaxi, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para invertir en arreglo de mototaxi (motor y tapiz ) El cual le generara un ingreso económico adicional.
texts.en:
Segundo Elloy is 20 years old and lives in his family home with his parents and brother in the district of Cayalti, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce and cattle-raising. Cayalti is located in the Province of Chiclayo, a part of the Lambayeque region of Peru's north coast.

Segundo Eloy is an agricultural laborer in the surrounding zones, and also offers transportation services by means of his mototaxi. He is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 new sols to invest in fixing up his mototaxi (its motor and upholstery). The vehicle generates an additional economic income for him.

loans.use: to buy a new motor and upholstery for his mototaxi.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 29-year-old male Ugandan who is married with four children, ages 8, 6, 4, and 2. Three of them attend school.

John is a boda-boda rider as his major source of income, a business he has been doing since 2012. He also carries out agriculture but on a small scale.

He has applied for a loan of UGX1,700,000 to buy a motorcycle, and he expects to pay it back after making profits from his transport business. He expects that the motorcycle will give him income to meet his family's needs. His main challenge in his business is poor roads and weather. He thanks Ugafode for the financial support rendered to him despite his poor background. He is hardworking.

loans.use: To top up on his payments on his motorcycle.

loans.name: Jeridah

texts.en:
Jeridah lives in Kamukuywa, a small town in Kitale County. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia as one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops, including maize, sunflowers, sugarcane, millet, and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, whose substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Jeridah is married and has seven children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for 30 years now and they are currently growing maize, sweet potatoes, sugarcane, and bananas. Jeridah is excited about beekeeping since the bees will aid in pollinating their crops.

This is Jeridah's first loan with Honey Care Africa and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to invest in dairy farming. Jeridah's hope for the future is to have electricity and piped water installed in her village area.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Kamukuywa, a small town in Kitale County. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. At 6,300 feet above sea level, Kamukuywa is one of Africa’s most elevated towns. The rich soil of the area makes it one of the nation's biggest maize-producing regions, lending it the nickname of “the breadbasket of Kenya.” Many farmers in the region have started planting bluegum trees on their land, which complement the region’s natural forests and provide bees with a variety of food sources. The people around Kitale have been beekeeping for centuries, and the area is dense with strong bee colonies.

Elizabeth is married and has 10 children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for four years now and they are currently growing maize, potatoes, cassava, vegetables and bananas. They also rear poultry. Elizabeth is excited about beekeeping as the bees will aid in pollinating their crops for a better yield.

This is Elizabeth's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to start a business and to educate her children. Elizabeth's hope for the future is to give her children the best education possible.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce lives in Kamukuywa, a small town in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. It is located close to Uganda and Mount Elgon, an extinct volcano which straddles the two nations and even has a peak at the Kenya-Uganda border. Founded by European settlers in the early 1900s, Kitale originally grew due to its proximity to the Ugandan railway. 

The area around Kitale is filled with natural forests, and the maintenance of tree coverage by the area’s residents has helped preserve the region’s soil and ensures that the area remains good for beekeeping. Kitale is the headquarters of the Kenya Seed Company, whose massive sunflower plantations provide nearby bees with a veritable buffet of high-quality forage.

Loyce is married and has 10 children. She is a retired teacher. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for 32 years now and they are currently growing maize, potatoes, cassava, vegetables and bananas. Loyce is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey.

This is Loyce's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay the school fees for her children and to invest in her farm. Loyce's hope for the future is to live a more fulfilling life.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Vanis Patricia

texts.es: Vanis de 34 años de edad es la propietaria de una peluquería ubicada en la ciudad, en la cual ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal, peinados, maquillaje, alisado manicure, pedicure etc.  Su negocio inició hace 10 años, pues después de la separación de su cónyuge,  debió buscar la manera de generar ingresos para aumentar el bienestar de sus 3 hijas.   Vanis trabaja durante 13 horas diarias atendiendo lo mejor que puede a su clientela, que son principalmente vecinos   y referenciados por estos en los sectores aledaños.  Su meta es fortalecer su infraestructura  y lograr una educación de calidad para sus hijos. Esta es justamente la razón que la impulsa a obtener un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un SPA para pies y una silla de peluquería. Con esta inversión planea incrementar su potencial de ventas y con ello sus ingresos y sus utilidades., pues su mayor desafío es tener un suficiente capital para invertir constantemente.
texts.en: Vanis is 34 years old and is the owner of a hair salon located in the city of Barranquilla in which she offers services for personal image enhancement, hair styling, make-up, manicures, pedicures, etc.  She started her business ten years ago after her separation from her husband, when she needed to look for a way of generating income in order to increase the well-being of her three children.  Vanis works 13 hours per day serving her customers the best that she can.  Her clients are principally neighbors and people from the surrounding neighborhoods.  Her goal is to strengthen her infrastructure and offer an education to her children.  This is the reason she is seeking a Kiva loan.  It will be her first loan with Kiva's partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use it to buy a foot spa and a barber chair.  With this investment she plans to increase her potential sales and with those her income.  Her greatest challenge is to have enough capital to continually invest in the business.

loans.use: To buy a foot spa and a chair for hair cutting.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Kakamega County, which is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forests. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest and the variety of crops grown in the area make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

Elizabeth is married and has 10 children. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for 40 years now and they are currently growing maize, sweet potatoes and bananas. They also keep poultry and cattle. Elizabeth is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and provide her with honey for medicine.

This is Elizabeth's first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to pay the school fees for her children. Elizabeth's hope for the future is to have her children educated and to expand her farm.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en:
Zacharia lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Zacharia is married and has six children. He is a machine operator by profession. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for twenty years now and they are currently growing maize, vegetables and sugarcane. Zacharia is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Zacharia's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to start a business. His hope for the future is to start a business that will earn him more income.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Zablon is married and has seven children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for twenty-three years now and they are currently growing maize and vegetables, and they raise cattle as well. Zablon is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Zablon's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to invest in his farm. Zablon's hope for the future is that his children get a good education.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in Kapsabet, a small town near Kakamega County. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya, close to the Ugandan border. It contains the only tropical rain forest in Kenya, and the variety of the flora in the region makes it well suited for beekeeping. It has one of the highest rural population densities in the world (in some areas, close to 600 people per square kilometer), which may contribute to the region's high poverty rates.

Daniel is married and has two children. He is a teacher. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for five years now and they are currently growing horticultural crops and they also keep dairy cattle. Daniel is excited about beekeeping as it is an enterprise that requires little input and it will earn him some income from the sale of honey.

This is Daniel's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy more beehives. Daniel's hope for the future is to become a successful beekeeper.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob lives in Kakamega. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Jacob is married and has nine children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for thirteen years now and they are currently growing maize, bananas and trees and they also keep cattle. Jacob is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Jacob's first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Jacob's hope for the future is to expand his farm.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita has operated her retail store since 2006. She is 63 years of age, married and blessed with three grown up children. All her children settled for marriage and live separately. 

Aside from her retail store, Rosita also has a rice field managed by her husband. Now, she would like to take out a loan for additional capital in the amount of 20,000 PHP to be used in buying various kinds of merchandise to restock her retail store. 

She's hoping that lenders will grant her requested loan so she can keep her retail store profitable. In this way, she could sustain her family's basic needs and save for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of merchandise to restock her retail store.

loans.name: Marinette

texts.en: Hog raising has been Marinette's business involvement. She has been in this kind of business for six years. She is 47 years old and separated. She focuses on her hog raising and a small store. She aims to improve the growth of her hogs, and that's why she is seeking a loan of 7,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy feed and essential vitamins for her hogs. She knows that through sustaining her hogs with proper nutrition, she could be able to generate greater income which would enable her to improve her way of living.

loans.use: to buy feed and essential vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Goravan village with her husband and 16-year-old daughter. The family runs a farm. It includes 20 sheep, 2 piglets and 20 chickens, and they also cultivate wheat. Karine's husband takes the gathered harvest to the nearby market and sells it there. 

Karine has requested this loan of USD 3,000 to pay for 20 sheep and to buy forage for the livestock. The loan will be a big support for Karine and her farming business, as she develops it further and makes it more profitable. Please help this hardworking woman with the loan.

loans.use: to pay for 20 sheep and to buy forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix tiene 64 años de edad de estado civil conviviente, vive en el Distrito de Buenos Aires, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura , ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Felix es la venta de cerveza y carne de cerdo actividad que realiza hace más de 15 años, contando con clientela fija, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en compra de cerveza para abastecer su negocio y cerdos para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecer su carne.

El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que es temporada de lluvias y hay aumento de ingresos para trabajadores de la zona.
texts.en:
Felix is 64 years old and lives with his life partner.  They live in the region of Buenos Aires, Perú, and his locale is a place where people work in agriculture, livestock, and business.  His home has basic services like water and electricity, and it is located in the Province of Morropon which belongs to the Piura region on the northern coast of Perú.  

Felix works selling beer and pork, an activity that he has been pursuing for 15 years.  He notes that he has a stable customer base, and he is asking for a loan of 2500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa in order to invest in the purchase of beer to stock his business and in hogs so that he can fatten them and sell their meat.  

The market has a good outlook since this is the rainy season and income has increased for workers in the zone.

loans.use: To purchase beer to sell and hogs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural nutrients and other elements for preparing his soil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of flour and rice

loans.name: Amistad San Juan Group

texts.en:
In spite of the obstacles that they face, the women of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Amistad San Juan” meaning “Friendship San Juan” are true fighters. Maria, a 41-year-old single mother with six years of education, is an example. She has one teenage son and has begun her university studies. She is a happy and enthusiastic woman and works hard to help her son make his dreams come true. Maria has a textile business and creates fine scarves, shawls and backpacks. She sells these items at a wholesale price by the dozen to merchants in nearby stores. She is requesting her third loan from Friendship Bridge that she will use to purchase additional thread and supplies for her business.

María is the President of the Trust Bank which is a perfect position for her. She has great leadership skills and transmits confidence and security to the group. Maria clearly exemplifies how one determined woman can break the cycle of poverty with the necessary tools and create a more prosperous life for herself and her son. She is determined that her son have a more prosperous life and realizes that education is essential.

Friendship Bridge combines small loans and participatory non-formal educational seminars in the monthly meetings of each Trust Bank. This is called “Microcredit Plus”.  A Loan Officer of the organization shares information on practical subjects like money management, budgeting and accounting as well as indebtedness and customer service. Other topics discussed include hygiene and nutrition, self esteem and violence against women and getting children ready for school.

Maria and the women of the “Amistad Trust Bank” face a far more positive and prosperous future with their small loans and newly acquired knowledge. Kiva investors are real partners in the Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase additional thread and supplies for her textile business.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DANAYA ont en moyenne 36 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits et des produits divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur 3ème  prêt solidaire. MINATA 2ème femme de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 carton de cigarettes, 25Kg de sucre, 10Litres d’huile et 10Kg de farine de blé. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 14 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group DANAYA are women who average 36 years of age and 5 children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the city of BLA, region of SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They know one another through ties of kinship, and their income-generating activities consist in buying and selling clothing and various goods. This is their 3rd group loan cycle. Both past loans were correctly repaid. 

MINATA (2nd from the right in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy 1 carton of cigarettes, 25 kg of sugar, 10 liters of oil, and 10 kg of wheat flour. She buys her stock from local wholesalers. She sells for cash, although often on credit, to a clientele that consists of both men and women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 14,000 FCFA, which she will use to pay for healthcare and tuition. The remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy various goods for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cassava.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials, generator, air-cooler, and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Mikail

texts.en:
Mikail is a young man of 25 years, living with his sister. He is not married. He has a retail shop business and also keeps cattle. He has been in the above businesses for over six years.

Alongside the retail shop, Mikail also runs a soft drinks shop which also supplements his daily income. According to him, through the above businesses he has been able to take care of his household plus his dependents. 

Mikail also says he has acquired this facility to boost his retail shop by buying stock (general merchandise) that is required by his customers. He also affirms that his biggest clientele base is within fellow traders around his place and also daily consumers. According to him, his biggest challenge is changes in people’s income which lowers the consumption rates.

He is described as a hardworking man who has been able to achieve everything from his sweat. He believes that with further financial assistance, he will continue to succeed.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Mujeres Central Group

texts.en:
San Juan La Laguna is a clean and beautiful little town on the shores of Lake Atitlan in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It is here that seven ladies have formed a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “Mujeres Central”. The women are Maya “Tzutijil” and many speak that indigenous language, as well as Spanish.

The Secretary of the Trust Bank is 29-year-old Encarnación who is married with one daughter. She carries out her secretarial duties successfully and also enjoys success with her small store where she sells high quality textiles. Encarnación also has a stall in the local market where she sells baby clothes and undergarments for women. Recently, she began another business and sells “ceviche” which is a marinated fish cocktail. This is her own delicious recipe and her customers love to buy it from her. Encarnación is requesting a new loan that she will use to buy more utensils and other supplies in order to improve her businesses.

All of the ladies of the Trust Bank benefit from the monthly educational seminars given by a Loan Officer of Friendship Bridge. They can immediately use relevant information about business administration, budgeting and accounting as well as customer service and indebtedness. Other topics covered include health and medicinal plants, women’s rights and self esteem and healthy habits. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of the loans and non-formal education “Microcredit Plus”. It is a valuable combination that really works for the over 20,000 women clients of the organization!

Encarnación and the six other women in her Trust Bank want Kiva investors to know how much they appreciate being able to secure these small loans. They work hard to manage their businesses successfully and are determined to pay back the loans fully and on time. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: To buy utensils and other supplies in order to improve her food businesses

loans.name: Iris Ivonn

texts.es: Iris tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad. Iris  es cosmetóloga y además presta servicios domésticos y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable quien hace todo lo que esta en sus manos para llevar el sustento a su familia. Isis  solicita este préstamo a FUSAI para dar inicio a la construcción de la vivienda dado que se quieren mudar a un lugar más seguro para el cual ya compraron el terreno para dar inicio a la construcción. Con el crédito solicitado comprará cemento, arena,ladrillo,etc.
texts.en:
Iris is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and her little 4 year old boy. Iris is a cosmetologist and also offers domestic services. In this way she makes a living and provides for her household.

She is a very hard working and responsible woman who does everything she can to provide for her family.

Iris is requesting this loan from FUSAI to begin the construction of a home. They want to move to a more secure area for which they already purchased the land to begin construction. With the requested loan she will buy cement, sand, bricks, etc.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, etc. to begin the construction of a home.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María Eugenia es madre de tres hijos por los que lucha para salir adelante junto a su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en uno de los mercados de la capital. Este nuevo crédito que solicita es para comprar materiales de construcción para levantar parte del muro perimetral de su casa para disfrutar de mejores condiciones junto a su familia en el hogar y sobre todo garantizar la seguridad de sus hijos.
texts.en: María Eugenia is the mother of three children for whom she fights to get them ahead with her husband. She sells food in one of the capital's markets. This new loan that she requests is to buy construction materials to erect part of the perimeter wall in her house to enjoy better conditions together with her family in the home and, above all, guarantee the security of her children.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, sand, iron, small rocks

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 33 years old and married. She earns a living by fattening and selling pigs in the Philippines. Celia is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Celia has been fattening pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from operating a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines. 

He is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of fruits to sell for his fruits business.
