Rodrigo has been in this business for 10 years. Rodrigo earns more income from buying and selling spices.

Rodrigo has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. He dreams to save enough money so he could afford to send his children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fruits to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a boarding house renting business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from cement stove making. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase housing materials like wood, paints, cement, etc. for her boarding house renting business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials like wood, paints, cement, etc.

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en:
Nieva is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income by buying and selling charcoal.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Nieva has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for the meat and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses.

loans.name: Ubaldo Aquilino

texts.es:
Ubaldo tiene 33 años de edad, estudió hasta educación media, está casado y tiene 2 hijos.

Ubaldo se levanta a las 5:00 AM junto a su esposa que le apoya en la actividades que él realiza y sus hijos van a la escuela, el oficio de la agricultura lo aprendió de su padre,durante la mañana se dedica a trabajar en la parcela junto a dos mozos que le ayudan a preparar la tierra y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar los animales que poseen.

El crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar los insumos para la siembra como lo son abono, semilla, veneno, rastriada, etc. Pues espera tener una buena cosecha para el sustento de su familia.

Ubaldo planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la siembra, en un futuro podrá  construirle a su familia una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Ubaldo rises at 5:00 am with his wife, who helps him in his activities.  His children go to school.  He learned to farm from his father and he works his land in the morning along with two helpers.  His wife cares for the home and their animals.

He is asking for this loan to buy the supplies he needs, such as compost, seeds, poison, weeding, etc.  He expects to have a good harvest to support his family.

Ubaldo plans to build a house for his family with the income he receives.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
Artemio tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos, en El Sector El Campo, una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad de clima frio, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Dedicado al cultivo de café, en su caserío, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 700 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos y inversión en mantenimiento de su finca y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Artemio is 46 years old and lives with his spouse and four children in the El Campo sector, a rural area in the Callayuc district. This is a community with a cold climate, and its population works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. It is located in the Cutervo Province, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region, which is a sierra north of Peru. 

His business is in the cultivation of coffee in his homestead. He requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,700 PEN to purchase fertilizer and to invest in the maintenance of his land and, in this way, have a better production to offer his clients.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to invest in the maintenance of his land

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a prepared-food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Concepcion earns more income by selling vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more ingredients for her food-vending business, like sugar, milk, and cooking oil.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients, like sugar, milk, and cooking oil

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 47 years old and married. She has three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 20 years, and she earns additional income by selling beauty products.

Ma. Luisa is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

She requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Violeta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a general store and by raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy fishing materials for her business, like nets, gasoline, and bamboo.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, like nets, gasoline, and bamboo.

loans.name: Arbia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Arbia works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming coconut and operating a general store. Arbia is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional inventory of vegetables and spices. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Arbia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Mira Flor

texts.en:
Mira Flor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling fish in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her business.

Mira Flor has been in this business for 10 years. Mira Flor earns more income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general merchandise business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy more merchandise to sell for her business.

Melanie has been in this business for seven years. Melanie also earns income from buying and selling fish and operating a rice mill.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 54 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Elma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to pay laborers for the preparation of her land.

Elma has been farming rice for 24 years and earns additional income from growing citrus.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers for the preparation of her land.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 49 years old and married with seven children, four in school.

Rosario works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, and noodles.

Rosario has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening and buying and selling rice.

She requested this new loan to further build her business.

Rosario aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college .

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, and noodles.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 36 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, spices, sugar, milk, and canned goods.

Marina has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Marina aspires to save enough money to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, spices, sugar, milk, and canned goods

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 35 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell like shampoo, soap, cream, coffee, and eggs.

Rowena has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell like shampoo, soap, cream, coffee, and eggs.

loans.name: Ginez

texts.es:
Ginez tiene 49 años de edad, casado tiene 1 hijo vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural, la comunidad es tranquila su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Cliente se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, pavos, cuyes, con más de 10 años de experiencia, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 100 nuevos soles para la compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversos gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona.
texts.en:
Ginez is 49 years old; he is married with one son. He lives with his family in a quiet community in a rural area of the Oyotún district, which is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo and is part of the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. The population works in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. 

Ginez earns his living raising and selling animals, like ducks, roosters, hens, young roaster chickens, turkeys, and guinea pigs. He has more than ten years of experience and his business is located at his own residence.

He has requested a loan of 1,100 nuevos soles [PEN] from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of more animals. This investment will enable him to have a greater variety and productivity of animals, which will have a great influence on his business. Ginez is planning to increase his animal stock to be able to serve the various tastes and needs of the customers in the area.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals to sell

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DEME ont en moyenne 42 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments et des produits divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DEME sont à leur 3ème prêt solidaire. NENE 1ère femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 boîtes de pommade, 5 cartons de savons. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 11 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group DEME are women who average 42 years of age and 3 children each. They all live in extended traditional families in the city of BLA, region of SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They know one another through ties of kinship, and their income-generating activity consists in buying and selling condiments and various goods. This is their 3rd group loan cycle. Both past loans were correctly repaid. 

NENE (1st from the left in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy 20 boxes of pomade and 5 cartons of soap. She buys her stock from local wholesalers. She sells for cash, though often on credit, to a clientele that consists of both men and women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 11,000 FCFA, which she will use to pay for tuition and food. The remainder will be reinvested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Sarina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Sarina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Sarina is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now is requesting another loan to further build her business.

Sarina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 53 years old and married with one child.

Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, and canned goods.

Elsie has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 28 years and also earns income from farming rice and food vending.

She requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Elsie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell  such as coffee, milk, sugar, eggs, and canned goods.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store. Elena is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ederlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ederlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns income from buying and selling fish. Ederlinda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials, like a bundle of fishing net, and gasoline for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Ederlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, like a bundle of fishing net, and gasoline

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials for her business.

Aida has been in this business for seven years. Aida earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay a lease deposit, finish the build out of her space and purchase a new laptop

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJEKAFO ont en moyenne 34 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des habits, des condiments et des articles divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur 3ème  prêt solidaire. DJENEBA 2ème femme de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 cartons de biscuit, 1 carton de savon. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 9 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group DJEKAFO average 34 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in BLA/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship, and they buy and sell clothing, condiments, and general merchandise. After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group DJEKAFO are now on their third solidarity loan.

DJENEBA, the second woman sitting at the right in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 2 boxes of cookies and a box of soap. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers. Her sales are made to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash and often credit.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 9,000 francs CFA that will be used for covering expenses related to healthcare and education. And the rest will be reinvested in her work.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME ont en moyenne 31 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des céréales et des produits divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur 3ème  prêt solidaire. MAMOU femme assise au milieu sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 cartons d’eau de javel, 1 carton de bonbon, 50Kg de sucre, 10Kg de lait en poudre et 30 boîtes de lait concentré. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group DJIGUISSEME average 31 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in BLA/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship and community, and they buy and sell condiments, grains, and general merchandise. After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group DJIGUISSEME are on their third solidarity loan.

MAMOU, the woman sitting in the middle in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 2 boxes of bleach, a box of candy, 50 kg of sugar, 10 kg of powdered milk, and 30 cans of concentrated milk. She gets her supplies locally from wholesalers. Her sales are made to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash and often credit.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used for education purposes. And the rest will be reinvested in her work.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise

loans.name: Djguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA ont en moyenne  37 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des céréales et des articles divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA sont à leur 3ème  prêt solidaire. CHATA femme assise au milieu sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 600Kg de riz. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group DJIGUIYA average 37 years of age and two children each, all living in traditional families in BLA/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through ties of kinship and community, and they buy and sell condiments, grains, and general merchandise. After having correctly paid back their previous loans, the women of the group DJIGUIYA are on their third solidarity loan.

CHATA, the woman sitting in the middle in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 600 kg of rice. She gets her supplies locally and from surrounding villages. Her sales are made to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash and often credit.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used for covering expenses related to healthcare and education. And the rest will be reinvested in her work.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 63 years old and widowed with six children.

Denia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like chips, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc.

Denia has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from dressmaking.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and now requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Denia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like chips, canned goods, soft drinks, and eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coal and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Sherif

texts.en:
Sherif is on disability yet, despite this fact, he works hard, and he’s got apple orchards to take care of on a continuous basis. In addition to this, he plants and sells seasonal veggies and grains.

Here is what he said during his interview with our Branch Assistant: “It is way too much work for me. I start my day at 5 a.m. and go to bed at 11 p.m., and all day I am on my feet. Gladly, my wife helps me as well, otherwise the whole thing would have been more exhausting than what it is in reality. When it comes to selling my products, this is easier since I sell them to wholesale buyers who cover the transportation themselves.”

Sherif is 60 and the father of two in their early 20s. He needs this loan to buy pesticides for the orchards.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for his apple orchards

loans.name: Jeta

texts.en:
What you see in the background of the photograph is Jeta's toilet that needs to be repaired as soon as possible. The bathroom has no door and is in terrible condition. 

Jeta is really seeking your financial help. The previous loan that she got from you, she paid it off and according to her, she will keep the promise of paying this loan in-full again.

loans.use: to repair the toilet and install a door to the bathroom.

loans.name: Fasso Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FASSO KANOU ont en moyenne 34 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à BLA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des céréales et des articles divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe FASSO KANOU sont à leur 2ème  prêt solidaire. KADIA 1ère femme de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paires de chaussures en plastique, 2 cartons de savon et 10 boîtes de pommade. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 16 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Fasso Kanou group are on average 34 years old with 2 children, and they all live in traditional extended families in Bla/Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali.) These women came to know each other through family and are in the business of purchase and resale of spices, cereals, and various other items.

After having fully repaid their previous loans, the women of the Fasso Kanou group are on their second group loan. Kadia is the first woman pictured from right to left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to purchase 10 pairs of plastic shoes, 2 boxes of soap and 10 boxes of pomade. 

Kadia stocks up in the area from wholesalers, and makes her sales to a customer base made up of both men and women for cash and often for credit. She hopes to be able to earn an average monthly income of 16,000 francs CFA, which she will use to provide for healthcare expenses and education costs, and the remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various items

loans.name: Nuriam

texts.en:
Nuriam is a 33-year-old woman who is married to Hafure, a 33-year-old man. They have been blessed with two children. They are Azil, 3, and Alika, 1 year old. Nuriam is a housewife, while her husband is a fisherman.

To make income for the family, Nuriam's husband works as a fisherman. Together with his uncle and two other fishermen, they catch the fish using his uncle’s boat. Automatically, they have to share the income generated from selling the fish.

Therefore Nuriam and her husband were thinking of buying a boat, so they would be able to generate their income. Unfortunately, they do not have enough money to make their dream come true. The situation led Nuriam to seek a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. The loan will be spent on a new boat. Nuriam hopes that the boat will enable them to improve their income.

loans.use: to buy a new boat

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela and her husband operate a fishing business together. Her husband is a fisherman, and Angela sells the fish he catches every day in their village. She is earning a good profit and was able to repay her previous loan successfully. Her loan funds were used for essential fishing boat repairs. 

Angela would like to improve the business. She wants to buy hooks and new fishing nets for use in the boat. In order to make this investment, she has requested a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit. 

She intends to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish hooks and new fishing nets

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is working and studying to be able to forge ahead and provide a more financially secure life for her needs. She needs to pay for her schooling and also cover her household expenses. Her goal is to complete her degree and to be a good teacher.

Daisy is striving for a better life through her studies, and she says that she is requesting this loan to cover her tuition fees for the first semester. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving, which will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to cover her tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Dolorosa

texts.en:
Dolorosa has trying to save for a long to buy special foam chests/boxes to be used for fish vending, but most of the revenue she brings in is spent on household expenses. 

Therefore, Dolorosa has requested a loan to add to her savings and buy more boxes to be used for fish vending.
 
Dolorosa is a 43-year-old woman, living with her family in the area of Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She thanks GDMPC for the financial services, which she hopes will help improve the general living standards of her entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy boxes for fish vending

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn, age 37, sells seafood to earn a living. She has been in this business for two years. She and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school. Marlyn is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Marlyn has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy seafood to offer for sale.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business. Her goal is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seafood to offer for sale

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 38 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marites has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Letecia has been in this business for 2 years and earns additional income by buying and selling fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like vegetables, meat, and spices for her food vending business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana buys and sells charcoal to earn a living. She earns an additional income through running a general store. Diana has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. 

Diana and her husband have six children, five of whom are attending school. She works hard to support her family.

After having successfully repaid her previous loan, Diana is now requesting a new loan in the amount of PhP 17,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy sacks of charcoal to offer for sale.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia, age 55, and her husband operate a fishing business together to earn a living. Amalia earns an additional income from buying and selling fish. She works hard to help her husband.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She is requesting a new loan in the amount of PhP 11,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional bundles of fishing net and other fishing materials for her business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
As the married parent of six children, Geraldine works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Geraldine is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy operates a general store business to earn an income. Her husband started working abroad five months ago in order to make a living for the family. Mercy started her business at that time in order to earn enough money to support the needs of her two children while awaiting her husband's support. She has been working hard at her new business for the past five months.
 
Mercy is requesting a loan from GDMPC in order to purchase additional grocery goods to offer for sale in her store. 

Her goal is to improve the business in order to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 44 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

Rubina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Rubina has been raising pigs for eleven years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rubina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of ten children, Delma works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Delma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional fish to make dried fish for her dried fish business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Delma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 61 years old, married and has three children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: José Joel

texts.es:
José de 36 años de edad, es una persona casada que estudio hasta noveno grado, vive junto a su esposa e hijos. Se levanta a las 5:30 a.m. Junto a su esposa que le apoya en la actividades agrícolas durante la mañana y sus hijos van a la escuela.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar  una vaca que  le ayudara en un futuro para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener ingresos adicionales.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old.  He is married and studied through ninth grade.  He lives together with his wife and children.  He gets up at 5:30am.  Together with his wife, he does farming work in the morning and his children attend school.

He is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to purchase a cow, which in the future will help increase milk production, so they can sell it and earn additional income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Reina es una mujer con 43 años de edad, luchadora, emprendedora la cual es sotera y madre de 4 hijos el mayor trabaja en una empresa privada, los dos que le siguen estudian en diferentes grados de educación en la secundaria y un menor también estudia en la primaria. Con 6 años de educación y una gran experiencia en la vida ella se ha dedicado al comercio, trabajo de cocina, elaboración de jugos naturales los cuales envasa en botella plástica para la venta entre otras actividades que han sido medio de ingreso para su familia. En la actualidad ella se dedica a la venta de comida en un pequeño negocio ubicado estratégicamente en el centro de la ciudad ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de sandalias para todas las edades de mujer y hombre; pero debido a la problemática económica sus ventas bajaron y mejor decidió cambiar de negocio. Como se menciona anteriormente ella se dedica a la elaboración de jugos los cuales envasa y son comercializados en las diferentes pulperías, bodegas y demás negocios de la zona los cuales le apoyan y le abren las puertas para que siga adelante. El medio que ella utiliza para desplazarse desde su casa de habitacion hasta su negocio es en taxi ya que como medio de trasporte para comercializar el producto es en un pequeño carrito de forma ambulante. COMIXMUL en reiteradas ocasiones le ha apoyado con los diferentes negocios que ella ha tenido pues es una mujer luchadora la cual merece lo mejor en su vida. En esta ocasión el oficial de promoción y crédito que le ha atendido le hablo de los fondos KIVA los cuales representan un gran apoyo en los diferentes productos que COMIXMUL promueve en especial el de SALUD, pues ella carece de un malestar en su vesícula la cual quiere tratar antes de que pueda empeorarse y perjudicar más su salud. Por lo que ella solicita pueda ser apoyada por los inversionistas para poder llevar a cabo el tratamiento y la intervención quirúrgica para curarse. Sus metas poder salir adelante con el tratamiento que necesita y posteriormente continuar trabajando en su pequeño negocio pues con las diferentes capacitaciones recibidas por los técnicos de FUDEIMFA ella ha sabido crecer y ha logrado salir adelante ya que de esa manera ella no dejara sus clientes desatendidos e insatisfechos.
texts.en: Reina is a 43-year-old woman, who is enterprising and a fighter. She is single and the mother of 4 children. The oldest works in a private business, the next two are students in different grades in secondary school, and the youngest is also a student, in primary school. With 6 years of education and a lot of life experience, she has worked in business, and works as a cook making natural juices that she puts in plastic bottles to sell, among other activities that have been the means of income for her family. At the moment, she works selling food in a small business strategically located in the center of the city and previously she sold sandals for men and women of all ages, but due to the economic situation, her sales went down and she decided it would be better to change businesses. As previously mentioned, she works making juices which she bottles and sells in various convenience stores, grocery stores and other businesses in the area which support her and open doors for her to get ahead. She uses a taxi to get from her home to the business and to sell the product she uses a small vendor's cart. COMIXMUL, in a number of occasions, has helped her with the various businesses that she has had since she is a fighter who deserves the best in her life.  This time, the loan officer that met with her discussed the Kiva funds which are a big help in the products that COMIXMUL promotes, especially for health, since she suffers from a gallbladder problem which she wants to treat before it becomes worse and affects her health more. This is why she is asking to be helped by the investors to be able to have the treatment and the surgery to cure her.  Her goals are to be able to go ahead with the necessary treatment and then to continue working in her small business because with the different training that she has gotten from the FUDEIMFA trainers, she has learned how to grow and has managed to get ahead and in this way she won't neglect her customers and leave them unsatisfied.

loans.use: to cover the costs of medicine and scheduled surgical intervention

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita, age 33, earns an income by operating a business that sells football accessories such as T-shirts, shoes, jackets, and socks. She has been involved in the business since 2010. 

She and her husband Raymond, age 32, are blessed with three young children. Zaskia is six years old and attends kindergarten, and the two younger ones are Zidan, age four, and Samil, age two.

Raymond's parents recently offered Zita a vacant spot in a business building, and she took the opportunity to expand her kiosk business into that spot. Having a permanent trading area for her business has enabled her to earn more income for the family's daily needs.  

Zita needs to buy more inventory items to sell in her storefront. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money immediately available to make this purchase. She has therefore applied for a loan from TLM in the amount of IDR 4,500,000. The loan funds will be used to buy more football uniforms, shoes, football jackets, and socks to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy football uniforms, shoes, football jackets, and socks to offer for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been operating her own retail store for more than ten years and she earns well from this. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her five children. The couple had to work hard, with the determination of having better income to provide their children with better education, that they don't currently have. 

To improve sales, Elizabeth took a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. 

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en: Elvera runs a general store in the village to earn a living. While her husband is at the farm, Elvera helps earn income by selling grocery goods and she has been doing this for more than a year. She saved her income and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She took  a new loan recently to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use her generated profits as capital to expand her business. She wants to improve the general living of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en: Eugene is married and operates a fishing business to make a living. He helps his wife peddling the fish in the market. He has been in this field of business for many years and he earns better to provide for his family. Recently, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy an additional variety of fish and new fishing nets. In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy an additional variety of fish and new fishing nets.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As the married parent of seven children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish and raising pigs. Alma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en:
Melitona, age 46 and unmarried, fattens pigs to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for the past 20 years, and she has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
 
Melitona has requested a new loan in the amount of PhP 25,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.
 
In the future, Melitona would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes, age 49, operates a tailoring business to earn a living. She has been in this business for 15 years. She earns an additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing items to members of her community. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She and her husband have nine children, two of whom attend school.

Mercedes has successfully repaid her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan in order to further build her business. She has requested an amount of PhP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy materials like fabric, threads, and zippers for her tailoring business.
 
In the future, Mercedes would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her school-going children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabric, threads, and zippers for her tailoring business

loans.name: Rosila

texts.en:
As the married parent of two children, Rosila works hard to support her family.

She has a business direct selling Personal Collection products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosila is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more products from Personal Collection to sell to her customers for her business direct selling Personal Collection products.

Rosila has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Personal Collection to sell to her customers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria buys and sells herbal products to earn an income. She has been in this business for six years. She works hard to support her family. 
 
Victoria has successfully paid back her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan in order to further build her business. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more stocks of herbal products to offer for sale.

Her goal is to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of herbal products to sell

loans.name: Elinita

texts.en:
Elinita is a married woman with four children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elinita is 35 years old.

Elinita has a general store business in the Philippines. Elinita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elinita has been in this business for six years. In the future, Elinita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Emma works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish and fruits. Emma is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 63 years old and widowed with four children. Yolanda works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like bread, coffee, biscuits, snack foods, juice, etc. to sell in her general store.

Yolanda has been in this business for 32 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, coffee, biscuits, snack foods, juice, etc. 

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, coffee, biscuits, snack foods, juice, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine.

Zenaida has been in this business for four years. Zenaida earns more income from selling purified drinking water.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her videoke machine

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn operates a transportation service to make a living. For eight years, she and her husband have earned well to provide for the family. She had planned to improve their farm in order to send her children to school.

Recently, she requested a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to cover motorcycle maintenance costs to ensure better services. In the future she wants to help improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle maintenance costs

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida works hard to support her family. Zenaida is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Zenaida requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like buttons, zippers, scissors, fabric, etc., for her business.

Zenaida has been in this business for 13 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Zenaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like buttons, zippers, scissors, fabric, etc., for her business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an ice and ice candy vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and ingredients for her ice and ice candy vending business.

Rosario has been in this business for 24 years. She earns more income from her computer shop.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 29 years old and married with five children. With four children currently in school, Rowena works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, detergent soap, canned goods, diapers, shampoo, fabric conditioner, beers, etc. to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent soap, canned goods, diapers, shampoo, fabric conditioner, beers, etc. 

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, detergent soap, canned goods, diapers, shampoo, fabric conditioner, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a married woman with five children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Saturnina is 50 years old.

Saturnina has a business selling rice in the Philippines. Saturnina requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Saturnina has been in this business for five years. In the future, Saturnina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley earns a living by operating a cooked food and fresh vegetable vending business. She has been in this business for two years now. She is unmarried and supports herself through her business.

Shirley has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy additional cooking ingredients as well as fresh vegetables to offer for sale.
 
In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients and vegetables for her vending business

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Beverly is 28 and has four children who are currently in school.

Beverly has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, bamboo, nails, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Beverly has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Beverly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, bamboo, nails, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Condrada

texts.en:
Condrada is 49 years old and married with six children.

Condrada works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Condrada has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns additional income from videoke machine rental.

Condrada aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 43 years old and is married with three children. With two children currently in school, Jesusa works very hard to provide for them.

Jesusa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like snack foods, cereals, coffee, sugar, sanitary pads, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. to sell.



Jesusa has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, cereals, coffee, sugar, sanitary pads, soft-drinks, noodles, etc.



In the future, Jesusa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock like snack foods, cereals, coffee, sugar, sanitary pads, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that he used to pay for the maintenance of his water dispenser business and computer shop. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting another loan, this time for PHP 35,000. He will use the loan to buy three sets of computer units needed in his shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Luis dreams of having a well-to-do living and hopes to put up branches of his computer shop. He meets up every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his computers and to buy three more units.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 47 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rufina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Rufina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Rufina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a business manufacturing baskets in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her basket making business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her basket making.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is married with two children. He owns bar and a hair salon in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He started business to look after his family. He experiences hardship due to competition for clients and high costs of rent.

His vision is to have several sources of income. He needs the loan to complete payment for a plot of land.

loans.use: to complete payment for a plot of land.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Leonora is 43 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Leonora has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Leonora has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Eva Julia

texts.es:
La señora Eva tiene 67 años de edad es viuda convive con una hija y sus nietos, su fuente principal de ingreso  provienen de la renta de cuartos de habitación, cuenta con más de 10 años de realizarla dicha actividad económica cuenta con muy buena clientela ya que con los precios en las rentas son bajos y hay un buen ambiente en su negocio lo que le ha generado ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades del hogar, educación y crianza para sus nietos y cubrir gastos financieros.
Doña Eva es una persona muy emprendedora a pesar de sus años sigue trabajando ya que desea dejarles un buen patrimonio a sus hijos, con el apoyo que solicita lo empleara en la mejoras de su cuartería como pintura, cemento, arena, y otros materiales para darle mejor servicio a sus inquilinos, lo que le generara mejores ingresos.
Doña Eva uno de sus sueños  es mejorar las condiciones de vida a su familia, con el apoyo financiero que se le brinde estaría dando un paso más para alcanzar sus sueños.  
Trojes, Honduras – Abril  2014
texts.en:
Eva is 67 years old, a widow, and lives with her daughter and grandchildren. Her primary source of income is from the renting rooms. She has spent 10 years renting rooms to others and she has a good clientele. Her prices are low and she creates a good environment to live in. Her business generates enough money to take care of household expenses, education, and caring for her grandchildren. 
Eva is an enterprising person and despite her age, continues working because she wants to give an inheritance to her children. With the help of the loan she will improve the rooms she rents and purchase paint, cement, sand and other materials so as to give a better service to her renters, which will in turn increase her earnings. 
One of Eva's dreams is to improve her family's quality of life and with the financial support of this loan she will be able to take one step forward in achieving this dream.

loans.use: purchase paint, cement, sand and other materials.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 40,000 PHP, to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosalita dreams for her children to finish their studies and hopes for an increase in sales and to gain new customers. She faithfully meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener and undergarments.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Marivic requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tatiana Carolina

texts.es:
Tatiana es soltera tiene un hijo vive la mamà en San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar. 

Pertenece a la venatnilla Santiagueña esta ubicada en la Parroquia Santiago pertenece al Canton San Miguel A 15 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel en esta ventanilla tiene 12 miembros que se dedican a actividades agricolas como simbre de maiz, frejol y papas, ademas de esto se dedican a la crianza de animales como gallinas ponedoras y engorde de cerdos. 

Tatiana se dedica a la agricultura y a la siembra de maiz, frejol, ademas a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Nesecita el credito para la compra de fertilizantes abonos ademas balanceado de engorde, crianza para los animales.  Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de San Miguel y vende en la Feria en San Miguel. 

Ha enfrentado desafios como las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. El sueño es seguir aumentando el negocio comprar un terreno para seguir trabajando. Le gusta mucho su trabajo.
texts.en:
Tatiana is single and has one son. She lives with her mother in the province of San Miguel.

She belongs to the group Santiagueña located in the parish Santiago in the canton San Miguel that is fifteen minutes from the San Miguel Office. This group has 12 members who make a living in a diverse range of activities from growing corn, beans and potatoes but also raising animals like chickens and pigs. 

Tatiana makes a living in agriculture and she grows corn, beans and also raises chickens and pigs. She needs this loan in order to purchase fertilizers, manure and also feed  for the animals. She will make her purchases in San Miguel and sell her product in San Miguel market. 

She has confronted many obstacles like plagues and disease of her crops. Her dream is to continue to grow her business and purchase more land so she can continue working. She likes her work very much.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, manure and feed.

loans.name: Truadio Antonnio

texts.es: Un deseo insaciable de brindarle a sus 3 hijos la mejor vida posible que nunca les llegue a faltar nada o pasen necesidades es el pensamiento que alimenta al señor Truadio cada día y lo motiva a trabajar, Truadio se desempeña como agricultor siendo el plátano su cultivo estrella, pero debido a diferentes factores como el clima y las plagas sus cultivos se vieron afectados haciéndole perder parte de sus productos terminados. Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, pesticidas, fungicidas y adecuar su campo para que soporte los cambios de climas que hoy evidenciamos.
texts.en: An insatiable desire to afford his three children the best life possible that they never lack for anything nor are their necessities overlooked is the thought that fuels Truadio every day and motivates him to work. Truadio works as a farmer, the banana is his star crop. Due to different factors like the weather and plagues, his crops have been affected making him lose part of his finals products. He requests a loan to buy farming supplies like seeds, pesticides, fungicides and to adapt his land to withstand the changes in climate that we see evidenced today.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like seeds, pesticides, fungicides and to adapt his land to withstand the climate changes.

loans.name: Chanthou Group

texts.en: Chanthou is 18 years old. She is a married woman in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers. Chanthou is the leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of the group loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, Chanthou hopes that she can purchase cows to breed and to resell their offspring, and she hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy the ground parts of a latrine

loans.name: Jonel

texts.en:
Jonel has been farming for more than three years and he was able to provide for his family's basic needs. He plants and harvests rice to sell in the local community in order to earn a living. Aside from this, he also earns by working for hire in the neighborhood.  

Recently, Jonel borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase fertilizer for his rice production business. In the future, Jonel would like to save in order to create an emergency fund for the future and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en: Noah is a 45-year-old hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda with 22 children and only 15 attend school. He has been operating a butcher shop together with cattle trading and farming since 1992 to look after his family and hopes for prosperity in spite of price fluctuations. Noah is requesting a loan to buy cattle for his business.

loans.use: to buy cattle for his business

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a twenty-year-old married man with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a motorcycle business where he earns income to run his home affairs alongside cocoa selling. He has been in business for four years and wishes to buy another motorcycle to increase his income and profits. He is in need of a loan to buy more cocoa to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is married and the mother of three children. She lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for many years by operating a general store. She has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC that she used for this business. 

Recently, Laura requested a new a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve and expand her business and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
Андрей занимается выращиванием овощей на собственном участке в г Каменка-Днепровская более 20 лет. Он имеет пять больших отапливаемых теплиц. Есть неподалеку еще один участок, где находятся две теплицы без отопления.
Андрей выращивает в теплицах помидоры, огурцы, капусту, перец. У него постоянные покупатели, которые делаают оптовые покупки по хорошим ценам. 

Андрей планирует сломать одну маленькую теплицу, так как она стоит поперек участка и мешает продлить две большие теплицы. Дальше нужно будет провести отопление. Андрей просит предоставить ему кредит в размере 12,000 гривен. 

Андрей хочет своим детям дать хорошее образование. Старший сын сейчас учится в г. Запорожье в колледже на юридическом факультете. Идет много средств на учебу, но Андрей готов платить и помогать сыну.
texts.en: Andrei has been growing vegetables on his own plot in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya for more than 20 years. He has five large, heated greenhouses and another plot close by with two greenhouses that do not have heating. He grows tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, and peppers and has regular customers who make wholesale purchases at good prices. Andrei plans to demolish one small greenhouse because it takes up too much space and prevents adding an extension to two large greenhouses. Then he will need to install heating. He is requesting a loan of 12,000 hryvnia. Andrei wants to give his children a good education. His oldest son is studying law at college in Zaparozhe. It costs a lot of money, but Andrei is willing to pay and help his son.

loans.use: to expand two greenhouses and install heating

loans.name: Lu

texts.en:
Lu is married, with four children. She operates a transportation business while her husband works on their own farm for a living. For three years running a transportation business, Lu was happy to say that this helps her family a lot, while waiting for the harvest of their crops. 

Lu borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to cover motorcycle maintenance costs. 

In the future, she wants to have a better living with her family.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance costs.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a 40-year-old married woman. She settled to earn her living in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines together with her two  children. Over the past five years, Marife was able to put up a fishing business that absolutely met the market's primary demands. Until now, the business is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's  expenditures.

Marife joined GDMPC earlier this year to have easy access to financial services. Her first loan application from the cooperative  is intended to obtain additional capital for her fishing business. She wants to buy new fishing nets and hooks. Marife expects an increase in sales so as to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and hooks

loans.name: Yessica Milagros

texts.es:
Yessica vive en la ciudad de chincha, trabaja como analista en una empresa de su ciudad desde hace 8 meses, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante y apoyar a su familia.

Yessica esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras en su vivienda, con lo cual podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir esforzándose por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Yessica lives in the city of Chincha and has worked as an analyst in an industry in her city for the last 8 months, which allows her to have income to keep advancing in life and support her family.

Yessica is grateful with the lenders at Kiva since, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy construction materials to make improvements in her home, which will improve the quality of life of her family and she'll be able to keep putting in effort to realize her great dream - to finish construction on her home.

loans.use: to improve her livelihood

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 35-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Regina has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eleven years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. 

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Zephanas

texts.en:
Zephanas is a 30-year-old married man with four children, one attending school. 

Zephanas used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season. Still in the textile business, he earns extra income from farming. 

Zephanas began the business to earn a living and is asking for support to buy clothes to sell. Despite his need, he encounters a problem of inadequate capital and competition.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Diana Milena

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer que empezó desde abajo y ha ido progresando a medida que pasa el tiempo.
Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de mercancía como ropa, bolsos y accesorios, además de artículos para el hogar y de belleza.
Aprendió el oficio de una familiar que se lo enseño y la motivo a trabajar independiente.
Hoy en día presenta una dificultad y es la falta de un exhibidor para mostrar su mercancía y de esta forma obtener más ventas, es por eso que solicita un amparo económico para comprar una vitrina y tener allí toda su mercancía exhibida.
Con los ingresos que obtiene de su actividad ayuda a sus hijos con la educación y con el mejoramiento de su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diana is a women who started from the bottom and has been progressing over time. She makes a living by selling all types of merchandise like clothing, handbags, accessories, household goods, and beauty products.

She learned this business from a family member who taught her and encouraged her to start her own business. She is currently facing difficulty because she does not have a display case to show her goods and sell more items. This is why she has requested a loan. She will purchase a display case with which to exhibit her merchandise.

With the income that she earns from her business, she helps her children with their education and helps to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a display case to show and sell her merchandise

loans.name: Adriana Cristina

texts.es:
Adriana es una mujer humilde, trabajadora y pujante.
Tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en la que atiende  a un pequeño número de clientes.
Con esta actividad ha logrado levantar y sostener a sus hijos los cuales le ayudan en la tienda y le colaboran mucho con su actividad.
Ella quiere empezar a ampliar su negocio y que sea más reconocido, por eso desea un auxilio económico para capitalizar su negocio y hacerlo un poco mas solido.
Con el dinero comprara surtido de toda clase como abarrotes y elementos de consumo básico de la canasta familiar, si podrá tener un inventario un poco más amplio y empezara con su proceso de ampliación.
Es una mujer sencilla y carismática, digna de admirar por su paciencia y valor humano.
texts.en:
Adriana is an unassuming, hardworking, and strong woman. She has a small grocery store where she tends to a small number of customers. With this business, she has managed to raise and sustain her children, who help her in the shop and contribute a great deal to her business.

She wants to expand her business and for it to become more well-known, so she would like some economic help to fund her business and strengthen it a bit. 

With the money, she will buy an assortment of all kinds of groceries and everyday household items so that she will be able to have a larger inventory and begin her expansion process.

She is a simple and charismatic woman, worthy of admiration for her patience and human values.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of everyday household products to increase her inventory

loans.name: Archana

texts.en:
Archana lives in the South 24 Paraganas district of West Bengal. She is 35 years old, married and has two sons; both are studying. Archana has completed her schooling until eighth grade.
