This family's living depends mainly on their paddy cultivation done by Archana and her husband. They earn around INR 40,000 per annum. 

Archana is a member of “Indira”, which is managed by the local NGO, “Sabuj Sangha”. Her family’s income is not adequate to meet their daily needs. Hence, she is requesting a loan of INR 15,000. She is planning to grow boro (a type of rice) crop so that she can earn more profit. The money will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the rice field. She expects that the income will help her expand her current business and pay for the family's food and health care.

Archana hopes to save enough for her children’s education and wants to turn her turn paddy cultivation into a big business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for the rice field.

loans.name: Gemis

texts.es: Gemís es un humilde agricultor que alterna su profesión con su propio negocio el cual es un establecimiento de bebidas y licores, este joven empresario de tan solo 24 años de edad le gusta llevar una vida productiva y atareada pues no puede quedarse quieto y siempre busca la manera de ser productivo y no solo por eso, puesto que tiene que alimentar a 3 hijos, solicita un crédito para la compra de bebidas alcohólicas y gaseosas que le permitan potenciar su negocio y hacerlo un lugar agradable, su sueño es tener un establecimiento muy rentable que le permita dejar el oficio de la agricultura para poder dedicarle más tiempo a sus tres hijos
texts.en:
Gemís is a humble farmer who alternates his profession with his own business, which is a refreshment and liquor establishment. This young entrepreneur is only 24 years old and likes to have a productive and busy life because he can't stay still and is always looking for a way to be productive, and not just for this reason, given that he has to feed three children. 

He asks for a loan to buy alcoholic beverages and sodas to allow him to empower his business and make it a pleasant place. His dream is to have a very profitable establishment that allows him to leave his farm job in order to be able to give more time to his three children.

loans.use: to buy alcoholic and soft drinks to make his business a more complete and pleasant place

loans.name: Sengee

texts.en:
Sengee, 44 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a warehouse in order to store vendor's goods for profit. His wife is unemployed and stays at home, looking after their children. 

Their eldest son is going to study in Japan and needs to pay the tuition fee. So Sengee is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to pay his son's tuition fee as an educational investment for his son. After graduating from Japanese college, his son will easily find a job and contribute to the family income.

loans.use: to pay his son's tuition fee

loans.name: Mirador De Bombon Group

texts.es:
Este préstamo es parte de las lineas de créditos "Credi Yapa" de la Asociación Arariwa, que permite los prestatarios con un buen historial de crediticio a recibir un especial préstamo. Este es un préstamo además de su préstamo regular que también esta en la recaudación de fondos en Kiva."

Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco solidario “El Mirador de Bombon” en el distrito de Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo. Ezequiel 41 años y vive en la comunidad de Mirador de Bombon. Ezequiel es una persona trabajadora que desde muy joven aprendió de sus padres la agricultura y la ganadería, él es una persona carismática y amable que sale adelante cultivando papa, trigo, cebada y avena, él en sus horas libres se dedica  al engorde de ganado entonces él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un ganado. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la ganadería, a la crianza de animales menores y el engorde de ganado. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
This loan is part of a group of loans called "Credi Yapa" from the Asociación Arariwa. This program allows borrowers with a good credit history to receive a special loan. This loan is in addition to their regular loan, which is currently fundraising on Kiva. 

A group of neighbors and friends compose the solidarity bank "El Mirador de Bombon" in the district of Challabamba in the province of Paucartambo. 
Ezequiel is 41 years old and lives in the Mirador de Bombon community. Ezequiel is a hardworking person who learned to farm and raise livestock from his parents at a very young age. He is a charismatic and kind man who makes his way in the world by growing potatoes, wheat, barley, and oats. In his free time, Ezequiel also fattens livestock to later sell. So, he is requesting this loan in order to buy a cow. 

This communal bank is composed of various people looking for opportunities to get ahead and who work hard in order to provide their children with a better future. The members make a living by farming, raising small animals, and fattening cattle. They are grateful for this opportunity that is being offered to them and pledge to make all of their repayments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Hong Group

texts.en: Hong is 43 years old. She is a married woman of six children at Pursat Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers. Hong is the leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, Hong hopes that she can buy farmland and her children can finish their studies and get jobs.

loans.use: to buy the ground parts of a latrine

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane is a 26-year-old, settled to earn her living in Misamis Occidental, Philippines together with her family. More than a year ago,Maryjane was able to put up a retail business that absolutely met their needs. So far, the business is still doing well and is giving enough cash inflow. Every end of the month, Maryjane approximately receives an adequate amount from her  business operations.

Maryjane joined GDMPC this year to have an easy access to financial services.  She borrowed a loan from GDMPC in addition to her capital. The money taken is intended to buy additional grocery goods to sell. Maryjane expects an increase in sales so as to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Vema

texts.en:
Vema runs a general store to make a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying rice and corn grits. She wants to improve sales in order to receive more profit. 

She took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell in addition to her working capital.

Vema wants to prove that with this little amount she can provide for the needs of her children and be able to improve the living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Ruthjane

texts.en:
This is Ruthjane, 34, resident of Payatas, Philippines. Her husband is Domingo, a buy and sell vendor, and she is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Ruthjane operates an accessories retail business. What she basically does is buy accessory items from wholesalers and sell them per piece/pack at a profit. Products can range from beaded jewelries like necklaces to other products of that type. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her product inventory. 

Ruthjane hopes to have another branch and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities and varieties of accessory products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Vinancia

texts.en:
Vinancia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Vinancia requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items of ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

Vinancia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items of ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.en:
Rolanda is 50 years old and married, with one child.

Rolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rolanda has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 44 years old and married with four children. With three children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Alicia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 3,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Alicia is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 49 years old and married, and has five children. 

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy seedlings and other supplies for her vegetable garden.

In the future, Clarita would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and other supplies for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria is 48 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Asteria and her family survived super-typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Asteria is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 7,200 to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Asteria has been a Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) borrower since 2012.

With your help, Asteria can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super-typhoon Haiyan. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Cherry Grace

texts.en:
Cherry Grace is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business and farms vegetables in the Philippines. 

Cherry Grace requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming vegetables for five years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cherry Grace would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Filma

texts.en:
Filma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Filma is 44 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Her house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending business and is committed to regain what she lost. 

Filma is taking out an 8,500 PHP housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

She has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. 

In the future, Filma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 54 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Juana works very hard to provide for them.

Juana's business and family home was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Juana has taken a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Juana is committed to rebuild her devastated life and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa, cooking oil, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Jennybe

texts.en:
Jennybe works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super-typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and has been in Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) since 2012. She is now requesting a PHP 7,400 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Jennybe will be able to rebuild her devastated life more quickly. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, aged fifty-six years, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with fourteen children and seven attend school. 

He welds metals in order to earn income, alongside earning a monthly salary. He is faced with the difficulties of a low number of customers and low salary payment. He hopes to buy a car after retirement.

John is acquiring a loan to finish constructing his boys' quarters.

loans.use: to finish contructing his boys' quarters.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 39 years old, married, and has four children. Two of her children are in school.

Editha is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Editha has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a tabletop sewing machine

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: Carlos inicio su profesión hace aproximadamente 17 años, cuando un amigo lo llevo a su taller de él aprendió todo lo que necesitaba para hacerse cargo del negocio, tiempo después se hizo con el taller al cual le realizo unas modificaciones y lo amplio adecuando espacios para separar los procesos de producción, hablando concretamente de la profesión, Carlos es un cerrajero ya muy conocido debido a sus años de experiencia solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima básicamente acero y hierro para fabricar diferentes diseños y atender unos pedidos que tiene, Carlos considera que la tecnología está jugando un papel muy importante hoy en día y por esto quiere el crédito con el dinero obtenido de los negocios adecuara algunas mejoras tecnológicas para tener su negocio a la vanguardia buscando siempre mejorarse, seguir con el negocio y  mantener a su familia
texts.en: Carlos began his profession approximately 17 years ago, when a friend took him to his workshop. He learned everything he needed to take over the business. After he had the business, he made some modifications and expanded it, setting up spaces to separate the production processes specific to the profession. Carlos is a locksmith who is very well known because of his years of experience. He is asking for a loan to buy raw materials, basically steel and iron to make different designs and fill some orders that he has. Carlos considers technology to be playing a very important role nowadays and because of that, he wants the loan. With the money he obtains from the businesses, he will make some technological improvements so his business will be on the vanguard, always seeking to improve, continue with the business, and supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making doors, and windows and to fill some orders so he make more profit and do some technological improvements on the locale.

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es: Rubén es un humilde trabajador de 35 años de edad que como muchos colombianos no tuvieron fortuna de conseguir un empleo estable para subsistir junto con su familia. Rubén encontró en el reciclaje una manera de progresar de llevar un plato de comida, este trabajo él ha permitido soñar, pensar en un futuro prometedor y es por esto que solicita un crédito para la compra de material reciclable con el que forjara una idea de negocio de expansión y adquisición de terrenos, con este proyecto espera consolidarse en el mercado poder tener más contratos de servicios, encontrar una mujer con la cual pueda procrear hijos y perdurar en el tiempo.
texts.en: Rubén is a humble 35 year old worker who like many Colombians has not had the fortune to find a stable job to sustain his family. Rubén  has found in recycling a way of earning his bread. This work has allowed him to dream of a promising future. So he has requested a loan to buy recyclable material with which he will create the idea of a business of expansion and buying plots of land. With this project he hopes to consolidate himself in the market and be able to obtain more service contracts. He would also like to find a woman with whom he could have children and survive in time.

loans.use: to buy recyclable material to expand his business.

loans.name: Nelia Rocio

texts.es:
Nelía es una empresaria que ha dedicado 5 años de su vida en una miscelánea que principalmente distribuye productos de papelería con una innovación y es que es el único negocio en el municipio que ofrece un rico producto llamado Bonice el cual ha causado muy buena sensación en los habitantes, sus inicios los empezó con su hermana quien era la propietaria del negocio y dos años después se lo compro. Solicita un crédito para la compra  mercancía para cubrir un evento especial en el municipio y que tenga suficiente mercancía para abastecer a todas las personas que se le acerquen solicitando un producto.
Su gran sueño y anhelo es comprar una casa en la cual pueda tener una linda familia y sea participe de grandes acontecimientos que planea para su vida
texts.en:
Nelia is a businesswoman who has dedicated 5 years of her life to a general store that primarily distributes novel stationary products and is the only business in town that offers a tasty product called Bon Ice, which has caused a good feeling among the residents. In the beginning, she started with her sister who was the owner of the business, but two years later she bought it from her. 

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to cover a spacial event in town and to ensure that she has enough merchandise to supply all the people that approach her and ask for a product.  

Her ultimate dream and desire is to buy a house in which she can have a nice family that can participate in the great events that she plans for her life.

loans.use: to buy supplies like Bon Ice and decorative items to attend a great event in her town that is approaching.

loans.name: Cruz Mary

texts.es:
Cruz una orgullosa agricultora que refleja en su sonrisa la satisfacción y el placer que tiene al ejercer su profesión y es que gracias al cultivo de café son dueños de la finca y el terreno en el que actualmente tienen el café, trabaja junto a su esposo pues tiene cultivos distribuidos en varios sectores para tener cultivos todo el año. 
Cruz es una mujer muy preocupado por sus cultivos siempre quiere tenerlos en las mejores condiciones posibles por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes, la belleza de sus cultivos se ve reflejada en la foto su único sueño es ampliar más sus predios, seguir teniendo una familia unificada que trabajan por un mismo propósito y brindar un buen café a sus compradores
texts.en:
Cruz is a proud farmer who reflects in her smile the satisfaction and pleasure she gets from practicing her profession. Thanks to coffee cultivation they are owners of the estate and the land on which they currently have the coffee. She works alongside her husband and has crops distributed in various areas so she can cultivate year round. Cruz is a woman very worried about her crops and always wants to keep them in the best possible conditions.

For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizers. The beauty of her crops are reflected in the photo. Her only dream is to further expand her farm, continue having a unified family working for the same purpose and to provide good coffee to the buyers.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to ensure the beauty and care of her crops.

loans.name: Soronzonbold

texts.en:
Soronzonbold, 30 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. 

He has been working as a driver at a transportation company since 2006. His wife is unemployed and stays at home, looking after their daughter. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, planks, and fiberglass for house renovation. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then fewer pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Solongo

texts.en:
Mrs. Solongo, 37 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Kherlen, a town in easternmost Mongolia. 

She has been selling children's clothes to local people at the bazaar for five months. Before this business, she used to sell ice cream for a living. 

Her husband runs a taxi service, and their two elder children go to high school. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy children's clothes in a large amount for a children's holiday so that she can sell her goods without worrying about an inventory shortage.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Uranchimeg, 45 years old, lives with her daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been selling food stuffs at a street stall since 2003. Her son is a student and studies at an agricultural university. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy shingles, cement, and planks in order to complete her house. Her family is currently living in a small room designed for a public water closet. She has been planning to build her house since the time she moved to this room. If she can secure the loan, she can complete her dream house and live with her family in a comfortable place. Also, a high quality house enables the family to burn less coal for heating, thus releasing fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy shingles, cement, and planks.

loans.name: Johayna

texts.en:
Johayna is a 44-year-old married mother of two, one of whom is enrolled in a private school.  Her husband left her and their children alone in Lebanon while he went to seek a better income and to cover his family's increasing needs abroad. In an effort to help support their family, she started her own home business. Johayna prepares catered home-made food for special occasions and her special taste is highly appreciated by relatives and residents in the area. 

Jonayna is acquiring a new loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. The previous loans made a productive impact on her business and helped her cover most of her needs. Now she will be purchasing serving trays and equipment for desserts, which improves the quality of her buffet and generates more growth for her business. In the future she hopes to have enough savings to open a small restaurant where she can further explore her talents.

loans.use: To purchase serving trays and equipment for desserts

loans.name: Ariunzaya

texts.en:
Mrs. Ariunzaya, 27 years old, lives with her husband and son in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. She has been working as a manager at a heavy automobile training center for six months. Her husband operates a crane at a mining company. Her family lives in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. 

Recently Ariunzaya and her husband began to build their own house, which is almost finished. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy shingles, planks and vacuum-insulated windows to complete her house. Living in a house is much better than living in a ger in many ways, such as comfort and warmth. A high-quality house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating and thus release fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to buy shingles, planks and vacuum-insulated windows
